Les spéculations cultivées sont : la tomate et le jakatou avec  FATOUMATA  1ère à droite position debout de la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et les semences pour entretenir : 1,5 hectares. 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du village, du village de Fachoribougou et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 95.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter un espace cultural encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The six members of the BENKADI IV group are married women with an average age of 24 and 2 children. They live mostly in polygamous families in KOULOUWO, one of the villages in the municipality of KABOILA in the prefecture of SIKASSO, the third largest administrative region of Mali.

They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to develop their farming business during the rainy season.  They are on their fourth loan with the institution. Their prior loans have been fully repaid.  The crops are: tomatoes and jakatou (a vegetable that resembles a small green tomato but is actually a member of the eggplant family) by FATOUMATA the first person standing on the right of the photo.  With her loan, she plans to pay labor costs and buy inputs and agricultural seeds for maintaining 1.5 hectares. The output is sold at the village level, at the Fachoribougou village and at the SIKASSO market, after the harvest, to customers consisting of men and women.  She plans to earn an average profit of 95,500 FCFA per year. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenditures.  She wishes to maintain this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso to farm an even larger area to better earn more income.

loans.use: to pay labor costs and to buy inputs and agricultural seeds.

loans.name: Raypan Group

texts.en:
Mercedes is married with 3 children. She is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. Mercedes is a farmer and she raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to purchase feed for her hogs. 

Mercedes has been a member of Kiva's partner, PMPC, for 4 years. Mercedes is the leader of this 4-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member has their own business.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her hogs

location.town: Calamba - Bagacay, Sibutad, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Cruz Mercedes

texts.es:
Cruz Mercedes tiene 22 años, Es soltera vive con los padres, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo de un año.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. EL PROGRESO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocache, perteneciente al Cantón Mocache, esta ventanilla se dedica a laborea de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz

Cruz Mercedes se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y en pocas cantidades cacao . Compra sus productos en Comercial Peña y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes y para invertir en siembra de cacao.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafios como la falta de dinero para seguir invirtiendo. Su sueño es ayudar a la familia economicamente y terminar la carrera universitaria.

Le gusta hacer ejercicio, nadar y bailar.
texts.en:
Cruz Mercedes is 22 years old.  She is single and lives with her parents in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  She has a one year-old child.

The 'El Progreso' community bank is located in Aguas Frías de Mocache, in Mocache province.  The members of this bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Cruz Mercedes is a farmer who grows corn, rice and small quantities of cacao.  She buys her products in Comercial Peña and makes her sales in the wholesale market in Ventanas.

Cruz Mercedes is requesting this loan to grow corn and rice.  She will buy supplies and fertilizers, and will invest in her cacao crop.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her business such as a lack of money to invest.  Her dream is to help her family financially and to finish her university studies.

Cruz Mercedes enjoys exercising, swimming and dancing.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers and to invest in her cacao crops

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria tiene 43 años edad, tiene una hija y nació en la ciudad de Echarate (La Convención, Cusco). Actualmente, Victoria vive en la ciudad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. Victoria tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes  en su domicilio. Ya son seis años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. La socia trabaja desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche todos los días. En esta oportunidad Victoria requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, leche y otras cosas más. Su sueño de Victoria es abrir un mini market. 

La ciudad de Echarate es la ciudad capital del distrito de Echarate de la Provincia de La Convención e importante centro de comercio de las valles de Lares y La Convención, las actividades principales son la producción de coca, café, cacao y frutales.
texts.en:
Victoria is 43 years old and has a daughter. She was born in the city of Echarte (La Convención, Cusco). Victoria currently lives in the city where she was born and has developed her business activities. She has a small grocery store in her home. Victoria has already been in business for six years and has done very well. She works every day from 5am to 9pm. Victoria is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that she can buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, milk, and other items. Her dream is to open a mini-market.

The city of Echarate is the capital city of the District of Echarate in La Convención Province. It is an important center of commerce for the Lares and La Convención Valleys. The main business activities involve the production of coca leaves, coffee, cacao, and fruit.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, milk, and other items.

loans.name: Kimsanhon's Group

texts.en:
Kimsanhon, 67, is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Aravan, a small village in Osh region. Unfortunately, Kimsanhon is a widow. She lives with her son, who works as an electrician. Kimsanhon breeds livestock to earn an income. She has been doing this for a long time and has a great deal of experience. She earns about 4,000 KGS each month which helps her provide for her family’s daily needs.

Kimsanhon is requesting a loan to purchase more sheep. At the moment, she has three breeding sheep and would like to have more. She will also use part of her loan to finish construction on her house. In the future, Kimsanhon wants to increase the number of her livestock and improve her family’s living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru: Саодат проживает в районе Яван. Ей 45 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Ее муж находится на заработках заграницей. Сама Саодат зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа мелко - рогатого скота. Она хочет купить несколько козлят в дальнейшем для продажи.
texts.en: Saodat lives in the Yavan region. She is 45 years old, married and has four children. Her husband is now working abroad. Saodat makes a living herself by breeding large horned cattle. She has been in this business for ten years. She is taking out the loan to buy small horned cattle. She wants to buy a few goat kids for future resale.

loans.use: to buy small horned cattle

loans.name: Tsuma

texts.en:
Tsuma is a married man with two children, both of whom graduated from school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For ten years, he has operated a retail shop business. Specifically, he sells various goods to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of competition from other retail operators in the area. He dreams of expanding his business and establishing a wholesale business in the future.

With the 40,000 KES loan he is requesting, he would like to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice. He decided to join Yehu so that he could have greater access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional retail items (bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice).

loans.name: Hassoun

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 44 years old, married and has four children. 

Hassoun has been the owner of a food market since 2003, selling soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He decided to apply for a $2400 loan in order to buy a large showcase and a generator. He is aiming to earn more profit to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to buy a large showcase and a generator.

loans.name: Sapiya

texts.ru: Более  трех  лет Сапия занимается куплей и продажей детских вещей. Торговлей она занимается  в местном базаре. Сапия  во второй раз сотрудничает с  «Имон Интернешнл». Она благодарна «Имон Интернешнл»  за сотрудничество. Сапия замужем, её муж в России, чтобы зарабатывать денег, у них 4 детей. В настоящее время у Сапии нет торговой точки, где бы она могла реализоваться. В будущем она планирует продолжить сотрудничество с «Имон Интернешнл»  и открыть торговую точку, где разнообразив свой ассортимент могла вести успешный бизнес. Она хотела бы получит кредит в размере 5000 Сомони для покупки детской одежды.
texts.en: Sapiya has been involved in buying and selling children's clothing.  She sells at the local market.  This is Sapiya's second time working with "Imon International).  She is grateful to "Imon International" for the partnership.  Sapiya is married, her husband is in Russia in order to earn money, and they have four children.  Currently, Sapiya does not have a retail outlet, where she can sell her merchandise.  In the future, she plans to continue the partnership with "Imon International" and open a retail outlet, where, having expanded her merchandise selection, she could run a successful business.  She wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 5000 Somoni to buy children's clothing.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing

loans.name: Precila

texts.en:
Precila is a hardworking mother. She helps her husband do some activities in the farm. The couple had been raising crops for almost three years. They usually plants and harvest rice and future sell it to local traders in the village where they live. Her husband plows the field and sometimes pays for laborers who helped them in sowing seeds in the rice field. 

She is requesting a loan of P10,000 to buy seeds and pay for laborers who helped in transplanting rice seedlings.

In the future, she wants to achieve abundant harvest every harvest season to continuously finance the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for laborers who helped in transplanting rice seedlings

loans.name: Mchekwisha

texts.en:
Mchekwisha is a single woman and has one adult child. She operates a water kiosk and retail business. She's worked in this business for two years and her primary customers are neighbors and townspeople. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Mchekwisha's other sources of income include a pension and income from her child. She describes her greatest business challenge to be fluctuating supply prices and her largest monthly expense is food for her family.

Mchekwisha will use this 80,000 Kenya shilling (KES) loan to purchase inventory and other business supplies. Mchekwisha aspires to expand her business and purchase another water tank in the future. She joined Yehu because of their openness and loan processing times.

loans.use: To purchase inventory and other business supplies.

loans.name: Aulghr

texts.en: Aulghr is a hardworking businesswoman aged 43 years. She is married and blessed with two children. For the last five years, she has been running a tailoring business to bring up her family. She also sells cereals for more income generation. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. With 70,000 Kenya shillings, she wants to buy fabric for her business. Aulghr dreams of buying a piece of land in the future.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 25 years old and the mother of a three-year-old child.  She runs a boutique to earn a living.  She has been in the business for three years.  She also owns rental houses, which earn her extra income.
 
Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to run her business well because she has been trained in business management skills.  She hopes to expand her business into wholesale in the future.

She needs a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy shoes and clothes.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothes.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
La Sra. Mery, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Luz y Esperanza II”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia D. San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Es casada, D. 42 años D. edad, tiene 03 hijas D. las cuales sólo la última está a su cargo y ella viene cursando el nivel superior.
Empezó su negocio por iniciativa  propia vendiendo chicha D. maíz amarillo con S/.100  D. capital, después hizo chupetes  (helados D. hielo) y refrescos D. chicha morada y cebada en botellas para facilitar la venta D. estos productos, por el lugar donD. vive transitan muchas personas que por el intenso calor D. nuestra ciudad se convierten en sus clientes.  Con este negocio contribuyó para la educación D. sus hijas. Además en la actualidad viene realizando venta D. artículos D. perfumería por catálogo, actividad que realiza por las tardes para incrementar su economía.
Con este préstamo D. S/. 1500.00, comprará  productos para preparar su chicha (referesco D. maíz morado), sus refrescos, chupetes como maíz morado, cebada, maíz para chicha y aguaje, además para comprar los artículos D. perfumería.
Mery es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora,  su sueño es contar con un local para poder vender refrigerios y D. esta manera seguir creciendo con su negocio, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindar la oportunidad a mujeres como ella y así poder hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Señora Mery belongs to the communal bank, "Luz y Esperanza II" (Light and Hope II) in the district of Tarapoto, in the province of San Martín, in the department of San Martín.  She is married, is 42, and has 3 daughters, of whom only the youngest is still under her care and is studying in high school.

She started her business through her own initiative selling chicha D. maíz (a corn drink), with 100 PEN of capital.  Afterwards she started making chupetes (popsicles) and another typical corn drink maD. of purple corn (chicha morada) along with a barley drink in bottles to facilitate the sales of these products.  In the area where she lives, many people pass through, and because of the intense heat in our city, they become her customers.  With this business, she has been able to contribute to the education of her daughters.  She also sells perfume through a catalog, an activity she started doing in the afternoons to increase her income.

With this loan of 1500 PEN, she will buy products with which to make her chicha, other drinks, and popsicles such as purple corn, barley, another type of corn to make chicha, and a fruit called aguaje.  She will also buy perfumes.  Mery is a very hard-working and enterprising woman.  Her dream is to have her own location to be able to sell refreshments and to continue growing her business.  She is thankful to Manuela Ramos for giving the opportunity to women like her to be able to make their dreams a reality.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Maria Ramosa

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de jardin,ella es propietaria de su jardin donde trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 1:00 p.m,ella administra el jardin junto con su familia,la socia por medio de este trbajo saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el jardin.La socia solicita el credito para comprar materiales para el jardin como papeles,cartulinas,colores y plumones al por mayor.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria is still running her kindergarten. She owns it and works there with her family from 8:00 am to 1:00 pm. Through this business, she is getting her children ahead. She wants to expand and improve her kindergarten, so she is requesting this loan to buy school supplies such as papers, cards, coloured pencils, and pens, wholesale.
She is happy to have this loan and promises to pay off her quotas on time.

loans.use: to buy kindergarten supplies such as paper, cards, coloured pencils, and pens wholesale.

loans.name: Melvin Everardo

texts.es:
Melvin Everardo de 39 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Gualaco, ubicado en el departamento de Olancho. Desde hace 22 años que se dedica a la carpintería y aprendió del oficio gracias a su padre.  
El negocio de la carpintería en ciertas temporadas resulta ser muy rentable para Melvin ya que cuenta con buenos clientes y en esta temporada navideña le están solicitando algunos pedidos. Él solicita este préstamo para comprar madera y así contar con más materia prima para elaborar los muebles que ya tiene encargados por sus clientes. El mayor deseo de Melvin es el de aumentar sus ganancias y de esta forma mejorar la economía de su hogar y mejorar la instalación física de su taller de carpintería.
texts.en:
Melvin Everardo is 39 years old. He lives in the town of Gualaco, located in the department of Olancho. He has been working as a carpenter for 22 years and learned the trade from his father.

The business of carpentry in certain seasons is very profitable for Melvin and since he has good customers in this Christmas season they are placing orders.

He is asking for a loan in order to buy wood and thus to have more raw material for his business. Melvin’s greatest desire is to increase his earnings and thus improve the family savings and to improve the premises of his woodworking shop.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocio se sigue dedicando al negocio de artesania,ella vende carteras,portalapiceros,portapasaprtes y cosmetiqueras,ella misma realiza estos trabajos de artesania y los distribuye a las tiendas que venden atesania y tambien manda a paises como suiza,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar y tener un local donde pueda vender sus trabajos de artesanias.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cueros e hilos para que realize los trabajos de artesania.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rocio works as an artesian. She sells handbags, pencil holders, passport cases, and makeup bags.  She herself makes these crafts and distributes them to the stores that sell handicrafts. She also sends to countries such as Switzerland.  

By means of this business, she brings forward her children. Her dream is to expand and have a local where she can sell her handicrafts. 

She is requesting a loan to buy leather and thread for her handicrafts. 

She is happy with the loan and promises to comply with her payment.

loans.use: To buy leather and thread for her handicrafts.

loans.name: Dairo Alberto

texts.es: El señor Dairo Alberto se dedica desde hace dos años a prestar servicios de herrería en un pequeño local que arrendó. Gracias a esta actividad consigue el sustento diario y apoya económicamente a sus padres. Con el ánimo de mejorar sus ventas y cumplir con varios pedidos que tiene, el señor Dairo Alberto necesita de la compra de materia prima como hierro y acero que le permita cumplir con su objetivo. A sus 29 años, sueña con tener un local más grande en el cual pueda generar empleos directos.
texts.en: For 2 years, Señor Dairo Alberto has offered blacksmith services in a small shop that he rents.  Thanks to this business he can provide daily sustenance and economic support to his parents.  With a view to improving his sales and fulfilling several orders, Señor Dairo Alberto needs to purchase raw materials such as iron and steel that will permit him to meet his goals.  At age 29, he dreams he dreams of having a bigger shop in which he can generate direct employment.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as iron and steel.

loans.name: Prudencio

texts.es: Prudencio, de 44 años de edad, vive separado de su pareja, tiene 02 hijos Yuri de 22 años y Joel de 17 años; vive en su propia casa y se esmera por sacar adelante a sus hijos. La labor que realiza prudencio es labrar la tierra, donde cultiva plantas de cacao. Es conocedor del arduo trabajo que se realiza en el campo agrícola; donde viene trabajando 30 años en sus propias tierras, en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y jornaleros quienes se encargan de cosechar y  trasladar los productos recolectados hasta cierto tramo para luego ser transportados con vehículos menores. Se siente muy comprometido con su trabajo; porque gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta al ver que sus plantas le dn una buena producción. Cuenta que la estación de invierno no es de su agrado porque son meses donde abundan mayor cantidad de insectos y precipitaciones de lluvia, perjudicando sus campos florales. Con el crédito solicitado comprará  más semillas de piña para expandir sus sembríos. Este es el crédito numero 11 con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro préstamo con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal donde es muy estimado por el resto de los integrantes. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará productos químicos, abono para hacer el mantenimiento de sus cultivos.
texts.en: Prudencio, who is 44 years old, lives separate from his partner.  He has two children. Yuri is 22 years old, and Joel is 17 years old.  Prudencio lives in his own house and tries very hard to provide a better life for his children.  Prudencio works as a farmer, where he cultivates cocoa plants.  He works very hard on the farming field.  He has been working for 30 years on his own land.  During the planting season, he counts on the support of his children and day laborers who see to the planting and move the collected products to a certain place so that later in can be transported with small vehicles.  He feels very dedicated to his work.  Thanks to his daily effort, today he enjoys seeing his plants give him a good crop.  He says that he does not like the winter season because there is a large quantity of insects and rain during those months, damaging his floral fields.  With the loan that he is asking for, he will buy more pineapple seeds to expand his sown fields.  This is his 11th loan with MFP.  He knows that if he pays it on time, he will be able to obtain another loan with greater ease and will not bring complications to his communal bank where he is well-liked by the rest of the members.  With the 1,000 nuevos soles, he will buy chemical and fertilizer products to maintain his crops.

loans.use: to buy chemical and fertilizer products to maintain his plants.

loans.name: Doreces

texts.en:
Doreces lives in Buluk. She sells fish and has been in business for five years. She is 35 years old, is married, and has five children. All of her children are still in school.
Doreces heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Fouzia, aged 33, has been involved in a embroidered cloth selling business for about five years. She buys a variety of printed and embroidered clothing from the main city market, and then sells to the people of the local community. She has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. The winter season is going to be starting and she wants to buy clothes for the winter season.

Fouzia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy a stock of different clothes for the winter season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business. Fouzia thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a different clothes for the winter season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers.

loans.name: Josiah

texts.en:
Josiah is 47 years old green grocer at Kilifi Kenya. He is a father of seven who has sold coconut in Kilifi for the last six years earning greatly from his sales.

This marks his fourth borrowing to venture in a transport business, he will use the money to purchase a motorcycle for transporting people and goods and the anticipated profit to expand his grocery and educate his children. He hopes to have a happy family in future.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Jacqueline Rita

texts.en:
At the very earliest age, Jacqueline Rita A. got her business experience from her mother, a merchant. She learned about buying and selling even while going to school, and so she was able to start her own business selling kids clothing and traditional waist cloths right after dropping out. Her older sister was already working in this field and helped with her modest display of items for sale. Business is booming now, but according to customers, the range of choices she offers is limited.

Mrs. A. has a plan to diversify her range of goods and to include groceries too, which is a very promising growth opportunity for our locale. She is requesting a loan of $900 as capital for buying and selling clothing and food items.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Jacqueline Rita est une fille de revendeuse. Elle a donc appris dès son plus bas âge à faire le petit commerce même en allant à l’école. L’expérience acquise dans ce domaine lui a permis de se lancer dans le commerce d’habits d’enfants, de pagnes dès l’abandon de ses études. Sa grande sœur qui exerce déjà cette activité l’a aidé à avoir un petit étalage. L’activité se révèle florissante mais la gamme des produits n’est pas variée selon la demande de la clientèle.

Elle désire a travers ce projet, diversifier la gamme des produits et associer en même temps la commercialisation des produits alimentaires et congelés, activité très porteuse et fructueuse dans nos milieux. Elle sollicite un crédit de $900 qui va lui permettre de disposer d’un fonds de commerce pour l’achat et la revente des habits et des produits alimentaires.

loans.use: Buying and selling clothing and food items

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia began selling fruits and vegetables 30 years ago. She began as a street vendor, but when she became a widow and had four children to provide for, she got a place in the market to be able to increase her sales and her income. She has had to work very hard in order to get ahead because she wants to offer her children a better quality of life. Now she needs a loan of $475, which she will use to buy inventory to stock her business.

The challenges that life has given Emilia have not been easy, but she knows that with strength of family and your help, they can be overcome. You can be an important part of Emilia’s and her family’s achievements. Today is the time to help, you can do it.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 30 años Emilia se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, inició con la venta ambulante de estos producto, pero al quedar viuda con cuatro hijos que sostener, consiguió un local en el mercado para poder incrementar sus ventas y su ingreso, ha tenido que trabajar muy duro para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos porque quiere ofrecerles una mejor calidad vida. Ahora ella necesita de un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para surtir su negocio.

No han sido fáciles los retos que la vida le ha dado a Emilia, pero ella sabe que con la unión familiar y tu ayuda pueden ser superados, tú puedes ser parte importante de los logros de Emilia y su familia, hoy es momento de ayudar, tú puedes hacerlo.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Begum

texts.en:
A. Begum, 35 years of age (ID-1299-M), has been a member of Shugandha Mohila Somity since October 2003 and is married to Mr. Amzad Hossain. She has 2 children – one 10 and the other 8 years of age. Both children are in school. Her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the family expenses, so both of them decided to do a brick business. She purchases bricks at a comparatively low cost from the brick-field, which is far away, stocks them in their fallow land, and sells the them when the price is little higher.

The bricks have high demand in the area for construction work, since Gazipur is a newly declared district headquarters and it is a developing area. She is interested in doing a larger scale business to increase her income. She needs US $900 to expand her bricks business.

loans.use: Purchase of bricks

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 60 years old. She is married and has 8 children. 3 of her children are in secondary school. Susan loves making ornaments. She has visited many towns to sell her beadworks. Susan laments the poor prices offered by the middlemen for her ornaments. She believes that when the women are able to sell their beadworks direct to the users, they will have a big breakthrough. Though Susan never went to school, she is very enlightened and is able to study the market trends. She was instrumental in having the group members buy the steers and building the stock. Asked why it was so important for her and her group members to start this project, Susan had this to say…” The Government has revived the KENYA Meat Commission. This is not far from us. We need to take advantage of this market. Since we have enough grazing land, and the weather has been good, its important for us to do the much we can.” Susan has applied for a loan of USD 750. She too will repay the loan in lump sum after the 8 months grazing period.

loans.use: Susan would like to buy 6 Steers

loans.name: Vasco Alfredo

texts.pt:
Vasco Alfredo D. is 45 years old, he is married and father of 7 children. They live in the neighborhood of Urbanização in Maputo. He makes and sells bricks from his home, he also operates a small grocery store. He joined the program in 2006, his first loan was of 6.000MT which he repaid on time. He is now in the 3rd cycle of the program and is requesting 15.000MT to be repaid in 9 months.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga Kiva Volunteer.

Vasco Alfredo D. tem 45 anos de idade, é casado e pai de 7 filhos. Vive no bairro Urbanização em Maputo e tem um pequeno estaleiro na sua residência no qual produz e vende blocos e tem também uma mini-mercearia. Entrou para o programa em Junho de 2006 com um empréstimo inicial de 6.000MT. Comportou-se muito bem nos empréstimos anteriores em relação ao reembolso. Vai para o terceiro ciclo e vai tomar 15.000MT para pagar em 9 meses.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Larysa

texts.en:
Larysa is from Kharkov, Ukraine where she has a business selling bed coverings and towels. She loves these types of “homey” things and has developed what she enjoys into a good business. She currently has two sales locations with plans for a third and would eventually like to purchase a store facility. Larysa supports herself and two children with income from her business.

Larysa has requested a loan to help further her business expansion by purchasing new inventory and renting a third sales location. Larysa has benefited from several loans through Nadiya Ukraine and has built a good reputation. We are excited to see how her business will continue to grow and develop in the future.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo is an artisan in embroidery. He makes costumes for traditional dance in Bolivia. His wife is a retailer who sells meat, and both activities are their main source of revenue with which they maintain their two small school-age children. They live in the Villa de Dolores area of the city of La Paz.

A loan is needed to make the CHUTA costumes for Carnaval (Mardi-Gras) celebrations, so that he can increase the amount he makes, which is his capital investment. The CHUTA is one of the typical personalities of Carnaval in La Paz. Their outfit or disguise is very beautiful and highly sought-after by persons who participate in the parade that marks the beginning of Carnaval.

This is Pablo´s fourth credit with IMPRO. His prior record qualifies him to be approved for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

Pablo es artesano en bordados, confecciona disfraces de danzas tradicionales de Bolivia, la esposa es comerciante de carne y ambas actividades son su principal fuente de ingresos con los que cubren la manutención de dos pequeños hijos que están en edad escolar; vive en la Zona Villa de Dolores Ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito es requerido para confeccionar disfraces de CHUTA para las fiestas de carnavales, de esa forma incrementara la cantidad de prendas que es su capital de inversión. El CHUTA es uno de los muchos personajes típicos del Carnaval de la ciudad de La Paz y su vestimenta o disfraz es muy bonito y apetecido por los componentes de las comparsas que desfilan durante la entrada del Carnaval.

Es el cuarto crédito con IMPRO, los antecedentes anteriores le faculta para aprobarle la solicitud realizada por el prestatario.

loans.use: Purchase of materials to make CHUTA costumes.

loans.name: Muk Yemusumba A Group

texts.en:
Hayusha is 30 years old and married with two children. She sells new clothes. With the profits from her business she intends to buy a piece of land.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase fabric for her clothing business

loans.name: Lucas Evangelisto

texts.es:
Lucas M. in the father of three children, and together with his wife he fights to provide them with education, food and all other necessities. Lucas M. has a convenience store which since a young age he has been developing in his house in the village of Las Pilas, located in Chinandega in Nicaragua.

He started up his business during a difficult economic crisis: he tells us that it was very hard as he had no idea how he was going to provide for his children, so he decided to invest in the business.

With the experience that he has gained over time, the business has been strengthened and in this way he has been able to supply the necessities for his home. He has worked with Ceprodel for the last five years and he feels very satisfied with the authorised credits he has received as they have been provided when he most needs them in order to purchase products for his convenience store. His most pressing need is to purchase products for his hardware store.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Lucas M. es padre de tres hijos que junto con su esposa lucha por brindarles su educación, alimentación y todas las necesidades. El negocio del Lucas Mendez es padre de tres hijos que junto con su esposa lucha por brindarles su educación, alimentación y todas las necesidades. El negocio del señor M. es una pulpería que desde muy joven la ha venido desarrollando en su casa de habitación en el pueblo Las Pilas ubicado en Chinandega de Nicaragua.

El negocio lo comienza cuando atraviesa una fuerte crisis económica y nos dice que fue muy duro ya que no tenia idea de cómo iba a mantener a sus hijos por lo que decide invertir en este negocio.

Con la experiencia que fue tomando con el tiempo, el negocio lo fue fortaleciendo, y de esta manera ha podido suplir las necesidades del hogar. El trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 5 años y se siente muy satisfecho con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido brindados cuando mas lo necesita para la compra de todos los productos para su pulpería. Su mayor necesidad es la compra de los productos de su ferretería.

loans.use: Purchase of products for Convenience Store

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en: Mrs. Sorn S., 47, is a mother of 7 children and also owns a plot of farmland with her husband. They grow a variety of vegetables, earning $4 a day. Four of their children are married and live separately. Three others stay at home and help them on the farm. To grow more fruit and vegetables, they need a loan from Kiva to purchase a water pump and fertilizers to put on the crops. Moreover, this money will be used to buy rice to keep for the next year (rice to cook).

loans.use: To purchase a water pump and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy A. is a trader who sells pastries. She is single and has no children. She is focused on expanding her business but lacks enough capital.

She is asking for $125.00 as additional capital to buy more materials for production and sale.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more materials for production and sale

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris I. is 46 years old, married and has seven children. She hails from Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions, drinks and snacks. This was a business she learned from her mother. She has been a member of LAPO for 5 years. She hopes to serve her customers better so she is requesting for a loan of $875 to enable her to buy a grinding machine and a generator. She said that this will enable her to make a larger profit. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy a grinding machine and a generator

loans.name: America

texts.es:
Description AMERICA is one of the hardest working women in the area who with her great commercial capability works selling cheeses in neighboring villages. These delicious cheeses are obtained thanks to the cows that she raises, which she feeds adequately from early on so that they produce quality milk. While her animals go out to feed she produces her delicious cheeses so that she can later sell them. This activity is very difficult for her because she tries to help her oldest son to raise her granddaughter, who stays with her most of the day while her parents work on their plot of land. To this end, she wants to increase her production and has decided to acquire another calf.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

AMERICA, es una de las mujeres más trabajadoras de la zona quien por su alta capacidad comercial se dedica a la venta de quesos en los pueblos cercanos a su localidad.Estos deliciosos quesos los obtiene gracias a las vaquitas que cría y ordeña desde muy temprano además de alimentarlas adecuadamente para que produzcan leche de calidad y mientras sus animalitos salen a alimentarse ella elabora sus deliciosos quesos para después llevar a comercializarlos. Esta actividad es muy dura para ella porque trata de ayudar a su hijo mayor en la crianza de su nietecita con quien permanece gran parte del día mientras sus padres trabajan en sus terrenos de cultivos. Desea incrementar su producción y ha decidido adquirir una vaquita más para este fin.

loans.use: To purchase a calf.

loans.name: Dante

texts.es:
Dante and his wife have been selling food in the evenings for the past two years. They sell the food on the street near their house from 4:30pm to 10:00pm. But as Dante is a bricklayer, from Monday to Friday his wife is the one in charge of the business. He just works there on weekends. The loan he has asked for is to be used to buy cooking utensils and the awnings he needs for the street food business. Dante would like to have his own premises and open a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva volunteer.

Dante y su esposa venden comida todas las noches desde hace 2 años. Ellos salen a vender a la avenida cerca de su casa, desde las 4.30 de la tarde hasta las 10 de la noche. Pero Dante es albañil, por lo que de lunes a viernes su esposa es la que se encarga del negocio. Él lo hace los fines de semana. Los préstamos que ha pedido le han servido para comprar los utensilios de cocina y los toldos que necesita para armar su negocio de comida en la calle. A Dante le gustaría tener un local y poner un restaurante.

loans.use: To purchase cooking utensils and awnings so he can set up his street food business

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia A. is 45 years old and a mother of five children. All of the children are in school now. She has been selling grocery products for seven years in the market to support her family. 

She says business is doing well and, therefore, she wants to use the loan to buy more products to increase her inventory. She believes this loan would enable her to save toward her children education.
Afia is a member of the group called Halleluya Trust Group. Members in this group agree in unison to guarantee for each other to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products like canned fish and tomatoes, cocoa products, skimmed milk, body pomade, etc

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is 34 years old. She is married with 2 children aged 10 and 2 years old. She has been a food (soup and ugali) seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $215 from her sales.

Farida now hopes for a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Mrs. Morn Kungmonech's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Morn K. is the group leader of four loan members who live in Klaeng Poar Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Morn K. is 28 years old and the mother of two children who are both attending a local school. She is a laborer who earns a small income to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Pov Sam Arn, is a construction worker. Even though Mrs. Morn K. and her husband work in different businesses, they still cannot support their family sufficiently. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Morn K. is asking for a loan to buy four piglets to start a pig breeding business.

One among four in this group has end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. The members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy four piglets to start a pig breeding business.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: n           La Sta.  Graciela  vive en la compañía  Tayy Loma de Carapeguá tiene  35  años  y  es  madre soltera  de  dos niños  uno  de 6  y otro  de 3  años  y vive hace 6 años en pareja  con el  Sr.  Nelson. nntSe trata de una persona  muy emprendedora , teje frazadas y manteles artesanales y ella misma se encarga de venderlos a cuotas, su  zona  de trabajo es la  localidad  de Capitán Bado ciudad distante a unos 500 km. de su ciudad natal , su  colocación y recuperación  lo realiza  una vez al  mes . Su pareja se dedica a la construcción de  obras (albañilería) y juntos llevan adelante   su familia.nntSolicita el préstamo para la compra de  hilos de distintos colores para tejer variados diseños.nnnnnnnnnnn
texts.en:
Ms. Graciela lives in the Tayy Loma region of Carapeguà. She is a 35-year-old single mother of two children ages 6 and 3. Her domestic partner is Mr. Nelson. She is a very enterprising person who knits blankets and handmade table cloths. She sells them in installments. Her work area is the locality of Capitan Bado, a city that is 500 km away from her hometown. She distributes her merchandise and collects payments once a month. Her partner works in construction (bricklaying), and together they help their family move forward. She is reqesting a loan in order to purchase assorted colors of thread so that she can knit several different designs.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase knitting materials

loans.name: Khoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Khoeun K., 50, is a fisherman who depends on fishing in and around Tunle Sap Lake where he can catch around 20 kg per day. He is married to Mrs. Thon E, 49 years old, who makes a living selling fish that her husband catches.

Thon has seven children, three of whom are married; her two daughters are working in a garment factory in Phnom Penh City. As another source of income, Khoeun requests a loan of US$ 600 to purchase oxen to sell for a profit. The borrowers live in Kompong Tom Province.(Mr. Khoeun's wife is pictured, because he was not available.)

loans.use: to purchase oxen to re-sell

loans.name: Justa Mariluz

texts.es:
La señora Justa es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Unidas al Triunfo”, del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera y actualmente vive con su hermana y una sobrina. 

Con el primer préstamo que recibió de S/. 300 compró papas y cereales para vender en su puesto de trabajo. Tiene 3 años trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que hace 4 años adquirió un puesto por un traspaso de su madre.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará papas y cereales para vender en  fiestas de navidad.

Justa desea continuar trabajando para aumentar sus ganancias e independizarse.
texts.en:
Mrs. Justa is a member of the Women United in Triumph (Mujeres Unidas al Triunfo) Community Bank in the district, province, and department of Puno. She is 27 years old, is single, and, at present, lives with her sister and a niece.

With her first loan of 300 soles, she bought potatoes and cereals to sell in her stand. She has been working with the Community Bank for 3 years. She acquired the stand 4 years ago through a transfer from her mother.

With this loan of 1000 soles, which will be repaid in 4 installments, she will buy potatoes and cereals to sell during the Christmas festivities.

Justa wants to continue working to increase her earnings and independence.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy potatoes and cereals

loans.name: Nasreen Sallah-Ud-Din Group

texts.en:
"My name is Nasreen and I’m a 43-year-old married lady. I belong to a city which is famous for its hand-made items and shrines. I married a man whose name is S. and he is a driver by profession and has driven an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for the past 5 years. I have five kids: two sons and three daughters. My elder son has a catering service for events. My youngest son is a carpenter and makes furniture. My daughters are getting an education by the grace of God. I have a boutique in which I display my clothes collection. I have a good number of customers. I have got a good reputation because I sell clothes on time with a good workmanship. I am applying for a loan to buy material (colored thread, cloth) to complete the orders of my customers.

I’m a group leader of some more women of my locality. Zahida Parveen Baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her boutique. Bilquis Baji wants a loan to buy thread to resell. Nasreen Bano Baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes."

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for completing order

loans.name: Fatima Ejaz M.irfan Group

texts.en:
Fatima E. baji is a 46 year-old widow and has resided in a city named Multan, Pakistan for the past 35 years.  Fatima baji is a graduate passed lady. Her education supports her when she faced crucial circumstances after the death of her husband. Fatima baji became the only breadwinner of her family. She is the mother of four kids: three daughters and one son. Her elder daughter works in a government office. Fatima baji didn’t stop her children’s education even knowing that how difficult it is. She never loses hope; she started a boutique from the committee amount. She got good recognition gradually in the community. Now her elder daughter also helps her in making dresses for the boutique.  She has successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy material (cloth, colored thread) to make more dresses to display in boutique. 

She is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Zaitoon begum baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business. Zahida mai baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Syeda bano baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Yasmeen baji wants a loan to buy cotton to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for boutique

loans.name: Loy

texts.en:
Loy Y. is 46 years old and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She sells desserts to earn a living, and is able to make about $3 per day. Her husband earns $2 by running a moto-taxi. This couple has three children, two of whom are construction workers.

Mrs. Loy Y. would like to take out a loan to purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate a moto-taxi business.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Uaina

texts.en: Uaina T., 40, is married with 5 children.  She has 3 year(s) of experience in the Vegetable Garden business. She sells to the general public and villagers 3 days per week. She has no previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).  SPBD loans are Uaina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase vegestable seeds, cabbages, peas, corn, cucumber,green pepper, egg plant

loans.name: Parviz

texts.en:
Parviz M. is a 29-year-old merchant who has been selling different foodstuffs in his own store for the last ten years. Parviz is married and has two children. He enjoys his type of business because he is very social and likes to talk with customers.

Parviz would like to expand his business and purchase more goods to increase his income. For this purpose he applied for 2500 USD loan.

loans.use: purchase more goods for re-sale

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Of the 70% of Cambodian people who make a living as farmers, one of them is Mr. Sok T.. He is 53-years old and runs a farming business. In order to support his business, T. has decided to ask for a loan from Kiva to be used as capital to buy fertilizers and more seeds. T. and his wife have five children. Two of them are married and live independently and the others are single and help with the farming work.
Mr. T.'s wife is pictured.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Uk's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of three people. Its leader, Mrs. C., 45, makes a living selling Chinese noodles and porridge in the busy market. She generates an income of approximately US$ 6 each day and started her business back in 2004. Her husband, Savorn, 50 years old, is a staff member for an organization. The humble couple are responsible for two teenage children, both attending school.

C.'s business is running very well and she has gained much profit because she cooks tasty foods for her customers. To earn additional income, C. is looking for a loan to increase her business capital in order to meet her customer's demands.

The other two borrowers are:

B. T., who works as a local chef for wedding parties; she needs a loan as capital to buy wedding equipment so she can rent it out to gain additional income; and

H. who owns a small laundry and provides a clothes-washing service. She is applying for a loan to add to her savings to purchase a used car for her husband to use as a taxi.

The borrowers are people living in Battambang Province.

loans.use: To increase her business capital

loans.name: Etyline

texts.en:
Etyline A. is a 30 year-old mother with a seven year-old daughter in elementary school named Carla. She is married to Cipriano, a 32 year-old construction worker. She resides in Antipolo, the capital city of Rizal Province in the Philippines. Antipolo is a mountainous city yet progressive and with beautiful views.

In 2004, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and a KIVA partner in the Philippines. She was motivated to join the institution to uplift her standard of living through access to capital for her business. She and her husband are partners in a business selling chicken. They also have secondary business processing and frying some of the chickens for sale in the village. Now on her 9th loan, Etyline is requesting a loan for 20,000 pesos as additional capital for both businesses.

Etyline is optimistic that her businesses will grow as they have for years. She is dreaming of sending her child to school through college. She also dreams of having a durable and concrete house of her own.

loans.use: To buy chickens and ingredients for fried chicken.

loans.name: Gerrelyn

texts.en:
Farming is the primary source of income of Gerrelyn O.’s family. She is 35 years old and the mother of two children. Her parents own the land she and her husband are trying to farm.

Like most couples, they desire to see their children finish their schooling and this is their inspiration to do better in their small business. Thus, Gerrelyn is asking the Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) for a loan of Php 15,000.00 that will be used as additional capital. 

Joining CEVI has been a blessing for Gerrelyn. She takes home the morals that she acquires from their group meetings. She applies her learning in their family to strengthen their ties and create a harmonious atmosphere in their home.

loans.use: To buy farming necessities

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: The man shown in the picture above is Mr. Sim R., a married man of 45 years old. He has a big pigpen behind his house where he raises many pigs to earn a living. In this work, his wife also helps him in caring for their pigs. Besides raising pigs, the family has always been in the annual business of growing rice. The couple has been blessed with six children: four are single and two are married and live independently. Two of them are employed working in construction. Sim R. will be using the loan  to acquire a large number of pigs to raise.

loans.use: to acquire a large number of pig to raise

loans.name: Ren

texts.en:
Mrs. Ren K. lives in An Doung Samreth village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Tom Rorn, is a farmer who owns a piece of land where he cultivates rice. He is also a palm juice collector.

Mrs. Ren K. is asking for a loan to buy more piglets, fertilizer, and a pump to support the field. This couple has six children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another stays at home to do housework and the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is present in the picture with her.

loans.use: to buy more piglets, fertilizer, and pump  to water the field

loans.name: Keny Flor

texts.es:
La señora Keny  es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor de la Justicia”, ubicado en la cuidad de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 30 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 01 hijo.  Ella estudió educación superior completa (nutrición), vive en el Barrio Independencia.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 8 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para se negocio de compra y venta de golosinas.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional de S/. 400.00 nuevos soles, con este monto ella comprará quesos, yogur, carne, etc. Todo lo compra en Azangaro, solo atiende pedidos semanales.

Su deseo es ser vendedora mayorista de quesos y yogur.

A ella le gustan las facilidades en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Sra. Keny is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor de la Justicia” (Lord of Justice), which is located in the city of Puno, Puno Province, Department of Puno. She is 30 years old, in a common law marriage, and has one child. She holds a degree in nutrition and lives in the neighborhood of Independencia. Sra. Keny has been working with Manuela Ramos for 8 years. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to purchase candy for resale. She is now requesting another loan in the amount of 400 soles to buy cheese, yogurt, meat, etc. She purchases her products in Azangaro and places her orders once a week. Sra. Keny hopes to be become a cheese and yogurt wholesaler. She enjoys the simplicity of her loans.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cheese, yogurt, meat, etc.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazareth”, ubicado en el Centro poblado de López del distrito de Ilave, provincia de el Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y madre de 3 hijos, estudio educación secundaria completa, vive   el  Centro poblado de Jamachi Yancaro.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace mas de 3 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para comprar ganado menor.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, este monto será invertido en la compra de  ganado menor ovinos, La Sra. Julia  luego los vende en las ferias de la zona que son una ves por semana.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando, para poder educar a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Community Bank "Jesus de Nazareth", located in the Centro Poblado Lopez in the city of Ilave, in the province of Collao, Puno. She is 29 years old and she is married, and is mother of 3 children. She completed high school. She lives in Centro Poblado Jamachi in Yancaro. She is with the Manuela Ramos movement (Kiva Field Partner) for more than 3 years. Her first loan was in the amount of S/.300 nuevos soles and she used the funds as working capital to purchase livestock. She currently requires a loan in the amount of S/.2000 nuevos soles, funds will be invest in the purchase of pigs. Julia later resells them in the country fairs of the region that are held once every week. Her hope is to keep working so that she will be able to send her children to school. She enjoys savings and attending the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase livestock.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is a 27-year-old mother of two who owns a small retail shop in Mihango Nairobi. She has been in this business for the past three years, and previously operated a salon. Tabitha has requested a loan of Ksh. 50,000 in order to add to her stock of drinks, snacks, and other items. One day, Tabitha would like to be a wholesaler. On a personal level, Tabitha would like to educate her children and build her own home. 


About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add stock to her store

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is a 38 year old businessman who runs a water supply business in Kayaba part of Mukuru  slums. He also owns rental units in the same area. He has been selling water for a period of five years and previously owned a grocery. He is requesting a loan of Kes. 50,000 to buy a water tank and a water pump. A father of four, Elijah hopes to own rental units and on a personal level, he hopes to buy his family a home away from the slums. He describes himself as social and generous.


About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Buy water tank

loans.name: Robinah's Group

texts.en:
N. Robinah is a hardworking, determined and friendly lady with a retail shop business that she has been running for over 10 years, plus having a restaurant where she sells breakfast, lunch and supper. Robinah is the mother of 7 children (of which 5 are still in school) and she takes care of other siblings. She started with the retail shop and only opened the restaurant after making some savings with the help of a loan. She is seeking another loan with the hope that it will help her recapitalize her business and make more profit out of the increased stock. 
Robinah is the leader of her lending group in Nyanama.

loans.use: To restock her retail shop with more goods and buy foodstuffs for her restaurant

loans.name: Yudaya

texts.en: Yudaya is a 50-year-old widow with two children between 18 and 25 years old.  One of her children goes to school. She owns a one-room house where she is staying with two people. The family has access to electricity but no piped water. Yudaya takes care of additional family members. The family gets three meals a day.  She incurs additional transport costs to and from shopping in Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda. She sells to all categories of people but mainly to schoolchildren because she resides near the school. Yudaya owns a canteen in Kawala selling all types of snacks like samosas, biscuits, fried groundnuts, pancakes and popcorn. Yudaya works seven days a week. On average, she receives 50 customers a day. Her business premise is her residence. Yudaya has been in this business for eight years and with MCDT for four years, servicing her eighth loan. She has worked all along with the same group mates. Her monthly expenses include school fees for her child and feeding the family. Yudaya wants to use this loan to buy more boxes of biscuits, cooking oil and wheat flour for frying chapatti and samosas. She hopes to see her business grow bigger and to employ three people to assist her.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for her products

loans.name: Sela

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 27 year old Sela M. from Tukuyu. She is single and has 2 children between the ages of 5 and 8. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependent because his parents cannot care for him. Sela has been running a Duka business since 2000. She owns a small duka, or neighborhood shop, in the city where she sells common household and grocery items. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Sela currently earns about 150USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more shop items such as cartons of sugar, soap, salt and cooking oil in bulk.  In the future, she plans to increase the size of her business. Sela thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more shop items such as cartons of sugar, soap, salt and cooking oil in bulk.

loans.name: Nelly Atieno

texts.en:
Nelly Atieno O., 31, is married and has four children ranging from the age of 4 to 13.  She runs a retail shop and sells household goods to walk-ins and frequent customers. She has been in this business for 10 years in a semi-urban area called Ugunja. Her main business challenge is the price inflation of goods.  

She is using the proceeds of her 40,000 Kenyan shillings loan to increase inventory for the upcoming holiday season. In addition, she has a motorbike for hire and a video show, where she charges viewers. In the future, she wants to be a wholesaler. Nelly describes herself as hardworking and determined.

loans.use: To buy more goods to stock

loans.name: Arc-En-Ciel Plus Group

texts.en:
Godet K. is a leader of a community bank named “Arc-en-Ciel Plus,” “Rainbow” in English, which is composed of 26 microentrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Godet, 37, single, sells shoes. He has been in business since 1988. He has acquired solid experience and his business has prospered thanks to good management and accumulated profits. With the next loan, he intends to purchase 25 pairs of shoes to increase the inventory of his business. Currently, he earns a profit of about $20 every week. His dream is to open a general boutique in his area.

loans.use: To purchase 25 pairs of shoes to sell in order to reinforce the working capital.

loans.name: Min

texts.en: Min T. is 37 years old and the father of six children who are still living at home. Two of his children are employed as staff members for a fishery association, while the others attend school. To earn a living, Min T. and his wife have their own small business as fishermen. They use many tools to fish in and around the river and are able to generate $5 each day to feed their family. Min T. lives in a very old home along the river that needs repair and he would like a $300 loan for the repairs.

loans.use: To repair his existing house

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva T. is a 49-year old married woman who lives in the Barangay of Binicuil in Kabankalan City, located in the province of Negros Occidental. She earns her living by selling herbal products.

Eva’s husband Edgardo works as a juice retailer.  They have three children between the ages of 14 and 20.  One is already working while the other is still looking for job.  The youngest of her children is currently going to school and also helps his parents in the business as part of his daily chores.

Eva T. joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 to help her husband improve the quality of life  their family. With the help of such loans to start her business, she has been able to increase their family income. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 20,000.

Eva T. is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 11,500 was used to fund operations of her business and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 6th loan, the amount of Php 12,000, which she intends to use as additional working capital for her business.  Eva T. is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. During the visit for data and picture, all of her recent product stock had already been delivered to her buyers but delivery receipts were available for proof of business.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To provide additional working capital for herbal products business.

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
Aurea T. is from the village of Banquero. She is 39 years old. Aurea is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Aurea owns and operates a business, planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables to sell. Aurea has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $38 a month from these activities.

In 2010, Aurea joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Aurea is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in her business. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Fe Group

texts.en:
The Fe Groups is a new group to ADIM, consisting of three woman entrepreneurs and workers; the coordinator is the young Gessell C. J. who, like many Nicaragüenses, works in the Zona Franca for minimal earnings and sees the necessity of credit. Gessel will use the loan to sell Avon cosmetics which will help at home so she can support her two children, one only two months old, the other three years old.

Amparo Pinedad also works in the Zona Franca. She will use the loan to help with costs associated with starting her business where she sells clothing, jewelry, accessories, and lingerie. The third member of the group, Andrea Isabel Q., has a very popular restaurant where she makes fried food, soups, vigoron and baho (both typical Nicaraguan dishes).

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthorn C. (pictured here), 50, and her husband, Mr. Ny Chhum, 57, have been married since 1979 and have eight children: four sons and four daughters. One of the children is married and lives outside the family home, two are garment factory workers, four attend school and one is still young. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number Five about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Chanthorn and her husband are rice farmers. Besides farming, Chanthorn also sells porridge in front of her house and her husband is a wooden house builder. 

Chanthorn is requesting her first loan in the amount of US$1,000. She will use $400 to purchase a water pumping machine and $600 of the loan to buy a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a water pumping machine and a motorcycle.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 28-year-old married woman with one child. She lives in a house of five people. She and her husband contribute to the welfare of the family. Her family currently resides in a rented house with the hope of finishing their own house by next year. 

Alice operates a salon in Hoima, Uganda. Before she had her salon business, Alice worked at her auntie’s salon, and then worked with a tobacco company, after which she started her own salon by using the savings she had and credit from Hofokam. She dreams of adding bridal services and a clothing section to her saloon. 

The purpose of the loan is to purchase braids, weaves, mirrors and a phone for her salon.

loans.use: To buy braids, weaves, mirrors and a phone for her salon.

loans.name: Kokadiyereye Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Kokadiyèrèyé, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 36 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Gonido sous préfecture de Fana, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce de condiments alimentaires et  de céréales tels Rokia D..
Ces femmes du groupe Kokadiyèrèyé sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire à l’instar de Rokia D. qui compte utiliser le sien pour acheter  des sacs de céréales.
Elle s’approvisionne le plus généralement à Fana et environs. Elle effectue sa vente sur place, au marché de Tingolé et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Rokia compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Kokadiyèrèyé group are all married and are, on average, 36 years old, have five children and live in traditional extended families in Gonido, in the Fana prefecture, in the region of Koulikoro (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know each other through family ties and are engaged in the sale of food condiments and cereals, as does Rokia D.. These women of the Kokadiyèrèyé group are on their fourth joint loan following the example of Rokia D., who plans to use her loan to buy sacks of cereals. She generally gets her supplies in and around Fana. She makes her sales from home, at the market in Tingolé, and at neighboring markets, at retail, in cash and on credit, to a clientele of men and women. Rokia plans to clear a monthly profit of 20.000 FCFA which will be used for the family’s daily expenses, and the rest will be reinvested in her business.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cereals

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina G. is from the village of Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 47 years old. Marina is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Marina owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Marina has been engaged in her business for still less than a year and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Marina is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Marina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Paz Y Progreso Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Karla, se constituye en la presidenta del Banco D. Emprendimiento, la señora tiene 34 años y vive en la calle Nataniel Aguirre y tiene como actividad un taller D. bordados, el mismo que se encuentra ubicado en el mismo domicilio.Se encuentra casada con don Mario  que tiene como actividad artesano en bordados con el que tiene dos hijos, los cuales todavia dependen D. ellos. La tienda D. bordados se encuentra ubicado en un lugar estrategíco, es una zona D. Artesanos D. trajes típicos. El negocio lo atienden todos los dias, abren a partir D. 9:00 a 20:00; El crédito solicitado es para la compra D. telas e hilos para la confección D. trajes para la fiesta del Gran Poder.

Doña Gregoria  se constituye en la tesorera del Banco D. emprendimientro, la señora tiene 57 años y vive en la zona D. Villa Nuevo Potosí  y es viuda, sus hijos ya son mayores y por tanto tienen independencia económica, la señora vive sola y tiene como actividad la venta D. flores frente al cementerio en la zona El Tejar, el puesto es fijo y propio el mismo lo tiene 25 años. Doña Gregoria sale a su puesto todos los dias desD. las 4:00 hasta las 22:00 horas. El crédito solicitado es para la compra D. floreros para sus arreglos florales.

Doña Jenny  se constituye en la secretaria del Banco D. Emprendimiento, la señora tiene 28 años, se encuentra casada con don Juan que tiene como actividad junto a la esposa la venta y arreglo D. flores con quien tiene 3 hijos y viven en la zona D. pasankeri. El negocio D. las flores se encuentra ubicado en la zona del Tejar frente al cementerio general, el puesto es fijo y propio con una antiguedad D. 7 años, donD. salen todos los dias a partir D. las 9:00 hasta las 18:00 horas; El crédito  que solicitas esta dirigido para la compra D. vitrinas y floreros para el negocio.
texts.en:
