Karla is the president of the communal bank. She is 34, and she lives on Nataniel Aguirre Street. She has an embroidery workshop, which is located in her house. She is married to Mario, who is an embroidery craftsman. They have two children, who are still economically dependent upon them. The embroidery store is in a strategic location in the area of the craftsmen who make typical outfits. She works in the business everyday. They open at 9 a.m. until 8 p.m. The requested loan is to buy fabric and thread to make outfits for the “Fiesta del Gran Poder” (a dramatic religious fiesta). Gregoria is the treasurer of the communal bank. She is 57, and she lives in the Villa Nuevo Potosí area. She is a widow. Her children are grown and economically independent. She lives alone, and she has a business selling flowers. She sells in front of the cemetery in the El Tejar area. Her stand is fixed, and it is her own. She has had it for 25 years. She works in her stand everyday from 4:00 p.m. until 10:00 p.m. The requested loan is to buy flowers for her floral arrangements. Jenny is the secretary of the communal bank. She is 28, and she is married to Juan. She and her husband sell and arrange flowers. They have three children, and they live in the Pasankeri area. Their floral business is located in the Tejar area in front of the general cemetery. The stand is fixed, and it is their own. They have had the stand for seven years. They work everyday from 9:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. The requested loan is to buy display cases and flower pots for the business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric and thread

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 38-year-old married man with three children.  He has been doing welding for four years.  He also does farming to earn extra income for supporting his family.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya in a group called Nuru Investment, he has become very positive about business.  Therefore he puts a lot of effort into his business.  Being a member of the group, he has been guaranteed a loan of Kes. 20,000 by the members.  With the loan, he plans to buy scrap metal, files and flax.  He hopes to expand his business and open more businesses in the future.

loans.use: To buy scrap metal, files and flax

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
“Rise up to the occasion” – he truly has been a testament to that. This is the simple business story of 41-year-old M. Fred, an enterprising produce-sales businessman operating in Nyamadane in Bushenyi.

Fred is a happily married man with ten children. As proof of the fact that he has what it takes to take care of all of them, he says he has seen all of them through school, the last born having recently finished his “A-levels” (high school advanced-level exams). Calling into question why he has such a big number of children is something which is frowned upon, especially in a rural setting where people believe in having many children, notwithstanding their financial status.

It’s a modest six-year-old business, but it has enabled Fred to make ends meet to a certain degree on weekly profits of 60,000 shillings. Barring the achievements he has registered, he is still behind schedule in many of his other set objectives. It’s for this reason that he wants this loan. He figures he will be able to purchase in bulk more crops like maize, beans, groundnuts (peanuts) and peas that he hopes to resell.

loans.use: To purchase in bulk crops like maize, beans, groundnuts, etc.

loans.name: Nurlan

texts.en:
K. Nurlan Manapovich was born in Orlovka village (Kemin region) where he still lives at the moment. He’s 37 years old. After graduating from school he went into the army. After this, he married Kanaeva Raihan, with whom he has four children: three daughters of school age and a little son who is only one and a half years old. Nurlan works as a security guard in the Altynken goldmine. Nurlan’s spouse is a housewife.

Since Nurlan is the only breadwinner in a large family, being a hard-working, responsible and enterprising man, he decided to open up a small shop in his garage three years ago. The garage was refurbished into a shop within one week. With a part of his salary of 3,000 Kyrgyz Soms, Nurlan bought groceries. The range of products in his corner shop was not sufficient, and after thinking for a while and considering all the risks, Nurlan got his first loan from Bai Tushum & Partners. Thus, he could widen the range of products and his shop, which he runs with his wife and older children (in their spare time), allows them to earn some extra money. The shop is open 24/7 and Nurlan has his permanent customers, to whom he gives some discounts and, in case of need, lends goods.

About one month ago, Nurlan’s shop was robbed. More than half of the goods (with a value of 50,000 Kyrgyz Soms) and the sale proceeds of a whole day were stolen. It was a big loss for Nurlan, but he quickly gathered his courage again. In view of the importance of the additional revenue from the shop for his family, Nurlan wants to obtain a loan of 40,000 Kyrgyz Soms to restock his shop with products.

The most important thing for Nurlan is his family; he wants to provide his children with a good education. This in turn will allow them help advance their country and their people.

loans.use: to purchase groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fertilizers to protect her land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Nhim

texts.en: Nhim P. is 33 years old and lives with five of her children in the Kampong Cham province. She and her husband are farmers and she also weaves baskets to sell at the market, while her husband sells palm sugar. The couple is able to make about US$5 each day. Nhim P. is asking for a loan of US$1000 to expand her farmland and also buy fertilizer.

loans.use: To expand her farmland and buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella O. is from the village of Igpit, Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 51 years old and is married. Estrella owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling bananas in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Estrella joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional bananas to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Estrella plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam R. is a 49-year-old farmer in her village in Kampong Tom Province. She earns an average of $2.50 per day. Her husband, Mr. Say Poch, is 56 years old and also works on the farm field with her. Sam R. has four children, two of whom work in the construction sector, while one is a tailor and another one is already married and lives separately. 

Sam R. faces difficulty traveling to the workplace or anywhere else, because she doesn’t have a vehicle. Because of this problem, Sam R. needs to take a loan to be used to buy a second-hand motorcycle to make family transportation easier.

loans.use: To buy a second-hand motorcycle to make family transportation easier

loans.name: Mickmass

texts.en:
Mickmass O. is 27 years old and lives in the town of Nebbi in the West Nile region of Uganda. He is single and has no children. Mickmass has a business selling second-hand clothes which he has operated for six years.         

To help expand his business, Mickmass has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more stock. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Mickmass hopes to generate greater profits and to take care of himself. In the future, Mickmass hopes to open other branches in different districts.

loans.use: To purchase more stock.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
el sr. Daniel G. B. tiene 40 años de edad, es padre de 3 hijos los cuales los tiene estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad y vive en el Barrio los Graneros de la ciudad de Choluteca.
Daniel se dedica a la venta de pan blanco desde hace varios años, tiene la ayuda de sus hijos para cargar el pan.
su esposa se dedica a la crianza de gallinas.
Daniel y su familia en sus tiempos libres se dedican a visitar a iglesia.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas pan, ya que sus clientes le compran mas y no logra terminar el recorrido de todos los clientes porque se queda sin producto.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Señor Daniel G. B. is 40 years of age.  He is the father of 3 children, who study in the school in their community.  They live in the Graneros neighborhood of the city of  Choluteca.

Daniel has been dedicated to the sale of white bread for several years.  He has the help of his children to carry the bread. 
His wife is dedicated to the raising of chickens.  

In their free time, Daniel and his family are dedicated to going to church.  The loan will be used to buy more bread, since his clients buy more than he has and he fails to finish the route to all the clients because he runs out of product.  He needs the profits to cover with the expenses of the home.

loans.use: To buy white bread

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
Felipe D. Jesus A. H., soltero, 29 años D. edad, nacido en Cerro D. Pasco y D. profesion carpintero.
Felipe D. Jesus trabaja en compañia D. su señora madre desD. hace hace 15 años. El arte D. la carpinteria viene D. generacion en generacion y èl lo aprendio D. su padre a tenprana edad.
Actualmente gracias a esta actividad, Felipe D. Jesus ayuda a sus hermanos menores, quienes se encuentran en edad escolar.
En su pequeño, pero humilD. taller, trabaja con 2 colaboradores, quienes reciben un incentivo por el trabajo que realizan al destajo.
El prestamo que se le otorga, lo invertira en la compra D. maderas para la elaboracion D. sus muebles, puertas y demas trabajos que tiene pendiente D. entrega.
texts.en:
Felipe D. Jesus A. H. is 29 years old, single, and was born in Cerro D. Pasco. He is a carpenter by profession.

Felipe D. Jesus has worked with his mother for 15 years. The art of carpentry has been passed down from generation to generation. He learned the traD. from his father at an early age. Thanks to this business, Felipe D. Jesus is able to support his younger siblings who are in school.

In his small humble workshop, Felipe D. Jesus works with two assistants who receive a commission for each piece they complete. The loan that is being granted will be invested in the purchase of wood for making furniture, doors, and other jobs that are pending delivery.

loans.use: Purchase wood

loans.name: Luciano

texts.es: El Sr. Luciano N. es un hombre muy trabajador el es empleado de una maquiladora de la localidad, tiene un pequeño el cual siempre ah  querido darle lo mejor y esta al pendiente de su seguridad y la de su esposa solicita el credito para la colacacion de protecciones en sus ventanas, su casa se la acaban de entregar y quiere empezar a ponerla bonita y comoda para su familia y sobre todo segura para beneficio de la misma.
texts.en: Luciano N. is a very hard-working man. He is an employee of a factory in his town. He has a little son, for whom he has always wanted to provide as best he can. He is concerned about the security of his child and his wife. He is requesting the loan to install protection on his windows. His house was recently completed, and he would like to start making it attractive and comfortable, and above all safe, for the benefit of his family.

loans.use: Installing protection on his windows

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius O. is a twenty-nine-year-old hardworking man in Kisumu City located in the western part of Kenya. He is married to Nereah, and they have two children, Triza, aged six years and Jacktone, aged two years.

Julius operates a secondhand clothing business at Kondele, a major shopping center that is two kilometers from the heart of Kisumu. He has been in business for the last eight years, and his monthly income is 10,000 KES.

Julius is taking out his first loan from Kadet Ltd, which he will use to buy new clothing to stock for sale to meet the demands of his customers during the Christmas season. He hopes to generate more income, expand his business and improve living standards for his family.

loans.use: To buy new clothing to sell

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Jenny; ella tiene 38 años de edad, soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia tiene su negocio de comida rápida que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Limatambo el cual lo administra su hermana, la socia a la vez trabaja en una agencia de turismo como secretaria, la socia es una persona muy emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

 La socia solicita el préstamo para la implementación de su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
This member belongs to the San Rafael communal bank.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

This borrower is Ms. Jenny.  She is 38 years old, single, and has one son.  She owns a fast food business located in the province of Limatambo, which her sister runs.  At the same time, Jenny works as a secretary at a travel agency.  She is a very enterprising person with a great desire to get ahead.

This borrower is requesting a loan for the implementation of her business.  She is happy to receive this loan and promises to comply with the repayment terms.

loans.use: for implementing her business

loans.name: Las Manzanas De Peña Group

texts.es: Este grupo decidió ponerse el nombre de Las Manzanas de Peña ya que dicen ser tan dulces como una manzana, la comunidad donde viven se llama Monte de Peña y de ahi el nombre de Las Manzanas de Peña.  La señora Susana Macedonia es la Tesorera del grupo,ella tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y desde hace 5 años hace tortillas hechas a mano las cuales lleva a vender a otras comunidades;solicita crédito para ampliar su negocio,comprar algunas prensas,dos comales grandes, y contratar a una persona que le ayude ya que ella sola no alcanza a hacer todos los pedidos que se le requieren; con esto su negocio crecerá y las ganancias obtenidas serán mayores, más adelante piensa hacer mejoras en su vivienda.
texts.en:
This group decided to call themselves Las Manzanas de Peña (The Apples of Peña) because it's said they are as sweet as apples and because the community they live in is called Monte de Peña.  From there they got the name Las Manzanas de Peña.

Susana Macedonia is the group Treasurer.  She is 45 years old, is married and for five years has made handmade tortillas, which she takes to other communities to sell.  She is asking for a loan to expand her business by buying some tortilla presses, two large comals (griddles for cooking tortillas) and hiring someone to help her because she cannot fill all her orders alone.  With this loan her business will grow, and she will earn more money.  For the future Susana is thinking of making improvements to her house.

loans.use: Tortilla presses and 2 comals (griddles)

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua Y. is single. She sells kenkey and utensils at Abura.  Ekua has received junior high education.  The sales she makes is used to pay for her accommodation and utility bills.  Her loan will be used to buy more utensils to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more utensils to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 61-year-old married man living with his wife and one child. He is from Lebanon. He has 35 years of previous experience in the agriculture business. He is specialized in selling all types of vegetables on a freelance basis. He has obtained four Kiva loans and he has been an excellent client with prompt payments. Despite his old age, he works hard to satisfy his family's needs.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to improve his business by performing the needed maintenance on his shuttle so he can pass by all the regions in his town and its surroundings without facing any vehicle problems.

loans.use: To perform maintenance on his shuttle

loans.name: Kasem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 47 years old, married and has four children. In 2009, Kasem decided to start his own business and he opened an electrical supplies shop in an area where the competition is minimal. He is well known and has a good reputation.

Kasem is requesting a $3000 loan to extend the shop and for advertising. He is planning to expand and open another branch.

loans.use: To extend the shop and for advertising

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 35 years old, married and with two children.  He does hair dressing to earn his daily bread.  He also runs a retail shop to supplement his income.   He has been engaged in the business for eleven years.  He runs the business with four employees.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, his living standard has improved because his business has improved.  He has also learned how to manage his finances by saving his money.  He has requested a loan of 80,000 KES to buy hair braids, hair oil and cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy hair braids, hair oil and cosmetics.

loans.name: Luz Ayda

texts.es:
Luz tiene 20 años de edad y es soltera. Vive en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz en Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. Su comunidad es pequeña y es en vías de crecimiento. Actualmente solo cuenta con servicios de luz; están en el proceso de instalar servicios de agua.

Desde hace más de 2 años, cuenta con una bodega donde ofrece en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. Su bodega está ubicada en el Mercado Carolina el cual es muy concurrido por el público de la comunidad. Por ello, su negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida y tiene una clientela fiel. Luz ha solicitado un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles para invertir en la compra de más mercadería para su bodega, específicamente arroz y azúcar. Luz espera incrementar sus ingresos para poder aumentar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Luz is 20 years old and single. She lives in the district of José Leonardo Ortiz in Chiclayo, which is the capital of the Lambayeque region. Her community is small and is growing. Currently she only has light services; they are in the process of installing water services. 

For more than 2 years, she has had a store where she offers a sale to her neighbors and customers in the area on a variety of everyday consumer products including staple items and groceries. Her shop is located in the Carolina Market, which is very popular with the public community. Therefore, her business is very well received and she has loyal customers. Luz has requested a loan of 1000 soles to invest in the purchase of more merchandise for her store, specifically rice and sugar. Luz hopes to increase revenue to raise her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more rice and sugar for her store.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina, de 26 años de edad, convive con Daniel de 38 años y tienen 03 hijos. Cuentan con casa propia en el distrito de Santa Rosa. Aún era muy niña, y ya sabia las técnicas de cultivo  y  el cuidado respectivo de sus plantaciones de cacao, en ese entonces, pero no todo fue felicidad para ella y para su familia debido a que pasaron momentos de estragos con su producto agrícola, aparte de que no había compradores en su comunidad, por los constantes derrumbes por su zona, así que todo lo invertido en su producto fue una perdida total. Luego de 2 años estuvo dedicado a pagar algunas deudas que tenía con sus proveedores y sus trabajadores, tiempo después recuperó su confianza y siguió apostando de manera agresiva en la agricultura, pero esta vez implantando un nuevo producto de café,  desde luego sus ventas aumentaron con respecto a otros años y ahora tiene compromisos con sus clientes. Por lo general trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo, pero en tiempo de cosecha necesita de sus peones para que agilicen la extracción de sus productos. Normalmente sus productos agrícolas lo venden en los centros de acopio de su comunidad. El crédito solicitado es para la compra de plantas de cacao para luego injertarlos, sus planes a futuro es comprar nuevos terrenos y sembrar frutas cítricas. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus cronogramas de pagos, además se siente augusto por trabajar al lado de sus compañeros de su banco comunal. Con los 2,00 nuevos soles solicitados comprará plantas de cacao para luego injertarlos y sacar buen provecho en corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Marina is 26 years old.  She lives with her partner, 38 year-old Daniel, and they have three children.  They own their own home in Santa Rosa district.

Marina learned farming techniques and how to care for cacao plantations when she was still very young.  However, things didn't all go well for her and her family.  They suffered some damage to their crops, there weren't any buyers in their community and there were constant landslides in their area.  As a result, everything they invested in their crops was a complete loss.  For two years, Marina was paying off debts that she had with her suppliers and her workers.  However, she recovered her confidence and continued committing herself aggressively to her farming.  This time she sowed a new coffee product.  Since then her sales have increased compared to other years and now she has agreements with her customers.

In general, Marina works alongside her husband.  However, at harvest time she needs to hire laborers in order to make her harvesting go more smoothly.  She normally sells her crops to the food warehouses in her community.  Marina will use the loan she has requested to buy cacao plants which she will later graft.  Her future plans are to buy more land and to start growing citrus fruits.

This is Marina's eighth loan from MFP and she pledges to continue making her repayments on time.  She feels privileged to be working alongside the fellow members of her community bank.  Marina will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy cacao plants which she will then graft and benefit from very shortly.

loans.use: to buy cacao plants

loans.name: Annette

texts.en:
Annette is 34 years old and married to Chrispine. She has 6 children. She operates a hotel in the Kangemi area. She has been in this business for a period of 6 years. 

With this loan, she plans to buy cooking oil, flour, rice, and other food stuffs. This is her first loan from KADET LTD and she is hopeful that it will boost her business. 

Annette desires to give her children a better education and a good life to the family.

loans.use: to buy food items for her hotel

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes qui composent le groupe DANAYA sont toutes des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs, co-épouses, enfants et époux. Elles résident au quartier Dougounina qui relève de la ville de BOUGOUNI, troisième région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles se sont connues à travers  des relations de parenté. Face aux difficultés d’acheter correctement les produits, dues au manque de ressources financières, elles ont décidé d’adhérer au programme crédit  de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe dont les quatre prêts précédents ont été bien soldés.
Avec ce prêt la présidente du groupe, Mariam D. compte acheter, 200 kg de noix de néré pour faire du « Sounbala » très apprécié dans la sauce africaine, 300kg de feuilles de baobab séchée et 150kg de dah. Tous ces condiments seront achetés à BOUGOUNI et ses environs, pour les revendre ensuite au comptant et en détail sur le marché de BOUGOUNI, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. Avec ce prêt les femmes envisagent obtenir un bénéfice mensuel de 15 000 FCFA par mois dont une partie sera utilisé pour solder le prêt et l’autre partie sera utilisé dans les frais de santé de leurs enfants.
texts.en: The women who make up the group Danaya are all married women who are 38 years old on average, have five children and all live in large traditional conjugal families with their brothers, sisters, co-spouses, children and spouses.  They live in the neighborhood of Dougounina, which is under the jurisdiction of the city of Bougouni, the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.  They know one another through parental relations.  Faced with difficulties in properly buying products due to a lack of financial resources, they decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso's loan program.  They are on their fifth group loan, having settled the balance of their previous four loans.  With this loan, the president of the group, Mariam D., expects to buy 200 kg of African locust tree nuts to make "Sounbala," which is very valued in African sauce, as well as 300 kg of dried baobab leaves and 150 kg of bissap.  All the spices will be bought in Bougoni and its surrounding areas, to then be resold together for cash and in bulk at the market of Bougoni to a customer base composed largely of women.  With this loan the women plan to make a monthly profit of 15,000 FCFA per month, of which a part will be used to repay their loan and the rest used to pay for their children's health costs.

loans.use: to purchase spices.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: Marisol tiene 36 años, es soltera y vive sola en una casa alquilada. Vende productos de belleza desde hace 7 años, su forman de venta lo hace por medio de pedidos que le solicitan sus clientes que eligen el productos en los catálogos que Marisol muestra. Cada cierto tiempo cuando le llegan los productos son distribuidos de acuerdo al pedido que le han hecho; asimismo cuenta ella con un mostrador donde exhibe diversos productos en stock, así el clientes tiene más opción de elegir y ella tiene más ventajas para ganar. Por tal razón necesita de un capital para que pueda comprar productos de manera anticipada y cuando están en oferta para luego revenderlos a un precio mayor, de esa manera se asegura más ingresos. Es su crédito número 4 que tiene con MFP,  considera que tener un crédito grupal fue una de las mejores decisiones que ha tomado para el progreso de su negocio de las cuales se siente muy agradecida y nuevamente comienza esta etapa de trabajo solidario con su banco comunal y pone su palabra de que seguirá siendo puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza en la siguiente campaña de ofertas.
texts.en: Marisol is 36 years old, single, and she lives in alone in a house she rents. She has been selling beauty products for the past 7 years. Her sales method is to take orders from her clients that choose products from catalogues that Marisol displays. When the products arrive she distributes to the clients who requested them. She has a display case where she displays the various products in stock that way clients have an option on choosing and there are more advantages to gain. She needs a loan to purchase products to have in supply and when they are on sale to immediately offer then at a better price. She will secure more income this way. This is her 4th loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she feels that participating in a group loan has been one of the best decisions she has made with regards to the development of her business. She feels very thankful and she will once again begin this work with the group of her communal bank. She gives her word to keep on being on time with her payments. With the loan that she requests she will invest in the purchase of beauty products on sale in the next campaign.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products for resale.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos es un joven trabajador  de 24 años de edad, es soltero y vive en casa de su madre en la zona urbana marginal del distrito de Mórrope - Lambayeque. El lugar es una comunidad pequeña con aproximadamente 100  familias.

Santos tiene muchos deseos de independizarse y desde hace 4 años mantiene su trabajo de confección de gorras. Santos realiza este trabajo a la perfección pues su hermano mayor se lo enseñó hace varios años. Santos tiene muy buen acabado en sus gorras y por eso cuenta con clientes que están más que satisfechos con sus productos.

Santos desea invertir en la compra de materiales para la confección de sus gorras (telas, hilos y agujas) así como, en el mantenimiento de su maquinaria. Este es el motivo por el que solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles que le serán de gran utilidad en su negocio.

Santos,  es un cliente antiguo para nuestra institución y cuenta con buen record de pagos.
texts.en:
Santos es un joven trabajador  de 24 años de edad, es soltero y vive en casa de su madre en la zona urbana marginal del distrito de Mórrope - Lambayeque. El lugar es una comunidad pequeña con aproximadamente 100  familias.

Santos tiene muchos deseos de independizarse y desde hace 4 años mantiene su trabajo de confección de gorras. Santos realiza este trabajo a la perfección pues su hermano mayor se lo enseñó hace varios años. Santos tiene muy buen acabado en sus gorras y por eso cuenta con clientes que están más que satisfechos con sus productos.

Santos desea invertir en la compra de materiales para la confección de sus gorras (telas, hilos y agujas) así como, en el mantenimiento de su maquinaria. Este es el motivo por el que solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles que le serán de gran utilidad en su negocio.

Santos,  es un cliente antiguo para nuestra institución y cuenta con buen record de pagos.

loans.use: Comprar telas,hilos,agujas y arreglar maquinaria.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy thread, lace & a sewing machine for sewing business.

loans.name: Leonie

texts.en:
Leonie is married and is a mother of a ten-month-old baby. She is 27 years old. She sells second-hand clothes and she has done this business for the past six years. Her business is going on well and she is proud of that. 

Her business enables her to meet the needs of her family and buy a piece of land on which she plans to build a house. She is requesting  a loan to buy more second-hand clothes in order to make more profits. She plans to reinvest all the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: to buy used clothing.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio tiene 42 años, es divorciado, se encarga de la manutención de la casa y de sus tres hijos quienes asisten a diversos centros educativos.Hace más de seis años que se inicio en el ramo de venta de electrodomésticos.
Don Antonio se dedica a la venta de una gran gama de electrodomésticos en lo cual le va muy bien, pues esta situado en un muy buen lugar al costado de la ruta principal por donde el cual concurre mucha gente. Cuenta con clientela formada debido al tiempo que lleva en esto.
Se define a si mismo como una persona muy humilde y admirada por el muy buen trato que le da a sus clientes.
Solicita el credito para la compra de electrodomésticos, para que así pueda atraer a mas clientes. Tiene mucha fe en el credito porque le sera de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Antonio is 42 years old and divorced.  He is responsible for supporting his household and his three children who are attending different schools.  More than six years ago, he started selling electrical appliances.

Antonio sells a wide range of electrical appliances and business is doing very well as it is situated in a very good location beside the main road where many people pass by.  He has regular customers owing to the length of time he has been in the business.

Antonio defines himself as a very humble person who is admired for the way he treats his customers.

Antonio is requesting a loan to buy electrical appliances, so that he can attract more customers.  He has a lot of faith in the loan because it will be very helpful to him.

loans.use: to buy electrical appliances to stock his business

loans.name: 3 De Junio Group

texts.es:
El Comité 3 de Junio de la ciudad de Villa Elisa cuenta con 15 integrantes, están en el tercer ciclo. Se reúnen en forma semanal en la casa de la secretaria , momento en el cual comparten ideas a realizar para las actividades así como también para resolver las posibles desavenencias. Todas las integrantes del grupo se muestran solidarias y con ganas de salir adelante.
La señora Adela ella vive en su humilde casita con su marido e hijos y tiene su pequeña despensa que quiere ir agrandando a través de los ciclos. Ella desea salir siempre adelante con sus microemprendimientos y sacar adelante también a su familia. Comenta que todo el sacrificio que hace es por un futuro mejor para sus hijos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, hortalizas y demás para el abastecimiento del local. Esta con las esperanzas puestas en el crédito, ya que sabe que le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The “Comite 3 de Junio” (June 3rd Committee) from Villa Elisa city has 15 members and they are in their 3rd loan cycle. They meet weekly in the secretary's house, where they share ideas for activities to carry out, as well as to resolve any possible disagreements. All the members of the group demonstrate solidarity and the desire to move ahead.

Mrs. Adela lives in a humble little house with her husband and children and she has a small store that she wants to continue growing through the loan cycles. She wants to advance always with her micro-enterprise and to advance her family as well. She comments that all of the sacrifices she makes are for a better future for her children.

Adela is requesting a loan to buy groceries, drinks, garden vegetables, and other items to resupply her store. She has her hopes placed on the loan, since she knows that it will be a great help.

loans.use: buy groceries, drinks, garden vegetables,and other store supplies.

loans.name: Ryskul's Group

texts.en:
Ryskul is the leader of this group. She is 53 and married to a security guard. Together with her husband she takes care of two grandchildren, both of whom study at school. In order to earn additional money for the family budget, Ryskul’s husband also works in construction. 

Three years ago, with an initial investment of 5000 soms, Rysku started to breed livestock and then resell it after fattening. She applied for the loan because she needs additional funds to increase the number of livestock. She wants to purchase six farm animals for breeding, fattening and further reselling. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Dep

texts.en:
Dep is a 56-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh city. Dep has 4 children. Dep’s husband works as a driver.

Dep earns an income to support her family by operating a beauty salon together with a general store in the front of her house. She has done this for 4 years. She plans to use this loan to buy a greater variety of basic goods to stock her store.
  
She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods to stock her general store.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a married man with five children. Three of his children attend school, while two have already graduated from school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, he has operated a charcoal-selling business, selling to his neighbors. He faces a major business challenge of seasonality, especially during the rainy season. He dreams of securing larger loans in order to expand his business in the future.

With the 10,000 KES loan he is requesting, he would like to purchase additional sacks of charcoal for re-sale purposes. He decided to join Yehu so that he could have greater access to loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of charcoal for re-sale purposes.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 

Virginia provides a motorela or habal-habal services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for maintenance.

Virginia has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Virginia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for maintenance

loans.name: Glicerio

texts.en:
Glicerio is a 32-year-old married man with 3 children aged 11, 4 and 1. He is a farmer and has been growing rice for 4 years. Glicerio sells his harvest at the market and earns about 5000 PHP per month.

Glicerio has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. He hopes to achieve an abundant harvest. He also hopes to save for his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Cherilyn

texts.en:
Cherilyn is 39 years old and lives in Sepac, Sapang Dalaga. She is married with five children. 
To earn a living, Cherilyn has a business selling snacks and other delicacies. She earns about PHP 2500 each month doing this type of work. Cherilyn has  requested a loan of 20,000 to purchase fertilizer for her corn.
Cherilyn has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.

loans.use: To purchase 10 sacks of fertilizer for her corn

loans.name: Percy

texts.es: El socio Percy está solicitando otro préstamo para mejorar los equipos médicos de su consultorio. El anterior crédito al socio Percy le ayudo a comprar más equipos médicos y así pudo brindar una mejorar atención a sus clientes, él obtuvo buenas ganancias de la cuales lo destino para la alimentación y para los gastos del hogar. El socio Percy está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en: Percy requests another loan to improve the medical equipment of his clinic. The previous loan requested by Percy helped him to purchase more medical equipment. He was then able to provide his clients with a better level care. He obtained good profits which he used towards the nutrition of his family and to cover the household expenses. Percy is happy for this loan and he is committed to making his loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase medical equipment.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan G. de 39 años se dedica a la comercialización de flores naturales, como rosas, jazmines, gladiolos, claveles etc. Inicialmente esta actividad la realizó en el negocio de un primo, y cuando estuvo preparado para atender él solo el mercado se independizó y ahora genera sus ingresos independientes, desde hace 10 años. Él se encuentra ubicado muy cerca al parque cementerio y sus principales clientes son los familiares de difuntos que se acercan a llevar flores a las tumbas de sus seres amados. En la actividad de venta de flores las fechas de mayor repunte de sus ventas son los fines de semanas y festivos, los días de los difuntos principalmente. Su sueño es convertirse en mayorista de flores pues conoce el mercado de los vendedores al detalle. En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará al por mayor y de contado flores para dar inicio a la meta que se propone.
texts.en: Juan G. is 39 years old and sells flowers like roses, jasmine, gladiolus, carnations, etc. In the beginning, he ran this business with his cousin. When he was ready to work at the market on his own, he became independent, and now he has been making his own money for 10 years. He is located close to the cemetery, and his main clients are families of the deceased who come to lay flowers on the graves of their loved ones. In the business of selling flowers, the days of the greatest sales spikes are weekends and festivals, days honoring the deceased mainly. His dream is to become a flower wholesaler since he knows the retail market. Right now he has applied for a Kiva loan, first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With this he will buy bulk flowers in order to begin going after his goal.

loans.use: to buy bulk flowers such as roses, gladiolus, carnations, etc

loans.name: Venancio

texts.en:
Venancio is 62, married and has seven adult children. He is a farmer who raised his family in a village. For almost 44 years, he has owned and managed a rice-farming and hog-raising business; he earns an income of approximately PHP 12,000 per month. Most of his income goes toward their daily consumption and the allowances of his grandchildren. Despite the hardships of life, he has aimed to improve his business because he wants to give his children a better life. Through his patience and hard work, most of his children have finished their studies and they are now professionals. Despite this, he wants to continue managing the business because he wants to earn and save for their future.

He is asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for his hog-raising business. He mentioned that the loan will help him to make an improvement in his piggery and increase the number of his pigs. He believes that "if there is patience, there is progress." This is his principle in life.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for his hog-raising business.

loans.name: Rolando Filimon

texts.es:
El señor Rolando tiene 35 años de edad y es soltero.

Rolando tiene 10 años de dedicarse a prestar sus servios como jornal. Él aprendió este oficio por la necesidad de ayudar a sus padres, ya que ellos son de escasos recursos económicos. Antes realizaba actividades agrícolas y fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaron, ya que era una costumbre de familia.

Rolando solicita el préstamo para comprar dos vacas, de esta manera podrá ayudar más a sus padres, ya que tendrá la leche y la guajada para el sustento diario. También como derivado de la leche tendría el suero, para engordar unos terneros. Así ira ahorrando para pagar el crédito y para casarse.

El crédito contribuirá en gran medida a que la vida de Rolando y sus padres mejore, ya que él dice que ayudara mucho en su economía, ya que él planea casarse y construir su propia casa, y tener todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Rolando is 35 years old and he is single.

For 10 years, Rolando has been working a day laborer. He learned the trade out of the need to help his parents, who have limited financial resources. He used to work in farming before and it was his parents who taught him, as it was a family tradition.

Rolando is requesting the loan to buy two cows. In this way, he will be able to help his parents more, as he will have the milk and the curd for daily sustenance. Also, as a milk derivative he will have the whey, with which to fatten some calves. That way he will be saving to pay for the loan and get married.

The loan will contribute in great measure to improve Rolando and his parents’ lives. He says it will help their financial situation a lot, as he plans to get married and build his own home and have everything that is necessary.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
El socio es el Sr. Teofilo; el socio tiene  56 años de edad; el socio tiene 3 hijos, el socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de jardin,el es propietario de un jardin que junto con su esposa administran,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 2:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelnate a sus hijos,el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el jardin . El socio solicita el préstamo para implementar el jardin y comprar papeles,libros,colores y pinturas al por mayor.

El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Teofilo is 56 years old and has three children.  He and his wife run a kindergarten and work from 8:00 am to 2:00 pm.  They move their children ahead in life through this business.  He wants to expand and improve the kindergarten and is asking for this loan to buy paper, books, crayons, and paints in quantity.

He appreciates the support he’s getting and promises to be disciplined about making his payments.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stock of retail products such as sugar, flour, etc.

loans.name: Beatrice Gbedonudé

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de quatre enfants, la cliente commercialise un peu de tout que se soit le savon les bougies,le lait en poudre et les pates alimentaires depuis 15 ans . Dans le but d'élagir,de satisfaire sa clientèle et de rentabiliser son activité, elle sollicite et obtient un prêt à Finadev. Le revenu issu de ce prêt l'aidera à couvrir partiellement les charges de son foyer et à ouvrir sa boutique à domicile.
texts.en:
This borrower is married with four children. For the past 15 years, she has been selling a variety of products including soap, candles, powdered milk, and pasta, among others. 

In order to increase and satisfy her customer base, and to make her business profitable, she is seeking a loan from Finadev. She will use the income earned with the help of this loan to offset part of her household expenses and to open a shop in her home

loans.use: to buy several cartons of soap, candles, milk, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Gloria Patricia

texts.es: La joven Gloria Patricia es empleada de una empresa que produce joyas y accesorios para dama, a la par tiene propio un taller pequeño que comenzó hace unos meses con algunos ahorros propios. A sus 20 años es una emprendedora quien desea incrementar la producción y atender la demanda de su taller, para lo cual necesita de la compra de insumos y una nueva maquina con lo cual puede cumplir su objetivo. A futuro sueña con tener un taller muy grande y generar muchos empleos.
texts.en: The young Gloria Patricia is an employee at a factory that produces toys and women’s accessories. She has her own small workshop that she opened a couple of month ago with some of her own savings. At 20 years old she is an entrepreneur who wishes to increase production and meet demand. To do that she needs to buy raw materials and a new machine so that she can reach her goal. For the future she dreams of having a much larger workshop and of generating many jobs.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and a machine for her workshop making and selling jewelry.

loans.name: Israel

texts.en: Israel is 42 years old. He is married to a farmer with nine children. All of them go to school. He sells different items such as soap, salt and cooking oil, a business which he has been running for the past 10 years. He has requested the loan to buy more similar items to add to the same business inventory. With the profits, he will pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more soap, salt and cooking oil.

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.en: Genevieve is married and has three children. She is 32 years old and lives in Dolipos Alto, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. To earn a living, Genevieve has a hog fattening business. She has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns approximately 3,000 PHP. She has requested a loan to purchase more feeds for her pigs. Genevieve has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Genevieve hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase more feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Mercuria

texts.en: Ma. Mercuria is a 51-year-old woman who lives a simple life with her family in a town of Tubigon, Bohol. Her husband does fishing, while Ma. Mercuria is running a sari-sari (variety) store business. She has been doing this for two years. Ma. Mercuria and her husband work hard to sustain everyday. They have five adult children. She is asking for a loan to buy commodities to sell such as drinks, spices, eggs, cooking oil, noodles, canned goods, snack foods, candies, toiletries, salt, sugar, and rice. Furthermore, Ma. Mercuria is still determined to uplift their livelihood for their future needs.

loans.use: to buy commodities to sell such as drinks, spices, eggs, cooking oil, noodles, canned goods, snack foods, candies, toiletries, salt, sugar, and rice

loans.name: Rosemond

texts.en: Rosemond Ventures is a phone use company in Shama dealing in communication for the clients in the local community with a popualation of 21,000 inhabitants. The proprietor of this communication centre has participated in several TEACH lending courses. She has developed an elaborate BUSINESS/MARKETING Plan. She would need $900 from KIVA LOANS to improve her businsess activities in 2007.

loans.use: Purchase Phone Equipments for Communications

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael is married and has two children; one is 5 years old and the youngest is 6 months old. His wife is a teacher. Ismael is in the business of making furniture, which is a family tradition. His grandfather started making furniture, and it has been passed down through the generations, continuing with his father and now with Ismael. The need for a source of income, and the fact that he liked learning this occupation, were what motivated Ismael to dedicate himself to this livelihood, in addition to the need to help out with family expenses. He makes all kind of furniture and has a lot of knowledge about this trade since he began in 1997.

Ismael is in need of a loan of $750.00 to buy tools that will allow him to improve the quality of his work and help him to increase his production, and therefore improve his business and number of clients. Ismael promises to pay back the loan over a period of 6 to 12 months. He is very excited to know that people with good hearts will help him improve his situation and that of his family and he is grateful to you all.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Ismael esta casado y tiene dos hijos uno de 5 años y el menor de 6 meses de edad, su esposa trabaja de maestra. El negocio de Ismael es la elaboración de muebles, el cual es una herencia familiar, ya que su familia conocía este oficio desde su abuelo y se mantuvo en generaciones, continuando con su padre y ahora Ismael. La necesidad de tener un ingreso y el gusto que tenía por aprender este oficio fue lo que llevo a Ismael a dedicarse a este oficio sumando la necesidad de colaborar en los gastos familiares. Los muebles que elabora son de todo tipo y tiene mucho conocimiento de este oficio debido a que empezó en el en 1,997.

Ismael esta requiriendo de un préstamo por US $ 750 para la compra de herramientas que le permitan mejorar aún la calidad de los trabajos que realiza e incrementar su producción, por ende su negocio y clientes. Ismael promete pagar el préstamo en un plazo de 6 a 12 meses y esta muy emocionado por saber que personas de buen corazón lo van a ayudar a mejorar su situación y la de su familia y se los agradece.

loans.use: To buy tools for his carpentry shop

loans.name: Phon

texts.en: Mr. Phon S. is 40 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with his wife and their three children.  Phon owns a barber shop and earns $5/day while his wife earns $3/day as a garment factory worker.  One of their children works at a local hotel and the other two children are students.  This loan will be used to repair and expand Phon's barber shop.  In the future, he hopes to grow his business into a hairdressing shop.  If successful, he will send his children to university and build a new house.

loans.use: to repair and expand his barber shop

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Hermelinda is 30 years old, single and the mother of 2 children. She is a humble woman but very hardworking, and thanks to her sacrifices she has been able to raise her children, acting as both mother and father.

Hermelinda is the owner of a business where she sells fast food like empanadas, sweet pies and salads, fruit juice and soft drinks. Thanks to previous loans she was able to start her business. One of her children helps her prepare the food and run her business, work that begins in the early morning.

Her main customers work in a soap factory that is a block away from her store. She prepares both breakfast and lunch for them.

Hermelinda hopes to take out a new loan to buy tables and chairs for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Hermelinda tiene 30 años, es soltera y madre de 2 hijos, ella es una persona muy humildes, pero muy trabajadora, y gracias a su sacrificio ha podido sacar adelanta a su hijos, cumpliendo el rol de madre y padre a la vez.

Hermelinda es dueña de un negocio donde se dedica a la venta comidas rápidas tales como empanadas, tartas dulces y saladas, jugos de frutas y gaseosas. Gracias a créditos solicitados anteriormente ella pudo montar su negocio; una de sus hijas la acompaña en la actividad diaria que lo inician a muy tempranas horas de la madrugada.

Sus principales clientes son los empleados de un fabrica de jabones que queda a una cuadra de su negocio, a quienes ella también prepara el desayuno y el almuerzo.

Hermelinda desea adquirir un nuevo crédito que lo utilizará para la compra de mesas y sillas para su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase tables and chairs for her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: She enjoys selling provisions and food items. She is optimistic that her business will improve if she is given a loan of US$475. Mrs. Elizabeth O. is 42 years old and is a married mother of 10 children. She is from Uromi in Edo State and has been with LAPO for the past 3 years.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and food items

loans.name: William Ernesto

texts.es:
In the heat of the jungle, the most used transportation vehicles are motorcycles. Ernesto is a skilled driver of these vehicles. He learned this work when he was a young man, and today it is his principal source of income. Ernesto has four young children, whom he supports by sending them money since he is separated from his wife, who lives with his children. Many times not having them by his side fills him with sadness, but he puts forth an immense effort to send them what they need for their development. His wish is to contribute properly to his children, and this is why he wants to buy an additional vehicle so that he can increase his income and accomplish his goals.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

En el calor de la selva, los vehículos de transporte más usados son los motocars y Ernesto es un hábil conductor de estos vehículos, él aprendió a trabajar así, desde joven y hoy en día es su principal fuente de trabajo.Ernesto tiene cuatro hijos menores, a los cuales mantiene enviándoles dinero, ya que es separado de su esposa, quién ahora vive con sus hijos. Muchas veces el no poderlos tener a su lado lo llena de tristeza, sin embargo se esfuerza inmensamente para enviarles lo necesario, para su desarrollo.Su deseo es contribuir debidamente con sus hijos y es por ello que desea comprarse un vehículo adicional, para que pueda incrementar sus ingresos y pueda lograr sus metas.

loans.use: Purchase of an additional vehicle to increase his income and the quality of life of his beloved children.

loans.name: Angostura 7 Group

texts.es:
Mercedes is 48 years old, she had eleven children and together with her husband she works fishing. Her group mates Anita and Cecilia work in the same productive activity, with the exception of Maria Silvia who has a general store in her home. In this ways, they obtain the income to support their families.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

MERCEDES TIENE 48 AÑOS, TUVO ONCE HIJOS Y JUNTO CON SU ESPOSO SE DEDICAN A LA PESCA. SUS COMPAÑERAS ANITA Y CECILIA DESEMPEÑAN LA MISMA ACTIVIDAD PRODUCTIVA, A EXCEPCION DE MARIA SILVIA QUE TIENE INSTALADO EN SU CASA UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES. DE ESTA FORMA ELLAS OBTIENE INGRESOS PARA EL SOSTENIENTO FAMILIAR.

loans.use: Investing in buying fishing nets. (INVERTIRAN EN LA COMPRA DE MALLAS PESQUERAS)

loans.name: Thi Hanh

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hạnh, 34 years old, is married and has 4 children. All children are in school age. Family’s economy is in hardship. She has a furniture store at home. Things are tough because of lacking venture capital. She would like to borrow money to strengthen and expand her store.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Hạnh năm nay 34 tuổi, đã lập gia đình và có 4 con. Cuộc sống gia đình rất vất vả vì các con còn đang ở độ tuổi lớn và đi học. Hai anh chị mở một cửa hàng mua bán nội thất tại gia đình. Việc mở cửa hàng ban đầu rất khó khăn vì thiếu vốn, anh chị đã tìm đến tổ chức vi mô với mong muốn vay vốn để có thể mua thêm tủ, bàn, ghế... phục vụ cho hoạt động kinh doanh của mình

loans.use: Buy goods

loans.name: Melahet

texts.en: Melahet M. and her husband own and operate a market in the small northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi. She and her husband have been working in this store for the last 16 years and have four children, some of whom also work at the store. Melahet and her husband are currently seeking funding so that they can increase the quantity and variety of their inventory.

loans.use: To increase the quantity and variety of inventory

loans.name: San

texts.en:
Mrs. San K., 47, is a mother of 9 children and works selling fish in a busy market, normally earning about $3 a day. Her husband, who is a farmer, makes on average $2 a day of profit. They have 9 children: two are garment workers making a salary of $60 each a month. Two others are painters and make an average of $2 each per day. The others stay at home to help their parents work.

The loan will be used to purchase more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: To purchase more fish.

loans.name: Ieng

texts.en:
Mrs. Ieng C., 35 years old, and her husband Say Sareth, make around $3.50 per day farming near their home in the Suong District, Kampong Cham Province. C. has two children, one of whom works on a rubber plantation in Kampong Thom Province and contributes about $0.83 per day to the family.

C. seeks a $400 loan to purchase a water pumping machine for her farming business and a used motorbike for her husband. With this motorcycle, Sareth will supplement his income by working as a motorcycle taxi driver.

loans.use: To purchase a water pumping machine for her farming business and a used motorbike for her husband

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila runs a small business selling women’s clothing at a huge market in the city of Simferopol, Ukraine. She has been in business for seven years and has developed an effective business strategy of having a good selection of products and pricing her inventory just a little lower than her competitors. Her current sales location is in an especially busy part of the market. In the next three or four months, she plans to move to a new area of the market where small booths are being constructed for vendors.

Ludmila is divorced and has a daughter who is 24. They live together in a small apartment on the top floor of their building. The roof has a consistent problem with leaks. Ludmila hopes to earn extra income from her business to have the leaks fixed.

Ludmila has requested a loan of $1,050 to help purchase new inventory and increase the assortment of clothing she has for sale. We are grateful for the opportunity to assist this hard-working entrepreneur with her business and look forward to her continued success.

loans.use: To buy new clothing inventory

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
.Martín owns a minibus which is his work tool and income source. He works as the chauffeur and his wife as his assistant (“voceadora”). They have an 8 year-old daughter and live in the Zone San José of Yunguyo of the town of El Alto. The loan requested will be spent on buying spare parts (brakes, brake and transmission oil) as well as maintenance costs so the vehicle has no mechanical defects and can work normally. This is his first loan with Impro and the evaluation allows the approval of the loan requested by Martín.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Martín tiene un minibús que es su herramienta de trabajo y su fuente de ingresos, con el cual trabajan él como chofer y su esposa como ayudante (voceadora). Tienen una hija de 8 años de edad y viven en la Zona San José de Yunguyo de la Ciudad de El Alto. El crédito que ahora solicita será destinado para la compra de repuestos (frenos, liquido de frenos, liquido de transmisión) y costos de mantenimiento para que la movilidad no tenga fallas mecánicas y pueda trabajar normalmente. Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada permite aprobar el préstamo solicitado por Martín.

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts and cost of maintenance of minibus.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a digital camera, a camera flash, 14 film rolls and 10 pairs of batteries/Comprar una camara digital, 1 flash para camara, 14 rollos de pelicula y 10 pares de bateria.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina is 50 years old. She is married and is the mother of three children who already have their own families. She studied until the fifth graD.. She lives in the Zepita district of the province of Chucuito - Juli in the region of Puno.

She is a partner of the Andrés Santa Cruz of Chuachua Communal Bank. With her first loan of S. 300 she bought two pigs and a sheep to fatten and sell at the cattle fair in the district. This transaction didn't go well, so she decided to buy more sheep to fatten. Thus she maD. a small profit and she bought some cows to fatten.

With the loan of S. 1, 500, which she will pay in four months, she will buy a cow to fatten and sell at the fair. If there is money left, she will invest it in the preparation of food to sell on Fridays in Desaguadero.

Catalina is slowly increasing her capital.She is very happy to belong to the Communal Bank, since she learned how to work on her own. She is grateful, since thanks to the support of Manuela Ramos she could improve her financial situation.

Her future goal is to have grassy land to install a farm.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Catalina tiene 50 años D. edad, es casada, madre D. tres hijos quienes ya tienen sus familias, ella estudió hasta quinto D. primaria, vive en el Centro Poblado D. Chuachua, del distrito D. Zepita, provincia D. Chucuito - Juli y Región D. Puno. Es socia del Banco Comunal Andrés Santa Cruz D. Chuachua, con el primer préstamo D. S/.300.00 nuevos soles compró 02 chanchitos y 1 oveja para engordar y vender en la feria D. ganado del día jueves en el distrito, este no le fue muy bien y decidió comprar más ovejas para engordar. Con ello obtuvo un poco D. ganancia y compró ganado vacuno para el engorD., al igual que sus otras compañeras. Con el préstamo es D. S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará una vaca para el engorD. D. la feria dominical D. Ilave y si es que sobra lo invertirá en el preparado D. comida que realiza en Desaguadero los días viernes. Catalina, manifiesta que poco a poco esta incrementando su capital, ella se encuentra muy feliz estando en el Banco Comunal aprendió trabajar sola y esta agradecida ya que gracias al apoyo D. Manuela Ramos mejoró sus condiciones económicas. Su visión futura es instalar pastos cultivables para instalación D. granja D. cuyes.

loans.use: Purchasing one cow

loans.name: Jemima

texts.en: Jemima Q. sells fresh eggs at Kotokoraba Market in Cape Coast. Jemima has received a high school education.  She is a widow and has 2 children. Jemima has been selling fresh eggs since 2001. She is responsible for taking care of her aged father and her brothers in addition to her children's financial needs. Demand for groceries has increased. Her loan will be used to buy more eggs and other groceries to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house for her children.

loans.use: To buy more eggs and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Teu

texts.en: Teu P., 37, is married and lives with three children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Since 2004, she has been growing lotus for sale. On average, she is able to make around US$3 each day. Her husband, Nuon Neng, 39, catches fish from the river and sells his catch to the market to earn approximately US$3 each day as well. This couple also receives support from one of their children, who is a garment factory worker. Mrs. Teo P. is asking a loan of US$400 to purchase a wooden boat, its motor, and fishing nets for her husband to catch more fish.

loans.use: To purchase a wooden boat, its motor, and fishing nets.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es: nEn la ciudad de Quiindy, en la Compañía Comandante P. distante a 18km de la Oficina de Carapeguá, unas señoras de escasos recursos se enteraron del programa de comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y decidieron reunirse para recibir una información sobre el mencionado programa, buscando un poco más de apoyo para fomentar a través del crédito sus ingresos familiares y mejorar su calidad de vida.nEstas personas crecieron gracias a este programa. Necesitan esta operación crediticia para invertir en sus respectivas microempresas y lograr un crecimiento sostenible que les haga crecer como grupo y en forma individual.nLas actividades que realizan estas señoras son:n1-tRAMONA V.: VENDEDORA   n2-tMA-SIXTA R. DIAZ: VNTA DE CHIPAn3-tNANCY BARRIOS: VNTA DE BEBIDASn4-tESTELVINA R. DIAZ: VNTA DE VERDURAS n5-tERMELINDA R. DIAZ: ALMACENn6-tOLGA C.: VNTA DE BEBIDASn7-tCLARA C.:VTA DE PRODUCTO AVON n8-tPETRONA P.: VNTA. DE REMEDIOS YUYOS n9-tMA-ELIA CABELO: VNTA DE FRUTASn10-tMIRIAN L.: VENDEDORAn11-tNORMA B.: VNTA DE REMEDIOS YUYOSn12-tDELICIA G.: CANTINA EN ESCUELAn13-tCARMEN G.: VNTA DE QUESO Y HUEVOn14-tMA-LOURDES C.: VNTA DE VERDURASn15-tESTER P.: COPETINn16-tJULIA M.: VENDEDORA AMBULANTE.n17-tVIDALIA C.: COSTURA DE PELOTASn18-tVIDALIA R. DIAZ: COSTURA DE PELOTASn19-tLUCIANA F.: ALMACENnNo estan en la fotonVidalia R. DiaznLuciana Fleitasn
texts.en:
In the city of Quiindy, in the Compañía Comandante P. 18 kilometers from the Oficina de Carapeguá, a few women of scarce resources found out about the committee of Mujeres Emprendedoras, "Enterprising Women," and decided to join together to get more information about this program, searching for more support to boost their family incomes by way of credit and improve their quality of life. These people grew thanks to this program. They need this credit operation to invest in each of their micro-businesses and achieve a sustainable growth that lets them grow as a group and as individuals. The activities that these women do are: Ramona V.: vendor Sixta R. Diaz: chips sales Nancy Barrios: drink sales Estelvina R. Diaz: vegetable sales Ermelinda R. Diaz: grocer Olga C.: drink sales Clara C.: Avon product sales Petrona P.: herbal remedy sales Elia Cabelo: fruit sales Mirian L.: vendor Norma B.: herbal remedy sales Delicia G.: school snack bar Carmen G.: cheese and eggs sales Lourdes C.: vegetable sales Ester P.: drinks and appetizer sales Julia M.: peddler Vidalia C.: balls seamstress Vidalia R. Diaz (not in photo): balls seamstress Luciana F. (not in photo): grocer

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bedspreads, hammocks, table cloths, threads

loans.name: Roukayath

texts.fr:
Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans. 


Born around 1969 in Plateau County in South Benin, Roukayath O. married Casmir Effouyemi and has 3 children in school. She specializes in beauty products and assorted products in the PK10 neighborhood where she has her storefront. She has seen her client demand increase enough to merit a loan to buy more beauty products. 


Née vers 1969 au Sud du Bénin dans le département du Plateau, Dame O. Roukayath est mariée à EFFOUYEMI Casmir et mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés. Spécialisée dans la distribution des produits de beautés et de quelques articles divers, elle dispose aujourd'hui d'une kiosque au PK10 où elle passe la journée derrière son étalage. Ayant reçu plusieurs commandes de sa clientèle, elle sollicite son troisième crédit pour renforcer son capital et pour honorer la demande de ses clients.
texts.en:
Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans. Born around 1969 in Plateau County in South Benin, Roukayathest O. married Casmir Effouyemi and has 3 children in school. She specializes in beauty products and assorted products in the PK10 neighborhood where she has her storefront. She makes an average of $20-$27 per day, and has seen her client demand increase enough to merit a loan to buy more beauty products. Née vers 1969 au Sud du Bénin dans le département du Plateau, Dame O. Roukayathest à EFFOUYEMI Casmir,mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés, spécialisée dans la distribution des produits de beautés et quelques articles divers,elle dispose aujourd'hui d'une kioque au PK10 où ellle passe la journée derrière son étalage, Elle faire en moyenne par jour un chiffre d'affaire de 15000 à 20000 francs CFA,Ayant réçu plusieurs commande de sa clientèle, elle sollicite son troisième crédit pour renforcer son capital et pour honnorer la demande de ses clients.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pommade and 3 cartons of soap

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of cloth and materials to sew clothes.

loans.name: Mohammad Hasham Group

texts.en:
Mirechand M. H. is the group leader of the M. H. group. There are four members in this group. Each of them would like to receive money for her business.

Salaha and Zynab want to take a loan for their tailoring businesses. They want to buy a new sewing machine for their businesses. Mirechand wants to take out a loan for her husband’s oil-selling business. He wants to buy necessary materials for his shop. Also Sakellah wants to take a loan for her son’s business selling vegetables. He wants to complete his stock.

They want to thank those who make this process of loans in Afghanistan possible, especially Kiva and AFSG who help poor people.

loans.use: to expand and improve their businesses

loans.name: Confianza Y Dignidad 2 Y 4 Group

texts.en: Marcia M. is the Group Coordinator for the Confianza y Dignidad (Trust and Dignity) Bank of Hope in Hato Mayor. This group of 5 hopes to utilize this microfinance loan to further establish their existing business ventures or create new operations in order to increase their profit levels. Marcia has 2 teenage children, ages 18 and 14. Marcia plans to utilize this loan to increase the inventory of the products she sells. Currently Marcia sells a variety of men’s, women’s, and children’s undergarments. Marcia is dedicated to the success of her business as she dreams of one day owning her own large variety store and converting a room in her house to a store. Loan funds will be used to increase current inventory levels and begin the process of creating a store. On behalf of Esperanza and this group of business entrepreneurs, we would like to thank you for your support!

loans.use: Purchase new undergarments to refurbish business.

loans.name: Saadat

texts.en: Saadat is a baker and has been in this business for 3 years.  She is 37, married, and has 2 children.  She needs a loan of $1200 so she can buy flour and other supplies.  With this loan Saadat can increase her business and add to her income.

loans.use: to buy flour and other supplies for baking bread

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana sells provisions and wine. She hopes to expand her business. She is 37 years old and married without a child. She is requesting a loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more provisions and wine to sell. She says thanks to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and wine to sell

loans.name: Joséphine

texts.fr:
G. Joséphine est née dans les années 1971. Joséphine est mariée à HOUNTONDJI Patrice et mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés. Joséphine est couturière mais, elle vend aussi. Joséphine vend des détergents et des seaux et bassines en plastique; qu'elle distribue de maison en maison. Joséphine achète ses produits à Cotonou au grand marché international du Bénin. Grâce à son activité Joséphine aide son mari à subvenir aux charges de ménage notamment à la scolarité des enfants. Joséphine a déjà eu deux crédits de ALIDé; qu'elle a bien remboursés. Joséphine a pour projet de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stock en ses différents produits qu'elle vend. C'est pourquoi Joséphine sollicite de ALIDé un troisième crédit. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
G. Joséphine was born in 1971. She is married to HOUNTONDJI Patrice and is the mother of two children, both in school. She is a seamstress, and she also sells detergents and plastic buckets, tubs, and basins. She distributes from house to house. Joséphine buys goods in Cotonou at the grand international marketplace of Benin. Thanks to her business, she is helping her husband provide for the household, notably with schooling costs for the children. She has had two Alidé loans before that she has repaid. Her plan is to do better in responding to the demands of her customers and to avoid shortages in the different products she sell. These are the reasons why she’s requesting a third loan from Alidé.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for micro-loan recipients.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth for sewing and some detergents

loans.name: Net

texts.en:
Mrs. Net S. opened a small shop in front of her house for selling a few groceries. She sells her items to her neighbors who live near her house. From the business, she generates an income of $3 a day to manage her family's daily living. As the another source of the family's income, her husband catches fish in and around Tunle Sap Lake to sell at the market.

S. has been married for a long time but has no child and she plans to have a child next year. Recently, S. sold all her wares from her store. To earn extra income, she is applying for a loan to increase inventory for sale.

loans.use: To increase inventory for sale

loans.name: Giyos

texts.ru: Алиев Гиез , житель города Яван. Возраст 49 лет, женат и имеет двоих детей. имеет средне техническое образование. По профессии гидротехник. Проработал 20 лет по профессии. В данный момент работает в сельском хозяйстве.Сеет овощи и злаковые культуры. Получаемый урожай реализует на рынке. Частично продукцию оставляет семье. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить удобрения для обработки  земли. Это поможет ему получить качественный урожай.Полученную прибыль планирует использовать для того, чтобы устроить сына в университет.
texts.en:
Giyos A. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 49 years old, married, and has two children. He completed a vocational education. He is a hydraulic engineer by training, an area in which he worked for 20 years. Currently he works in agriculture, growing vegetables and grains to sell at market. Part of the harvest is kept for the family. He decided to request a loan to buy fertilizer to improve the land. This will help him raise a high-quality product. The profit earned will go toward sending his son to university.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is married and has two young children. She lives in Tinkfuin, outside of Belo, Cameroon, and goes into town to sell her goods at Belo market. With this loan, Caroline will buy one bag of mixed beans, three bags of soybeans, and two bags of potatoes.

Caroline regards herself as a good businessperson – she attends to the customers at her market stall promptly, aims to keep her prices down, and treats her customers well. When she generates income with this loan, she will be able to employ workers on her farm, which she believes will help her community to prosper. Having faced poverty and been without food before, Caroline will use the profits from this loan to provide food for her children and pay for their school uniforms and stationery.
