She also will buy kitchen pots (made from aluminum).

This is Caroline’s second loan from Kiva partner, GHAPE, since she became a beneficiary in early 2007. Caroline takes out GHAPE loans because it teaches her how to do business. She believes that GHAPE grants loans to enable people to grow in their businesses.

About GHAPE
The Grounded and Holistic Approach for People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff, and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase mixed beans, soy beans and potatoes

loans.name: Ganiyu

texts.en: Ganiyu is 45 years old, and is married with three children. She obtains bread in large quantities directly from bakeries  and then supplies it to traders who, in turn, sell it to consumers. Ganiyu has been in this business for over eight years. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to increase her inventory in order to meet customer demand. Ganiyu has been borrowing from Kiva partner, LAPO, for over two years and has a good repayment record.

loans.use: To purchase more bread to sell

loans.name: Mashkhura

texts.ru: Хидирова Машхура проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 35 лет. Разведена, имеет 2 детей. Машхура более 6 лет занимается торговлей. Она имеет торговую точку на центральном рынке. Машхура просит кредит, чтобы закупить новый ассортимент одежды. Она хочет накопить сбережения для дальнейшей учебы детей.
texts.en:
Mashkhura H. lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube. She is 35 years old, divorced and has 2 children. Mashkhura has been involved in sales for over 6 years. She has a retail store at the central market. Mashkhura is requesting a loan in order to buy a new assortment of clothing. She wants to save money to pay for her children’s education.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of new clothing assortment

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is happily married to Noel who is 54 years old. She is mother to five; four of her children are already adults and her youngest child is only 6 years old. She lives in the town of Angono, Rizal province in the Philippines.

Her ambition to rise above poverty brought Eden to join ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 2008. Her previous loan was fully utilized for her business: a sari-sari store (general store). And the store as properly managed, brings her good income that can sustain the basic needs of the family.

Now she is excited to receive a loan of 10,000 pesos to pay for 4 sacks of rice, liquors, beverages, cigarettes and groceries for her store. She has hopes of expanding her business into a bigger store and also to be able to save for the school fees of her youngest son. She also aspires to having a house of her own.

loans.use: To pay for 4 sacks of rice, liquors, beverages, cigarettes and groceries for her store

loans.name: Edy Gladis

texts.es:
La señora Edy Gladis es socia del Banco Comunal “30 de Agosto”, en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 31 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos, ella pudo estudiar educación superior (incompleta).

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 10 años, su negocio es la venta de abarrotes, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para adquirir verduras.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para poder comprar  alimento balanceado para animales.

Su deseo es poder agrandar y surtir mejor su tienda.

A ella le gustan los intereses y las facilidades de pago.
texts.en:
Edy Gladis is a member of the Community Bank "30 de Agosto" located in Ilave in the province of El Collao in Puno. She is 31 years old and she is single with no children. She was able to go to high school but did not complete her studies.

She has been with the Manuela Ramos movement (Kiva Field Partner) for the past 10 years. Her business is a grocery store business. Her first loan of S/.300 nuevos soles was used as capital funds to purchase vegetables.

She currently requires an additional loan in the amoun of S/.3000 nuevos soles. The loan will be invested in the purchase of high quality animal feed.

Her wish is to be able to expand and have greater variety in her store.

She appreciates the interest and the ease of payments.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase high quality animal feed.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel Z. is engaged in rice retailing business for years now. She purchases sacks of rice and retails it per kilogram in her village. Maricel would like to avail a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase stocks of rice. She desires her inventory be full so that her earning never stops. Her daily income from her business is indispensable to her family because their daily food allowances come from the business. Maricel wishes for her family’s good health and dreams of uplifting their lifestyle someday.

Maricel, 28, is married to Benito Z., who works as a wood carver in their village. While both of them work hard everyday, she hopes that her children will also complete their studies someday. Bren Justine, their eldest son, is now six years old and is studying in Grade I in primary school. Their youngest is only one-month old. She hopes that her business grows so that she can meet the growing needs of her children. She also dreams of sending them to school and college someday so that they can uplift themselves from the poor living condition.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Keziah

texts.en: Keziah A. is 28 years old. She is married and has five school age children. She lives in Kenya. She is a simple, hard working entrepreneur who has spent eight years buying and selling local chicken breeds. She buys her stock cheaply from the locals especially during market days and supplies to nearby hotels. The income from her business supports her family. She believes that with a loan of Khs 20,000 her business will improve.

loans.use: Improve her business.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Félix tiene 56 años, vive con su esposa en su casa propia. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a las tareas agrícolas, lo cual le ha permitido sostener a su familia. Hoy, sus hijos son personas independientes y con sus propios hogares, por lo que Félix trabaja feliz al lado de su esposa. En épocas de siembra trabajan con la ayuda de sus dos toros para arar la tierra, de esta manera logra que sus productos sean atractivos para ser vendidos en el mercado de su localidad. Además sus tierras de cultivo se ubican en una buena zona, con  canales de riego que garantizan una buena cosecha.
Esta es la oportunidad número 14 en que tiene un préstamo con MFP, durante estos años (aproximadamente 6) ha aprendido el valor del ahorro, por lo que se siente muy contento de seguir participando en este tipo de créditos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para sus tierras de cultivo.

loans.use: Compra de abono

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes C. is a 31-year-old mother of five, all of whom are attending school. She has been in various business for the last nine years. She manages her own sari-sari (general) store located at their house while her husband, Maximillano, 32, provides a helping hand in taking care of their piggery business. Agnes joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative only last year but has been enjoying the many social benefits it supplies to community members. Agnes is applying for a new loan of P10,000 from the cooperative with which she plans to venture into a computer shop business. To start, she will use her new loan to purchase a computer. Agnes hopes to venture into opening an Internet shop soon. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To buy a computer for her new business

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia S. is 36 years old and has been selling fruit and vegetables for almost five years now. She is married to Ramil, a farmer in their village. They are blessed with three children: Ryan Vincent, 4; Cris Jhon Paul, 3; and the youngest who is just an infant.

Ramil plants vegetables in their fields while Virginia sells their harvested yield. Having a farm where they can harvest vegetables is very important to the couple thus they want to sustain its productivity. For this reason, Virginia is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to 5,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy more vegetable seed and fertilizer so that they can harvest more yield.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Françoise

texts.fr: D. Françoise est née en 1957 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Françoise est mariée et est mère de cinq enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Françoise vit seule au quartier Kowégbo depuis près de 15 ans, et supporte seule les charges de la famille. Françoise n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour satisfaire ses besoins, Françoise vend des boissons alcoolisées (liqueurs) ainsi que divers produits (biscuits, bonbons, papiers mouchoirs, etc.) à Kowégbo. Françoise a 30 ans d’expérience dans ce domaine. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Françoise fait ses achats. Françoise est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. C’est dans l’optique de renforcer la vente des liqueurs et d’augmenter son fonds de roulement que Françoise sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
D. Françoise was born in 1957 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She is married and the mother of five children who are all in school.  For nearly 15 years, she has been living alone in the Kowégbo district and is the sole breadwinner of the family.  Françoise has never been to school.  To support herself, she sells alcoholic drinks (liqueurs), as well as a variety of goods (cookies, candy, tissues, etc.) in Kowégbo.  She has 30 years of experience in this domain.  Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, is where she makes her purchases.  She is a previous ALIDé client who repays her loans.  With regard to bolsteiring her sales of liqueurs and increasing her working capital, she's requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of liqueurs and various goods (cookies and candy) to sell

loans.name: Yusufu

texts.en:
Yusufu is 52 years old, is married with five children, and he takes care of two dependents. His wife also sells cosmetics but they do not work together. Their children and dependents are between 7 and 26 years old.

Yusufu is a self-employed businessman who has sold cosmetics products for the past ten years. He is a proven entrepreneur with a track record of success. The hours of his business require that he works from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day except Sunday.

After having the idea of expanding his business, Yusufu is requesting his first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company. He will use the loan to purchase more cosmetics products which are in demand by a large number of his customers.

With this loan, Yusufu will work hard to make his business successful. If this strategy succeeds, he hopes to earn more money, which will help him to continue paying school fees for his children and dependents. In addition, he and his wife are committed to building a secure future for their family.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics products to sell

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Vorn B. is 45 years old and she lives in Roung village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 3-hectare (7.5-acre) piece of land on which she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Sam Kim, is a duck breeder. This couple has four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

Since her husband’s poultry business is going well, he wants to expand it. In order to do this, Mrs. Vorn B. decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducklings to raise and duck feed.

loans.use: To buy more ducklings and duck feed for her husband's business

loans.name: Galbadrah

texts.en:
Galbadrah is 32 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Gobi-Altay province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His son and daughter both attend a local secondary school while his wife is a food technician who works for a private company.

Galbadrah operates a business in his town making wooden products, designing and producing a variety of wooden furniture. He started his business in 1995 after graduating from college as a carpenter. Using his experience, he has built a stable business over the years, and his many customers are very satisfied with the quality items he produces.

As a young, business-minded entrepreneur, Galbadrah has developed a good taste in making unique and stylish furniture that is in demand. He is focused on the future and wants to open his own workshop. He is requesting a 700,000 tugrug loan to purchase wood, glue, lacquer and other necessary materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase wood, glue, lacquer and other necessary materials

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Mr. Neang  P. lives in  the Ampil village in Kandal province. He is 27 years old and lives with his family. He is a farmer who owns land and cultivates both rice and vegetables. Although he works hard, he earns a minimal income to support his family. He now faces an obstacle because he does not have enough money to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides to support his farming. 
In order to deal this problem, Mr. P. is asking for a loan to assist his vegetable growing.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seed, fertilizers, and pesticides to support his farming.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To restock her stationery and secretarial bureau with more goods like duplicating papers, books, and pens

loans.name: Salimatou Djidéré

texts.fr: Salimatou Djidéré D. est une femme de 32 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Vélingara Foulbé2 depuis 4 ans et a 8 fois de suite bénéficié de crédits. Elle est vendeuse de tissus teintés, elle achète sa marchandise en gros et revend au détaille dans son quartier. Cette activité lui procure des bénéfices qui lui permettent de participer à la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
Salimatou Djidéré D., age 32, is married and the mother of 3 children. She's been a member of the Village Bank in Vélingra Foulbé 2 for four years, and already benefited from eight loans. She sells dyed fabrics, that she buys wholesale and retails in her neighborhood. The profits drawn from this business enables her to help support her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her business (retailing dyed fabrics)

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 37-year-old married mother of five children ages 4-11 and who all go to school. She owns a five-room house where she lives with seven people. Sarah also takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and piped water and gets three meals a day. Her monthly expenses include feeding the family and medication. 

Sarah works in a semi-urban area, which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She owns a charcoal store in Kisaasi in Nsimbi Ziwoome zone where she sells both retail and wholesale. Sarah works seven days a week and receives an average of 25 customers a day. She buys from delivery vans that pick up the charcoal from the villages and then deliver it directly to her home. Besides her charcoal business, she also sells airtime. Her major business challenges include thieves, ever-increasing charcoal prices, the rainy season which hinders her customers from reaching her, and even the delivery cost of transporting the charcoal.  She has been in this business for over fifteen years and with MCDT for twelve years.  She is now requesting her fourteenth loan. Sarah joined MCDT because it was near her home and also because of being able to borrow in groups. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal.  She hopes to grow her business and start selling wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Bolatito

texts.en:
Bolatito is a fashion designer and she designs lovely Nigerian and Western designs for her customers. She loves this business because she makes her customers look good. She hopes to own a fashion house in the future. She has been in this business for a long time and she uses her experience in business to attract and retain more customers.

Bolatito is 31 years old and is married with two children. Her husband is a civil servant and he also supports their home. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to boost her business. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials

loans.name: Neema

texts.en: Neema Y. is an entrepreneur and a married woman. She runs a business as a food vendor at Yombo Makangarawe in Dar es Salaam. She prepares and sells varieties of both cooked and fried food to customers. She purchases the business goods from the food shops and food market center. She managed to open another business selling traditional clothes for income generation. Also she employs two workers who help her in running the business. She is requesting a loan of T.shs 1,000,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Maegret

texts.en: Maegret is 57 years old. She is a widow with six children. Her children are doing well at school. Her children had to switch schools from a private school to public school beause of the death of their father. To make a living, she sells periwinkles at retail prices to her customers. Periwinkles are used as soup ingredients in Nigeria and it is highly profitable. She has been in this business for seven years. She is requesting a loan of N70,000 to purchase more periwinkles to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more periwinkles to sell

loans.name: Tlatoani Group

texts.es:
EL grupo del que vamos a platicar se llama “Tlatoani”, que significa guerreros pertenecen al poblado D. Tlayacapan, son 5 integrantes: Humberto Eduardo Martínez Rodríguez el venD. tamales y atoles, Anastasio D. L. R. Santamaría inicia negocio (venta D. revistas y periódicos), Antolina X. F., venta D. Artículos por Catalago (perfumes), Maria Elena O. M., (venta D. Elotes hervidos y esquites), Eutimio Gómez T., (servicio, Albañilería).

     Don tacho como le llaman los demás integrantes del grupo es D. quien vamos a platicar, cuenta con 63 años D. edad, el va a iniciar el negocio D. venta D. revistas y periódico, platica que en el barrio donD. el vive no hay quien tenga un puesto D. revistas, actualmente vive con su esposa L. Sra. Isabel Santamaría Nopaltlali, tienen 4 hijos: Arturo D. L. R. Santamaría D. 39 años, (casado), Macario D. L. R. Santamaría D. 29 años, (casado), Armando D. L. R. Santamaría D. 27 años, (casado), Carlos D. L. R. Santamaría D. 22 es el mas chico y también (casado)

Don Ignacio y su esposa, actualmente viven solos,  me hace mención que le gustaría  poco a poco agrandar su negocio nuevo, comenzar a crecer para poder tener algo mas estable, actualmente,  trabaja en el campo y por esta misma razón y por ser mayor D. edad,  cada día le es mas difícil conseguir donD. trabajar, por esto es  que necesita y desea crecer mas.

El esta contento D. haber obtenido L. oportunidad D. recibir este crédito y agradece D. antemano L. confianza que le otorgan para trabajarlo, gracias a  Kiva y Fundación Realidad,  seguir adelante,  si se pueD., mi esposa Isabel, también les agradece D. todo corazón su apoyo.
texts.en:
The group we are going to talk about is called “Tlatoani”, which means warriors, from a village called Tlayacapan. There are 5 members: Humberto Eduardo Martínez Rodríguez who sells tamales and maize drinks, Anastasio D. L. R. Santamaría who wants to start a business (magazines and newspapers), Antolina X. F., who sells catalog products (perfumes), Maria Elena O. M. (boiled corncobs and corn kernels), Eutimio Gómez T. (services, bricklaying). Don Tacho, as the other group members call him, is who we are going to talk about. He is 63 years old, and is going to start a business selling magazines and newspapers. He tells us that the neighborhood where he lives doesn’t have a magazine stand. Currently, he lives with his wife, Isabel Santamaría Nopaltlali, and they have 4 children: Arturo D. L. R. Santamaría, 39 years old (married), Macario D. L. R. Santamaría, 29 years old (married), Armando D. L. R. Santamaría, 27 yeards old (married), Carlos D. L. R. Santamaría, 22 years old, the youngest, and also married. Ignacio and his wife currently live alone, and he says he’d like me to mention that he wants to slowly grow his new business to have a more stable source of income. Currently, he works in the country and, since he is now older, it is more difficult every day for him to find work. This is why he needs this business, and to be able to grow it. He is happy to have been given the opportunity to receive this credit, and he gives thanks ahead of time for the confidence placed in him. Thanks to Kiva and Fundación Realidad he can try to get ahead. His wife Isabel also thanks you with all her heart for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase magazines and newspapers.

loans.name: Lemu Group

texts.en:
Mary F., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called "Lemu". She is 44 years-old, married and has six children who range from one to 24 years old. She did not attend school due to poverty. She also cares for three siblings. All of her children are in school. 

For five years, she has been selling charcoal at the ELWA Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She says customers are attracted to her business because she sells good charcoal.

She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more bags of charcoal. She describes herself as a very easy-going person.

Her dream is to improve her business and be able to assist other family members.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Juan Ramón

texts.es:
El señor Juan Ramón  es un comerciante de 60 años de edad, está casado con la señora Amada Carvallo de Baéz hace 35 años, quien le dio 12 hijos de los cuales son 7 mujeres y 5 varones, ya casi todos están casados o en parejas sólo viven con ellos 3 hijos y la menor tiene 13 años y está en el colegio. 
Viven en casa propia en la ciudad de Villa Elisa  hace 13 años.
Ellos emigraron de la ciudad de Caazapá, donde se dedicaba a los trabajos de agricultura, cría de animales y aves de corral este trabajo lo hacía con toda su familia.
Llegaron a la ciudad y compraron para su propiedad en el distrito de San Antonio, donde habilitó una despensa en donde podía vender todo tipo de mercaderías y productos a granel.
Le gusta mucho el  comercio porque le permite estar en contacto con la gente de su barrio y conocer clientes en los lugares donde se abastece de mercaderías, cuenta que le involucra a sus hijos en el negocio  porque es la mejor manera de independizarse e ir creciendo, es por eso que muchos de sus hijos tienen también su negocio propio.
El crédito que retira es para ellos un gran apoyo porque con ello puede adquirir  mercaderías en mayor cantidad  a menos precios como arroz, azúcar, harina, aceites y otros.
texts.en:
Juan Ramon is a merchant, 60 years old, and has been married to Amada for 35 years. They have 12 children, of whom 7 are female and 5 male. Almost all are married or living with partners now. Just 3 children still live with them; the youngest is 13 and still in school. They have lived in their own home in the city of Villa Elisa for 13 years. The couple emigrated from the city of Caazapa where they had performed agricultural work, while raising livestock and chickens. This was done with all their family. Upon arrival in the city, they purchased property in San Antonio district, and rehabilitated a store where they could sell all types of merchandise and products in bulk. Juan Ramon enjoys commerce because it permits him to be in contact with the people of his barrio and also, to know clients in the areas that supply the merchandise. He says that he includes his children in the business because it is the best way to make them independent and to continue growing. As a result, many of them now have stores of their own. The loan he is taking out will be a great help, allowing him to acquire merchandise in larger quantities at lower prices, including rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING DRINKS, RICE, SUGAR, MEAT, TEA, AND BULK PRODUCTS TO SELL

loans.name: Gyenvudde Development Group-Lugazi

texts.en: It is now a decade since 45 year old, enterprising, N. Gitta started her general merchandise retail shop in Nyenga-Lugazi. With a modest savings from her farming and charcoal sells business, she embarked on this business. For this married mother of 6, determination and hard work have been the stock in trade attributes that she has banked on to give her business an edge. She has used profits from her business to not only give an improved lease on life to her family’s welfare, but she has also used it as a ways and means of consolidating her business. In a week,her business generates her 250,000 shillings. She also still maintains her farming and charcoal making business. She envisions owning a wholesale business in the future. Gitta says the first step to making this dream come to fruition is through acquiring this loan. With this loan she plans to use to purchase in bulk more retail items like bars of soap, sugar, posho and salt for her shop. She says that she will make a strong head way towards achieving her goals.

loans.use: The purchase of retail items like soap, sugar, posho and salt

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline I. is from the village of Upper Bandera. She is 51 years old and is married with four adult children. Evangeline owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Evangeline joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,500 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Belen

texts.en: Belen P. is from the village of Eastern Poblacion. She is 33 years old and is married with three school-aged children. Belen owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Belen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Belen is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace G. is currently in the business of selling bread, simsim (sesame seeds) and groundnuts (peanuts), and is requesting a loan to stock tomatoes and onions to sell. Grace is 41 years old and is married with a husband that is a peasant. She has 5 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: Stock tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida lives in a small city called Riwind, which is located near Lahore and famous for its dairy and farming industries. She is 45 years old and has lived in this area for the last 22 years. She is married to M. H., who is 53 years old and is in the business of selling rice and wheat. 

Farida is a housewife who also owns a buffalo and sells its milk to people who live in her community. She has been in this line of work for the last eight years.

Farida and her husband have seven children, four sons and three daughters, Only four are in school, in part because her older children had to leave school at an early age to support the family financially. Her oldest son is a rickshaw driver and one of her younger sons works in a small hotel in Lahore, where he lives during the work week. Her oldest daughter does embroidery work, taking orders from clients who live nearby. 

Farida has applied for a loan from Asasah to expand her milk-selling business. She plans to use the money to buy another buffalo, which will give her more milk to sell to her clients. She has taken out five previous loans from Asasah and repaid each on time She has also never missed a meeting called by our organization.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo in order to sell its milk in local markets

loans.name: Parveen Akhter's Group

texts.en:
Parveen Akhter lives in a historic city in Pakistan called Lahore. Lahore is the second largest city of Pakistan and is known for its history and culture. 
She is a 31-year-old lady who has been married to 39-year-old G. H. for the last 13 years. She is the mother of three daughters and two sons and lives in a three-room brick house with her family in an area named Mughalpura. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He provides transport facilities to his clients. Parveen supports her family financially by sewing clothes for her neighboring clients. She found the need to do this work a few years ago when she observed that her husband’s income alone was not enough to fulfill the basic needs of the family. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. With the loan, he will buy a new rickshaw because his current rickshaw has become old and he cannot work with it for long hours. Parveen is hopeful that her husband will be able to increase his income by purchasing a new rickshaw and as a result her family will be able to have a better living standard. This is the second time Parveen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah. 
 
Note: In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Parveen.

loans.use: To buy a new rickshaw

loans.name: Kudrat

texts.en:
Kudrat A. is 24 years old and the father of two small children. Kudrat is a villager in Shahrituz, urban-type community in Southern Tajikistan. He and his wife are farmers who own 21 hectares of land to cultivate rice, wheat, onion and other vegetables. On their plantation, they now face an obstacle because they do not have enough money to buy seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants for planting. So Kudrat decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Kudrat has gained a reputation for his responsibility with financial obligations and for keeping his word.  We are happy to have another opportunity to assist him with the operation of his business. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge tiene la edad de 48 años, es casada, y tiene 2 hijos de 20 y 14 de edad que son su mayor prioridad. El quiere comprar materiales para insumos para aplique al cultivo. Cuenta con un área de café que ya ha producido varias  cosechas adecuadas y de buena calidad. El dinero ayudará en poder mantener el cultivo en buen estado y mejorar las cosechas. Tiene varios años que se dedica a su finca y quiere crecer. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibida de FUDECOSUR y esta contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Desea tener más ingresos para mejorar el estado del cultivo y mejorar el estado de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge is 48 years old and is married with 2 children, ages 20 and 14. His children are his highest priority. He would like to buy agricultural supplies for his fields. Jorge has land planted with coffee that has produced many good high-quality harvests. 

The loan money will help Jorge maintain his crops and improve his yields. He has been working this land for many years and would like to expand his operation. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR [the Kiva field partner] and he is happy with the opportunities that they have given him. He would like to increase his income in order to improve his crops and provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: Help with coffee farm

loans.name: G.s. G.m.s Group

texts.es: La Señoras Maria Ignacia, Flor de Maria y José Antonio. Conforman el grupo solidario G.M.S.  Ellos tienen diferentes actividades económicas, son personas muy luchadoras que les gusta mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. Flor se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 4 años. Ella es una madre muy responsable y abnegada, siempre se ha preocupado por mejorar las condiciones de su hogar. José que tiene su negocio que es venta de pelibuey, hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio, pues siempre está dispuesto a mejorar su condición de vida. Es así que ellos se han unido para invertir en sus negocios.
texts.en: Mary Ignacia, Flower of Mary and José Antonio belong to the group called G.M.S. They work in different businesses. They are people that struggle to improve the lives of themselves and their families. Flower of Mary has been selling clothes since she was four years old. She is a responsible and selfless mother. She is always concerned about improving the condition of her home. José has sold sheep for the past four years. He is always trying to improve his quality of life. This is how they are united in order to invest in their businesses.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Narcisa Monserrate

texts.es:
Narcisa vende productos Yambal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes). Vive con su esposo en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil). 

Para mantener a su hijo con los gastos escolares ella empezó a trabajar vendiendo productos Yambal. Poco a poco incremento su cartera de clientes porque trabaja desde muy temprano ofreciendo los productos recorriendo las calles, vende perfumes desde $ 15.00 hasta $ 55.00 c/u, cremas muy económicas. En la actualidad tiene la idea de surtir su mercadería con ropa para que lo clientes tengan más variedad al comprar. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos Yambal como perfumes, cremas y ropa para iniciar con las ventas. En el futuro quiere vender otra clase de productos y dirigir sus ventas en otros lugares.
texts.en:
Narcisa sells products produced by Yanbal, a company that offers women entrepreneurs a means of making a living independently. She lives with her husband in Primavera de Duran, a degraded area on the outskirts of Guayaquil.
 
She started selling Yanbal products to pay for her son's schooling. She has steadily expanded her customer base as she gets out early in the morning to sell her wares, which include very affordable personal care products. She would like to acquire a stock of clothes in order to offer a greater range of products to her customers.
 
With the loan, she will buy Yanbal products, such as perfumes, creams and clothing. In the future, she would like to sell other types of products and expand sales to other areas.

loans.use: Buy cosmetics and clothing for resale

loans.name: Sharuwa

texts.en:
Sharuwa N. is 19 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda.  She is single and has one child.  Sharuwa has a business of stone quarrying, which she has had for one year. She also sells vegetables.  

To help expand her business, Sharuwa has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase both stone quarrying materials and vegetables.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sharuwa hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Sharuwa hopes to own a plot of land.    Sharuwa is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by reading story books.

loans.use: To purchase stone quarrying materials and vegetables

loans.name: Tuwisana Plus Group

texts.en:
Célestin K. is the president of the Community Bank named Tuwisana Plus, which is composed of 17 microentrepreneurs. These members are united by the same goal:  To grow their businesses by loans received from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC. 

Célestin is 60 years old. His main activity is selling packages. He buys them in bulk and resells them via retail at a profit. He sells his products daily at the market in his area, west of Kinshasa.

Célestin started his business in 1990. He is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having six times obtained and repaid loans. His next loan will allow him to buy packages in larger quantities to increase his sales in order to make a better profit. Célestin makes a profit of about US $180 per week. With this increased profit, he plans to buy food and  and pay school fees for his children. He is married and the father of eight children between 11 and 31 years old. Four of them attend school. He is also responsible for another child left by his relative.

loans.use: To buying packages in larger quantities to resell

loans.name: Moeumu

texts.en:
Moeumu F., age 35, is a farmer. She plants and harvests taro for sale. Moeumu has many years of experience in this business. She needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve and expand the business. She and her husband have five children.

In 2008, Moeumu  joined SPBD.  This is her fourth loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Moeumu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome for her taro crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build two rooms in his parents' house

loans.name: Thandiwe Group

texts.en:
Reginah is 52 years old and married with 5 children, ages 12 to 26. She sells live chickens at her home in Empangeni in South Africa (KZN). She has been in this business for one and a half years. She also earns income from the government’s child support grant. She says that the main challenges to her business are the death of chickens when there is heavy rain and when the chickens lose weight due to disease, making them unsellable.

She requested this loan through Women’s Development Businesses (WDB) to buy more live chickens. She says that the extra income from this loan will help feed her family and provide her children with proper school facilities. In the future, she would like to have a decent shelter for her chickens. She would also like to have a machine for keeping the chicken eggs warm. 

In the photo she is standing on the left wearing a purple skirt. Reginah says she is looking forward to being honest and committing herself in working with WDB and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy live chickens for resale

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila A. is from the village of Nazareth, Osmeña, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 52 years old,  is widowed, and has two adult children.

Leonila owns and operates a a food stall selling fruits, vegetables, herbs and spices in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately PHP 6,000 a month.

In 2008, Leonila joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of PHP 6,000 from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Leonila is requesting a new loan of PHP 10,000 which will again be used to purchase fresh fruits and vegetables to sell. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from this loan investment to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fresh fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Arcelita

texts.en:
Arcelita is a 54-year-old married who supports her family by selling frozen foods and meat.  She lives in Narra, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000. Arcelita is borrowing PHP 10,000 to fund her frozen foods business. This will be her ninth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 13,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Arcelita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Maria Yrene

texts.es:
Maria tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Vive con su familia en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde hace 3 años, cuenta con una bodega donde vende a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. La bodega está situada en su domicilio. Actualmente, desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería. También, desea responder a la demanda para útiles escolares durante esta temporada escolar. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles. Con esta inversión, Maria puede lograr mayores ganancias y seguir invirtiendo en su negocio. Maria es un cliente recurrente de Edpyme y ha cumplido con sus otras obligaciones de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Maria is 22 years old, single, and doesn't have any children.  She lives with her family in Tambogrande district, an agricultural area located in Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

For 3 years, María has owned a grocery store where she sells essentials and groceries to her neighbors and customers from the area.  The store is located in her home.  María would currently like to expand her business by purchasing more merchandise.  She would also like to respond to the demand for school supplies during the current back-to-school season.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  With this investment, María will be able to make more profits and continue investing in her business.  She is a long-standing client of Edpyme and has made her previous repayments punctually.

loans.use: to buy school supplies to sell

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin, de 24 años de edad, natural del distrito de Ayacucho, vive separado de su pareja y juntos tienen 01 hija llamada Yohalibet de 06 años, él es un padre responsable no descuida de sus deberes  como progenitor y se dedica a pasar la manutención mensualmente, tiene casa propia a medio construir en la comunidad de Sampantuari Alta situado en el distrito de Quimbiri. Edwin, es campesino  sus padres le enseñaron este oficio desde muy niño, desde entonces trabaja en sus propias tierras desde hace 06 años, en donde cultiva los siguientes productos: plantas de cacao, café, y hojas de coca.  En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros. Sabe muy bien que el dinero que obtiene es gracias a la buena producción de sus frutos y por ello son comercializados en la ciudad de San Francisco y Quimbiri, lugares donde mejores precios le ofrecen por la calidad de sus granos de café, cacao así como las hojas de coca. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar, ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de maderas y calaminas ya que tiene planeado construir su propia vivienda a base de material rustico. Considera que lo más difícil es trasladar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los secaderos que están ubicados a 2 horas de caminata. Más adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras, para aumentar su producción. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, afirma que el dinero del crédito le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo y se siente muy agradecido con la institución por concederle el préstamo. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará madera y calaminas, para construir su propia casa.
texts.en: Edwin is 24 years old and a native of Ayacucho.  He lives separately from his partner and they have a 6-year-old daughter named Yohalibet.  He is a responsible parent and does not neglect his duties as a father, paying monthly support.  He has his own house which is half-built in the community of Sampantuari Alta, located in the District of Quimbiri.  Edwin is a farmer and his parents taught him the trade when he was very young.  Since then, he has worked his own lands for the past six years where he grows the following products: cacao plants, coffee, and coca leaves.  During the harvest, he has the help of workers.  He knows very well that the money he earns is thanks to the good fruit production, which is why he sells them in the cities of San Francisco and Quimbiri where they pay him higher prices for the quality of his coffee beans, cacao, and coca leaves.  What he likes most about his work is the harvest, as he feels as though the months of hard work pay off in the quality of his fruits.  The loan requested is for the purchase of wood and corrugating roofing, as he plans to build his home using rustic materials.  He considers the most difficult part to be transporting his products from the farm to the dryers, located two hours away on foot.  In the future, he hopes to buy new lands to increase his production.  This is his first loan with MFP and he says that the loan will help him greatly to progress with his work.  He feels grateful to the lending institution for granting him the loan.  With the 1,500 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) requested, he will purchase wood and corrugated roofing to build his house.

loans.use: to buy woof and corrugated roofing to build his house.

loans.name: Rakita Ole

texts.en: Rakita Ole N. is 36 years old, married and has two children. He has been a farmer for the past three years and has a monthly income of 7,500 KES. He has applied for his first loan from Kiva partner, KADET, which he will use to buy farm inputs. With the profits generated, he plans to pay school fees for his children. Rakita dreams of being a prominent farmer. He is an assiduous man who works with effort to attain more, not withstanding limited resources.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCION-ANTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Anta, perteneciente a la provincia D. Anta y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Alejandrina; ella tiene 57 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 8 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. agricultura y crianza D. animales como vacas y ella tiene unas tierras D. cultivo donD. siembra habas,trigo,papa y maíz y luego los venD. en las distintas ferias que se realiza en el distrito D. Anta y los días domingos se dedica a la venta D. comida, la socia por medio D. estos negocios saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere seguir apoyando a su hijos que está estudiando para operar maquina. La socia solicita el préstamo para pagar la mensualidad del estudio D. su hijo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is a member of the "Virgen Inmaculada Concepción-Anta" community bank which is located in Anta district, in Anta province and department.

Alejandrina is 57 years old, married, and has eight children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business farming and raising animals such as cows.  She has some farmland where she grows beans, wheat, potatoes and corn which she then sells in the different street markets which are held in Anta district.  On Sundays, she sells food.  Through her businesses, she gets her children ahead in life.  Alejandrina would like to continue supporting her children.  One of her sons is studying to operate machinery.  She is requesting this loan to pay his monthly tuition payment.

Alejandrina is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to pay her son's monthly tuition fee

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 51 años, asegura que se siente feliz al haber conformado una familia unida. Pues se casó hace varios años y fruto esta relación tiene dos hijos. Maria desde hace 10 años que se dedica al negocio de venta de adornos y autopartes, ella tiene una puesto de venta alquilado en el centro comercial “Auto Partes San Pedro” y hay veces viaja a la ciudad de Lima para comprar mercadería y en otras ocasiones sus proveedoras le envían de la ciudad de Lima. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Juntos Unidos”, y este es el quinceavo ciclo de crédito con La Asociación Arariwa, donde está seguro que accederá a futuros créditos porque refiere que con sus ahorros, sus pagos puntuales, más el trabajo activo que desempeña en su banco comunal garantizan como una persona responsable. Con el dinero solicitado, invertirá en el pago de la mercadería que le proveerán por ejemplo le van a traer adorno, pararrayos, radios, faros y otras cosas más.
texts.en:
María is 51 years old and says that she feels happy to have created a united family.  She married years ago and has two children.  For ten years, María has been selling decorative accessories and spare parts for cars.  She has a rented sales location in the "Auto Partes San Pedro" shopping center.  Sometimes she travels to the city of Lima to buy merchandise and sometimes her suppliers send her goods from the city of Lima.

María is a member of the "Juntos Unidos" community bnk and this is her 15th loan cycle with Asociación Arariwa.  She is certain that she will access future loans because her savings, her punctual repayments and the active work that she carries out as a member of her community bank all guarantee her as a responsible person.

María will use the money she has requested to invest in buying merchandise from her suppliers such as decorative accessories, lightning conductors, radios, headlamps, etc.

loans.use: to invest in buying merchandise from her suppliers such as decorative accessories, lightning conductors, radios, headlamps, etc.

loans.name: Franklin Sergio

texts.es:
Franklin de 30 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (llamado así porque en su originalidad había muchas flores orquídeas) de Guayaquil. Es soltero. Su actividad comercial es la venta de jugos y  batidos.

Comenzó hace un tiempo atrás en una carreta que era de sus mama y un día con unos ahorros que tenia por medio de eso se compro su propia carreta y desde ese entonce le gusta esa actividad. Labora de 6H00 am a 15H00 pm diariamente. Vende en su carreta jugos naturales a 0,30 , batidos de todo sabor a 0.60 y tostadas a 0.60 cada uno. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar para su negocio tostadora industrial licuadoras y varios frutas para tener mas variedad e incrementar sus ganancias. En un futuro desea comprarse una casa y un vehículo.
texts.en:
Franklin is 30 years old and lives in an urban area of Las Orquídeas (which is so called because there used to be many orchids to be found there), in Guayaquil.  He is single and his business activity is selling juices and smoothies.

Franklin started his business some time ago using a cart that belonged to his mom.  One day, with some savings that he had, he bought his own cart and, since then, he has enjoyed his business.  He works from 6.00am to 3.00pm every day.  He sells natural juices for 0.30, different flavored smoothies for 0.60 and tostadas for 0.60 each.  With the help of this loan, he would like to buy an industrial toaster, blenders and various fruit so that he can offer a wider variety of products and increase his profits.  In the future, he would like to buy a house and a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy an industrial toaster and blenders

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKADI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43ans, 4enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à  ZERLABA, un des villages de la commune de PIMPERNA dans la préfecture de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : la tomate et le jakatou avec  GNIRE 1ère à gauche position debout de la photo.
 Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et les semences pour entretenir : 1hectare. 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du village et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 145.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter au mieux son espace cultural pour en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The ten members of Benkadi 1 Group ("Harmony") are married women who, on average, are 43 years old and have four children. Most of them live in polygamous families. They live in Zerlaba, one of the villages in the municipality of Pimperna in the prefecture of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to finance their agricultural business during the winter season. This is their seventh loan with the institution, the previous loans having been repaid on schedule.

They grow tomatoes and jakatous (a vegetable that resembles a small green tomato but is actually a member of the eggplant family). Gnire, who grows jakatous, is pictured standing at the left. She intends to use her loan to pay for plowing and buy supplies and seeds to cultivate one hectare of farmland. The harvest will be sold in her village and at the market in Sikasso a clientele made up of men and women.

Gnire expects to make an average profit of 145,500 CFA francs per season, which she will use to repay her loan and help her husband to cover daily household expenses. She wants to keep alive her cooperation with Soro Yiriwaso to best farm her land and earn more income from her activity.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and buy supplies and seeds.

loans.name: Dorris

texts.en:
Dorris is 42 years old and lives in Paynesville. She’s married with three children aged 4 to 23; only two live at home, and all attend school. For the last four years, she has been selling children's clothes, men's clothes, women's clothes, etc.

Dorris has requested this loan to purchase more used clothes for adults and children. She says her problem is low inventory in the business. She started this business by helping her mother, so from that point on, she learned it. It makes her proud because it helps her to send her children to school. In the future, she would like to have her own shop.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for adults and children.

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es:
José, tiene un taller de estructuras metálicas y soldaduras, tiene 27 años de edad, vive con su esposa y un hijo de 2 años de edad, la vivienda es familiar, él inicio con el oficio como ayudante, luego se compro la maquinaria e inicio con su propio negocio, con ayuda de sus amigos y vecinos, trabaja de 8:00am a 4:00pm, desde hace 6 años.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de hierro (polín c), láminas, pintura, lijas, discos para pulidora, esta será una gran ayuda para José, pues tiene algunos contratos por iniciar y con este material podrá salir con todos los pedidos.
Su mayor sueño es tener su propia casa, que su negocio crezca además de dar a su hijo todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
José has a metal shop / welding shop.  He is 27 years old and lives with his wife and 2 year-old son in a house which belongs to a family member.  He started in his trade as an assistant, then bought the machinery he needed and set up his own business with the help of his friends and neighbors.  He works from 8.00am to 4.00pm and has been in business for 6 years.

José is currently requesting a loan to buy iron, sheets of metal, paint, sandpaper and polishing disks.  This will be a big help as he has some contracts to make a start on and, with these materials available, he will be able to fill his orders.

José's biggest dreams are to own his own home, for his business to grow, and to be able to provide his son with everything he needs.

loans.use: to buy iron, paint, sandpaper and polishing disks

loans.name: Gard

texts.en: Gard is an individual client from Kihihi. He is 29 years old and married with two children who are 4 and 2 years old. One of the children is already in school. Gard has a retail shop that sells general merchandise. In addition, he is involved in the sale of used clothes, especially bitengi, from Rukarara Cell and he is happy that his business is able to generate 200,000 shillings every week. He is also involved in the sale of produce, from which he got the start-up capital for the retail shop and selling clothes. His dream is to strive for business expansion and family development since he has managed to provide for his children. Gard needs a loan to be able to buy more clothes and shop items for resale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shop items for resale.

loans.name: Preciosa

texts.en:
Preciosa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Preciosa requested a loan of  PHP 19000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Preciosa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a Khanga’s, handbags and shoes selling business. (Khanga's are traditional pieces of fabric worn by East African women) She sells at retail and from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of Khanga’s, handbags, and shoes. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of Khanga’s, hand bags, and shoes.

loans.name: Khursandmurod

texts.ru: Хурсандмурод житель района Хуросон. Ему 24 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Хурсандмурод имеет средне - специальное образование, он электрик. По специальности работает два года. Кроме того он занимается растениеводством. У него рядом с домом имеется участок земли, где он выращивает овощи и кукурузу. Этим видом деятельности занимается шесть лет. Кредит берет для повторного посева. Он хочет купить семена и минеральные удобрения.
texts.en: Khursandmurod lives in the Khuroson district.  He is 24 years old, married and has four children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Khursandmurod has a secondary-specialized education; he is an electrician.  He has been working in this field for two years.  Besides this work, he is involved in agriculture.  He has a plot of land near his house, where he grows vegetables and corn.  He has been involved in this business for six years.  Khursandmurod is requesting this loan for a repeat sowing.  He wants to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for a repeat sowing

loans.name: Tebajjukira Development Group

texts.en:
"A prolific, lusty, trail blazing and purposeful enterpreneur" may be just the right words to describe 55-year-old Robert, who operates a retail enterprise in Lugazi. This enterprising father of 12 started giving a good account of himself in this trade a decade ago. Robert exudes nothing but confidence.
He set forth in his business on his own hook and all the strides he has made have come as a result of his unwavering and tenacious hard work ethic.
It’s fair to say Robert is now on the inside lane to become a past master in business. He has soaked up loads of experience, and day in, day out, Robert feels he is getting well posted with the nitty gritty and fundamentals of running a business. Does this spell success for his enterprise? In many respects it does.

He has been able to handle most of his adversity philosophically. Robert has also made sure he does not get complacent as his business grows. Before he nurtured the idea of bearing a hand in this business, Robert was mostly inclined to a coffee selling business. His auxiliary businesses (to wit, cattle and food sales) have aided him in the consolidation of his business profits. Weekly, Robert says this business generates him sales returns totaling to Uganda shillings 25,000.

The records indicate that Robert's group is on their 4th loan cycle. Their repayment record is up to the mark. Robert says he is going to use his loan proceeds to purchase more retail commodities such as maize flour, beans, rice, salt, sugar, etc. to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities such as maize flour, beans, rice, salt, sugar, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Madelyn has a shop that sells rice & flour per kilogram. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy sacks of rice & flour to sell.
Madelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Madelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice & flour to sell

loans.name: Twelwaneko Nabingoola Group

texts.en: Margret needs another loan to buy a microscope for her clinic. She used the previous loan to buy drugs for her clinic and has been able to save money from the profits earned. Her major challenge is lack of enough equipment to use and her dream is to have a fully equipped clinic. She is a member of the above mentioned group in which each member guarantees the other and their mission is to struggle and get out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy a microscope for her clinic.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel, de 46 años de edad; es una mujer separada, vive en su casa propia, ya que sus hijos son mayores de edad e independientes. Hace 15 años monto un negocio, con un Bar - Restaurante, y en ella cuenta con personal que atiende a la clientela. Pues para ella es importante que sus clientes estén satisfechos con la visita a su establecimiento. A Isabel, le gusta la actividad que realiza ya que le es rentable y es la manera más fácil de poder asegurar su calidad de vida, sin emnbargo es difícil no poder contar con una refrigeradora para mantener frescos los alimentos, como: verduras, carnes, entre otros alimentos. Aún así no pierde las esperanzas de hacer sus sueños realidad y lograr comprarse una refrigeradora. Este será su primer crédito con MFP y esta apta a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que desea acceder a otros préstamos posteriormente. Con los 1,500 soles que solicita podrá comprar una refrigeradora que le será útil en su Bar – Restaurante.
texts.en:
Isabel,aged 46, is separated from her husband and lives in her own home as her children are grown and financially independent.  For the last 15 years, she has had a Bar-Restaurant business, where she has staff who serve her customers.  It's important to her that her customers are satisfied with their visit to her establishment.  

Isabel enjoys her work, as it is profitable and the easiest way to be able to secure her quality of life.  However, it is difficult to keep her food, such as vegetables and meat among other things, fresh as she does not have a refrigerator.  She has not lost hope in making her dreams reality and being able to buy herself a refrigerator.  

This will be her first loan with MFP, and she is ready to make her repayments punctually as she wants to be able to get additional loans later on.

With the 1,500 Soles that she is requesting, she will be able to purchase a refrigerator that will be very useful for her Bar-Restaurant.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Adrienne

texts.fr:
Cliente de 48 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 15 et 25 ans.Elle s'est lancée dans la vente de la friperie , il y'a bientôt 30 ans.Elle achète des ballots de friperie comme des serviettes non utilisées, des peignoirs, et des draps. 
Elle a des stratégies de vente très efficace, elle achète des ballots de serviettes , draps et elle les vend aux clients par crédit et le reste , elle vend dans sa boutique.
Ayant déjà beneficiee de plusieurs prêts,elle a rembourse ses prêts avec succès et a fait des épargnes considérables.Ces prêts ont fortement changes les conditions de sa vie de famille, ses enfants fréquentent des universités privées et elle est entrain d'aider son mari a construire leur maison familiale.
texts.en:
Adrienne, aged 48, is married and the mother of four children aged between 15 and 25. She has been selling secondhand clothing for nearly 30 years. She buys bundles of secondhand clothes, such as unused towels, robes and sheets. Her sales strategy is very efficient. She buys bundles of towels and sheets, and then resells them on credit to her customers. Part of her sales is carried out in her store.

Adrienne was already granted several loans, which she paid off successfully and which enabled her to save a considerable amount of money. These loans have strongly improved the living condition of her family. Today her children attend private universities and she helps her husband with the construction of their family home.

loans.use: to buy bundles of unused towels, robes and sheets.

loans.name: Mbanacho Group

texts.en:
Fred is the facilitator of the Mbanacho group. Fred and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Fred takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund for One Acre Fund’s best prices and to access fertilizers and hybrid seed. In the recent 2011 season, Fred had a very good maize yield harvesting 12 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Fred was only able to harvest 2.5 bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Fred and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Fred will educate his children and invest in raising livestock
.
In 2012, the members of Mbanacho group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Fred is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
Amanda, de 30 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy trabajadora. Convive con su pareja con quien tiene cuatro hijos de 13, 10, 8 y 2 años, quienes estudian en el colegio secundario y primario respectivamente. Ella junto a sus hijos y su pareja, viven en su casa propia que pudo comprar con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio. Desde entonces, todos los días salen en busca de nuevos ingresos y mejores condiciones de vida para su familia.
El trabajo de Amanda, consiste en el alquiler de mototaxi, ella tiene una mototaxi que alquila desde muy temprano a un chofer,quien le paga un promedio de 25 soles al día  y que significa un ingreso adicional para ella. Además trabaja en un consorcio en el área de limpieza, tiene el apoyo incondicional de su parejas, quien trabaja en una mototaxi también haciendo el servicio de transporte de carga y pasajero. Se indicio con este negocio con la ayuda de su pareja y esto fue hace tres años. Le va bien pues tiene doble ingresos ya que trabaja ella, aparte alquila su mototaxi y su conviviente aporta con sus ingresos diarios a su hogar, al principio estaba un poco mal con su economía, pues ella solo dependía de su marido para tener algo de dinero en su hogar- Agradece mucho que pudo conseguir su trabajo, ya que significo un crecimiento para ella y su familia, ahora desea comprar una mototaxi mas, pero por ahora solo desea arreglar su vehículo. Este será el segundo préstamo con la institución MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Con el monto solicitado, comprará algunas piezas y más cosas que necesita su mototaxi, además pagará al mecánico que le dará mantenimiento a su unidad móvil.
texts.en:
Amanda is 30 years old and is a good, friendly, hard working woman.  She lives with her husband and they have four children, ages 13, 10, 8, and 2, who attend elementary and junior high school.  They live as a family in their own home that they were able to buy with lots of effort and sacrifice.  Since then they venture out daily in search of new income opportunities and better living conditions for their family.

Amanda’s work consists of renting out a moto-taxi to a driver who pays her 25 PEN per day; an extra income for her.  Aside from that, she also works in the cleaning industry and has the unconditional support of her family who also work with moto-taxis, providing transportation services for cargo and passengers.

She began this business with her husband’s help thirteen years ago.  Things are going well and she has two incomes since she works and rents out the moto-taxi.  Her husband also supports the household with his daily income.  At first she had a little financial trouble and she only depended on her husband’s income for the household.  She is very happy to have been able to get a job because it symbolized growth for her and her family.

She would like to buy another moto-taxi, but for now she wants to maintain her current vehicle.  This will be her second loan through MFP.  She is very grateful to know that she has financial backing.  This makes her feel secure and she is committed once again to make her payment as with the previous loans.  She will use the money to buy spare parts and a few other things that her moto-taxi needs.  She will also pay the mechanic who will do the work.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and pay a mechanic.

loans.name: Jefferson Alexi

texts.es:
Jefferson Alexi tiene 23 años de edad es soltero tiene dos hijas, vive con los padres y las hijas de 5 y 2 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
La VRC JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto El caimito, Perteneciente a la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo Corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol Gandul.
Jefferson se dedica a labores agrícolas siembra de maíz y arroz. Las compras y las ventas los realiza en ventanas, Solicita el crédito para trabajar en ele cultivo de maíz.
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar una desgranadora. El sueño es poder tener una casa propia.
Los desafíos a los que se ha enfrentado es las plagas en el cultivo.
En los tiempos libres le gusta practicar el indor futbol.

Con la ayuda del CREDITO ANTERIOR ha podido invertir en el cultivo de maíz ha comprado abonos agrícolas. 
"Está muy agradecido por la ayuda prestada",
texts.en:
Jefferson Alexi is 23 years old, single and has two daughters.  He lives with his parents and his daughters who are 5 and 2 years old in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The “Jerusalen” communal bank is located in Recinto El Caimito belonging to Puerto Pechiche Parish, Pueblo Viejo Canton.  This communal bank carries out short cycle corn, rice and pigeon pea farming.

Jefferson is a corn and rice farmer.  His purchases and his sales take place in Ventanas.  He requests the loan for his corn crops.  With help from the loan he will be able to buy a corn kernel remover.  His dream is to have a house of his own.  The challenge he’s faced is pest infestations of his crops.  In his free time he likes playing Indor soccer.

With help from his previous loan he was able to invest in his corn crops buying farm manure.  He is very happy for the help provided.

loans.use: to buy a corn kernel remover.

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es:
Mauricio, vive con su esposa y su hijo de 15 años de edad, él se dedica a vender agua embotellada, este oficio lo inicio hace diez años trabaja de 7: am a 5: pm de lunes a domingo. 
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar una bicicleta, para poder repartir agua  embotellada y de esa forma podrá tener más facilidad y rapidez con la entrega de la venta.
El sueño de seguir trabajando,tener más clientes, mejorar su negocio y poder darles a su familia lo mejor.
texts.en:
Mauricio, vive con su esposa y su hijo de 15 años de edad, él se dedica a vender agua embotellada, este oficio lo inicio hace diez años trabaja de 7: am a 5: pm de lunes a domingo. 
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar una bicicleta, para poder repartir agua  embotellada y de esa forma podrá tener más facilidad y rapidez con la entrega de la venta.
El sueño de seguir trabajando,tener más clientes, mejorar su negocio y poder darles a su familia lo mejor.

loans.use: Para comprar una bicicleta .

loans.name: Francisca Marlene
