texts.es: Francisca Marlene es una emprendedora de éxito, su actividad económica a la que se  dedica es a la venta de ropa nueva en el cual tiene mucha experiencia en el negocio, su perseverancia que tiene le ha permitido llegar muy lejos de crear su propia herramienta  de trabajo. Esta actividad económica a la se dedica Francisca la realiza de forma ambulante  lo cual le permite tener muchos clientes. .Francisca con el financiamiento que Fundación León 2000, le ha brindado  le ha permitido mejorar mucho en todo los aspecto en lo personal y en el negocio, aumentando su mercadería y sus clientes, su esposo la apoya en todo ambos han salido adelante para darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Francisca está solicitando financiamiento para invertir en mercadería en el negocio.
texts.en: Francisca Marlene is a successful entrepreneur.  Her economic activity is the sale of new clothing and she has a lot of experience in the business.  Her perseverance has allowed her to get very far in creating a source of employment for herself.  Francisca makes her sales going door to door, which allows her to have many customers.  With the loan that Fundación León 2000 has offered her, Francisca has been able to greatly improve aspects of her personal life and her business, increasing her merchandise and her customers.  Her husband supports her in everything and both have pressed forward in order to give their children a better quality of life.  Francisca is requesting the loan to invest in merchandise for her business.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes.

loans.name: Eduardo Luis

texts.es: Eduardo vive con su cónyuge y su hijo de 6 años de edad al sur occidente de la ciudad. Con su negocio de vender frutas y verduras, ha logrado el sostenimiento de su hogar y hoy quiere hacerlo crecer, aplicando inyecciones de capital de trabajo a él, pues en las épocas de mayor movimiento comercial, como las de fin de año, su capital de trabajo se torna insuficiente para responderle a su clientela, que día  a día crece más. Su meta es lograr tener su propia casa y por eso trabaja esforzándose en todo momento, con el fin de lograr aumentar el bienestar de su hogar. Eduardo estudió hasta octavo grado de bachillerato y cuando se organizó en familia, casi inmediatamente terminó este grado,  generó esta idea emprendedora para lograr sostener su hogar; su experiencia data desde hace mas de treinta años,  cuando apoyaba a su madre en el comercio de verduras también,  en un lugar ubicado al centro de la ciudad. Sus ventas las hace diariamente y sus compras también, posee una clientela que lo reconoce y que ya le hace encargos, pues identifica la calidad de las frutas y verduras que vende Eduardo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará zanahoria, cebollín, papa, habichuela y uvas, productos que mas vende a final de año donde las familias la consumen como insumo de los deliciosos pasteles criollos que vienen con tres carnes y con mucha verdura y porque cada uno en la familia cuenta con 12 uvas, para esperar el año nuevo con su 12 tradicionales deseos.
texts.en:
Eduardo lives with his wife and his six year old son to the southwest of the city.  With his business of selling fruits and vegetables he has managed to support his household.  Now, he wants to make it grow by infusing it with work capital.

During the times of greater commercial movement, like the end of the year, he does not have enough working capital.  This means he cannot meet his customers’ needs, which grow more every day.

His goal is to manage to have his own house.  That is why he makes an effort all of the time in order to increase the well-being of his household.

Eduardo went to school up until the eighth grade, high school.  When he formed his family he almost immediately finished this grade.  He developed this enterprising idea to support his household.  His experience dates back to over 30 years ago when he helped his mother, who also sold vegetables in a place in the center of the city.

He makes his purchases and sales every day.  He has a customer base that knows him and places orders with him.  They recognize the quality of the fruits and vegetables that Eduardo sells.

He is currently requesting a Kiva loan, his first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use the loan to buy carrots, scallions, potatoes, beans, and grapes.  These are the products that sell the most at the end of the year.  The families use them as ingredients for the delicious Creole pastries that come with three meats and a lot of vegetables.  Also, each member of the family has 12 grapes to await the New Year with their 12 traditional wishes.

loans.use: to buy carrots, scallions, potatoes, beans, and grapes.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en: Prossy is married with three children and all go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members . She sales fruits and vegetables and has been in this business for 2 years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy mangoes,tomatoes,oranges,pineapples,onions.  She works seven days a week.Her major challenge include perishablilty of fruits and vegetables.  She would like to buy a fridge to keep her fruits fresh.  She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy mangoes,tomatoes,oranges,pineapples,onions.

loans.name: Sokeang's Group

texts.en:
From Kandal province, Sokeang is a 28-year-old married mother of two dependent children, one of whom is in school while the other is under the age of school. Working for a garment factory and growing rice are businesses earned as income to support family’s living. She earns about USD12 per day and can save about USD7.5 each day for future needs. 
This is the first loan for her with VisionFund and she, the group leader of four members, will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer to improve her farmland. She hopes that she will get more yields to uplift lifestyle and to keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer to improve farmland to keep sending her children to school.

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.en:
Mrs. Elisabeth O. is a 45 year old woman. She is married and the mother of two (02) children. Very active, she has spent 25 years running a business selling seals, dishpans, and other plastic items. Starting off on her own, she was unable to enlarge her business to obtain adequate revenue to contribute to household expenses. With her first two loans of $350 and $650, obtained and repaid without incident, she was able to build up her business a little bit. However, it turned out to be insufficient to respond to the demand of her market.

Today, Mrs. O. is asking for a loan of $1000 to strengthen her business. This loan will serve as capital to buy seals and dishpans in bulk, as well as iceboxes, to attract more clients and increase sales. This will allow her to generate enough revenue to help improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame O. Elisabeth est une femme de 45 ans, elle est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants. Très active, elle exerce il y a 25 ans le commerce de vente des sceaux, bassines et autres articles en plastique. Débutant avec son propre moyen, elle n’arrive pas à accroître ses activités pour en tirer de revenus adéquats en vue de contribuer aux charges du ménage. Avec ses deux premiers crédits respectifs de $350 et $650 obtenus et remboursés sans incident, elle a pu rehausser tout petit peu son activité. Mais, ils s’avèrent insuffisants pour répondre à la demande de son marché

Aujourd’hui, Madame O. sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour renforcer ses activités. Ce crédit lui servira de fonds de commerce pour acheter des sceaux et bassines en gros ainsi que des glacières pour attirer plus de clientèle et augmenter son chiffre d’affaires. Ceci lui permettra de dégager un revenu adéquat pour contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: To buy and resell seals, dishpans, and iceboxes

loans.name: Brenda Yamileth

texts.en: My name is Brenda Z. and I have been making and selling baked goods such as pies, cakes, pastries and quesadillas for three years. My clients are very good since I distribute my product to small supermarkets and grocery stores. I also do special orders for meetings, parties, birthdays and weddings. My goal is to increase production to increase sales. With the earnings I would be able to hire someone to help me with production as well as pay for private schooling for my daughter and feed my family.

loans.use: Purchase of flour, salt, food coloring, artificial flavors, sugar, eggs, butter, oil, milk and water.

loans.name: Nasy

texts.en: Nasy S. has been married 16 years and has six children. She has only one loom at home and is weaving by herself. She has been a weaver since she was 16 years old, and learned this skill from her neighbor. Sometimes, her daughters help her to weave after they come home from school. Her children are still young and all of them are in school. After school, they help their parents look after the cows and weave the silk. Her husband, Mr. HAM Hoeurn, purchases and sells cows in nearby villages. He learned this business from friends in the same village over the last 6 years. Since the family started borrowing loans from MAXIMA, the family business has become more profitable and has enabled them to send all of the children to school.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and supplies for cows

loans.name: Chhoeun

texts.en: Mrs. Chhoeun S. P. is 41 years old and lives in Kampong Cham province with her husband and their three children.  Mrs. Chhoeun sells coffee to the local villagers, earning about $2/day.  Her husband is a taxi driver, who earns about $5/day.  This loan will be used to purchase a car for the taxi business.  Ownership of the car will help to drive down the family's costs in the long run.

loans.use: To purchase a car for a taxi business

loans.name: Sarvinoz

texts.en: Sarvinoz K. is 22 years old, she has a secondary education.  Three years ago she started her business.  She has rented space and started selling.  At first it was just food, but lately she has also started dealing phone cards.  This kind of service has high demand and brings Sarvinoz good profits.  For the loan amount for $1200 she is going increase the range of foods she carries and start selling cell phones.  This loan will help Sarvinoz K. to achieve this growth.  Locals can buy food near where they live and can get cell phone service nearby.  The client is going to pay off the loan in 12 months.

loans.use: to increase revenue and expand business

loans.name: Victoria Feliciana

texts.es:
Feliciana is happy because everyday she can contribute to her household economy by growing and nurturing her animals. She raises piglets, cows, and bulls. She takes these animals to a cattle fair on her locality and currently the number of animals she owns has grown thanks to the care she gives them. She is originally from Chambara, she was born and raised in a farming family and now she is happily married and has five children. Her children are all that she could live for. She wakes up very early everyday so she can take care of her children and then she goes off to the field so her animals can eat, after a very intense day she goes back home to get the energy to continue with her daily chores. Thanks to this activity she has been able to provide for her family. She has many desires to keep working this way, improve her stables, and give better quality food to her animals so they will fatten. She requests a loan so she can keep giving support to her children’s education. Let’s help Feliciana in her desire to grow excellent professionals and men of good.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva volunteer

Feliciana, está feliz porque día a día puede aportar a la economía de su hogar mediante la crianza y engorde a de sus animales, ella cría cerditos pero sobre todo vacas y toros que los lleva a una feria ganadera de su localidad y actualmente el número de sus animalitos se ha incrementado por la constancia y la dedicación en el cuidado que les otorga.Ella es natural de Chambara, nació y creció en una familia netamente ganadera y hoy felizmente casada y con 5 hijos, que mueven todo su existir, trabaja diariamente levantándose muy temprano para poder atender a sus hijos y luego irse al campo para que sus animales obtengan de la naturaleza sus propios alimentos, después de un día intenso regresa en las tardes a su casa para reponer sus fuerzas y continuar diariamente con sus labores.Gracias a esta actividad que realiza ha podido apoyar a su familia. Tiene muchos anhelos de seguir trabajando de esta manera pero para mejorar sus establos y darles mejor calidad de alimentos para su engorde, solicita un préstamo, esto le favorecerá para poder seguir dando a sus hijos el sustento para su educación.Apoyemos a Feliciana en sus grandes deseos de ver a sus hijos convertidos en excelentes profesionales y hombres de bien.

loans.use: Compra de alimento y herramientas para renovar las instalaciones del establo.

loans.name: Maman

texts.fr:
Maman A. is a dedicated woman who has been selling yams at the market in Assahoun for eight years. She is 39 and a married mother of two children. The successful management of her business has allowed her to earn an income to help meet her family’s needs. She has been a FECECAV client for three years and has already received and repaid three loans. With this new loan, Maman would like to increase her working capital so she can build up her inventory and meet her customers’ demand.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Maman A. est une femme dévouée qui vend des ignames au marché d'Assahoun depuis 8 ans. Elle agée de 39 ans , mariée et mère de 2 anfants. Elle exerce avec succès son activité qui lui procure des revenus pour la contribution des charges familiales. Elle cliente de FECECAV depuis 3 ans et a bénéficié de 3 crédits qu'elle payé avec succès. Avec le présent crédit Maman voudrait renforcer son fonds de roulement afin d'acrroître son stock pour la satisfaction de sa clientèle

loans.use: Purchase of yams in neighboring villages to resell them in Assahoun

loans.name: Peace

texts.en: Miss. Peace O. is 37 years old and lives in Benin City where she operates her restaurant business. She is asking for the loan of $450 to enable her by more foodstuffs and drinks. She started her trade in 2001. She has been an LAPO member.

loans.use: To buy more food to cook and sell

loans.name: Damaris Carolina

texts.es:
In the city of León in the town of El Sauce, Señora Damaris L. has for ten years been dedicated to the business of selling clothes and footwear from her home.

She is a married mother with a young son. She makes a grand effort to meet all his needs. A problem that Señora Damaris has faced is that due to her difficult economical situation, she has had moments in which she hasn't met with sufficient capital to acquire the clothing and footwear products to sell.

For this reason she requests a loan from Ceprodel to allow a boost in her business and merchandise. This will enable her to continue maintaining her home. So far she has received three successful loans with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

En la ciudad de León específicamente en el municipio de El Sauce, la señora Damaris L. desde hace diez años se dedica al negocio de la venta de ropa y calzados teniendo su negocio en sus propio hogar de habitación.

Es madre casada y con un pequeño hijo a su cargo, por tal motivo se esfuerza grandemente para suplir todas las necesidades de su hijo. Una problemática que ha atravesado la señora Damaris es que a pesar de su difícil situación económica ha habido momentos en los cuales no ha contado con el capital suficiente para adquirir de sus proveedores la ropa y el calzado para comercializarlos.

Por este motivo acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con créditos que le permitan surtir su negocio de mercadería y de esta manera continuar con el mantenimientos de su hogar de habitación. Actualmente su record es de tres créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: Buy merchandise like clothes and footwear.

loans.name: Namayemba East C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Joy N.. She is currently in the business of selling clothes and is requesting a loan to boost business. Joy is 34 years old and is married. She has 5 children ranging from age 4 to 13 and her children go to school. Each week, Joy makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land. Joy has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Joy is joined in her small group by Rose A., Florence O., Umice A., and Beatrice A.. Rose A. has a business selling clothes and wants to add more capital. Florence O. is currently operating a business in shoe sales and wants a loan to purchase more shoes to sell. Umice A. operates a business selling charcoal and wants to increase her inventory. Beatrice A. is currently in the business of running a restaurant and is requesting a loan to buy more furniture.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and increase stock

loans.name: Emokpae

texts.en: Mr. Emokpae P. is 37 years old, married, and has a child. He hails from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. He sells notebooks and textbooks. He has been in this business since 2001. Mr. P. is requesting a loan of $875 to enable him to buy more notebooks and textbooks for sale. He thanks you.

loans.use: To buy books for sale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Mrs. Elizabeth A. is 38 years of age and she lives in Benin City. She is married with 5 children. She sells local soap, a business that she learnt for 1 year and then started on her own in 2006. She is requesting a loan of $450 to enable her to buy more materials to produce and sell the soap locally known as soda. She has been in LAPO for 1 year as a dedicated client.

loans.use: To buy more Materials for the production and sale of soap

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Afi K. is 34 years old, married, and the mother of three. She is a food retailer in the marketplace in Adéta, a village located about 150 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. She is a specialist in making "pâte", a traditional dish that is consumed by the entire local population. With this loan, her second from FECECAV, Ms. K. hopes to buy corn and some indispensable ingredients for making it. The profits that will be earned from her sales will enable her to support her children and to improve their living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame Afi K. est âgée de 34 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de nourriture au marché d’Adéta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise. Elle est spécialisée dans la préparation de « la pâte, » un plat traditionnel consommé par toute la population locale. Avec ce crédit, son deuxième de FECECAV, Madame K. espère acheter du maïs, et des ingrédients indispensables à la préparation. Les profits qui se dégageront de ses ventes lui permettront de supporter ses enfants et améliorer leurs conditions de vie.

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente’s family consists of his two children, who are 2 and 11 years old. The three of them live in their house, which they own. The family’s primary source of income is passenger transport on the Chane Ind. Minero y Montero route. His wife works as a primary teacher in the town of Puerto Fernandez. There is a lot of competition in the public transportation sector, but he is widely preferred because he is popular in the neighborhood. With this current loan request he will buy a computer system, which costs approximately Bs. 8,000.00. Vicente has good credit references.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La familia de Vicente está conformada por sus dos hijos de 2 y 11 años respectivamente, los tres residen en su domicilio que es propio. La actividad principal de la familia es el servicio de transporte con ruta Chane Ind. Minero y Montero, su conyugue trabaja como docente en la comunidad de Puerto Fernandez en el nivel primario. Dentro de lo que se refiere a transporte público hay bastante competencia pero tiene bastante preferecia por ser popular en la zona. Con la presente solicitud adquirirá un equipo de computación que tiene un costo aproximado de Bs. 8,000.-. Vicente tiene muy buenas referencias crediticias en el sistema financiero.

loans.use: To buy a computer system

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gladys is 34 years old ans she studied until 5th grade of secondary school. She is married and has 3 kids who still depend on her.

She currently works making sheets, curtains, pillows and she does this according to the demand of the clients in this market, thanks to the support of her husband and eldest son.

Gloria is a member of the group 'Lupakas' in the community of Huariquisana in the district of Pilcuyo in the province of El Collao llave in the region of Puno. She became a member of the group with the objective of buying more material and a sewing machine.

With the first loan of 300 soles she bought 15 sheets of 2 layers and with this she has, bit by bit, increased her capital and the merchandise of her business.

With the loan of 2300 soles which she will pay back in 4 months, she will buy material to make 200 sheets of 2 layers which she will give to her friends and intermediaries in the cities of Juliaca, Puno and Llave.

She is very happy as her business is growing each day and her earnings have improved considerably over the last few years.

Her future vision is to have a small workshop in the city of Llave and have her kids be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Gloria tiene 34 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto de secundaria, es casada y tiene tres hijos que aún dependen de ella. Actualmente se dedica a las actividades económicas de confección de sabanas, cortinas, conchas, almohadas y elaboración de sojas, estas actividades vienen trabajando de acuerdo a la demanda de los clientes del mercado, gracias al apoyo de su esposo y su hijo mayor. Gloria, es parte del Banco Comunal de Lupakas de la comunidad de Huariquisana, del distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia de El Collao Ilave y región de Puno. Su pertenencia al Banco fue con el objetivo de comprar más telas y maquina de coser. Ella con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compró para 15 sabanas de 2 plazas, con ello poco a poco ha incrementado su capital y mercadería para su negocio. Con el préstamo de S/. 2,300.00 nuevos soles, el cual será pagado en cuatro meses lo invertirá en la compra de telas para elaborar 200 sabanas de dos plazas, ello lo entregará al por mayor a sus amigos e intermediarios, en las ciudades de Juliaca, Puno e Ilave. Ella esta muy feliz, ya que sus negocios están creciendo día a día y además sus ingresos a mejorado considerablemente en los últimos años. Su visión futura es tener un taller de confección en la ciudad de Ilave e hijos profesionales.

loans.use: To buy material in bulk/Compra de telas al por mayor.

loans.name: Viktor

texts.en:
Viktor is married and lives in Kahovka, a town in Kherson region.  He works as a taxi driver. He loves being self-employed and managing his own time. Viktor has a nice car and offers taxi services around his region. He is a workaholic and is always ready to work non-stop, even on the weekend. Viktor has been in this business for 3 years and his monthly profit is about $400. 

Viktor is requesting a loan of 5000 Grivnas ($1075) to cover some of the current vehicle maintenance expenses to keep his taxi in good working order.  This will generate additional profit as he finds more clients. This business is a crucial segment of his life since it is Viktor's opportunity to support his family.

loans.use: To generate additional profit

loans.name: Sao

texts.en: Sao S., 27, is married and lives with her husband and one little child in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is a garment factory worker and makes US$2.50 each day. Her husband works growing rice, corn, and beans, making US$3 each day. Sao S. is asking for a loan of US$600 to purchase a water pump, fertilizers, and rice seeds for her husband. She sees this purchase as a good investment to expand her husband's business, and she is confident it will increase the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump, fertilizers, and rice seeds.

loans.name: Tinh Thi

texts.vi: Chị Tình năm nay 28 tuổi. Hiện tại  chị đang sống cùng chồng và hai con nhỏ tại huyện Hưng Nguyên tỉnh Nghệ An. Năm 1998 chị Tình tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Bên cạnh chăn nuôi gia đình chị Tình còn sử dụng máy cày để đi cày ruộng thuê cho người dân địa phương với thu nhập 15.000.000đ/ vụ. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm một chiếc máy gặt lúa mới để kinh doanh nhằm tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Tinh Thi N. is 28 years old. Currently she lives with her husband and two young children in Hung N., Nghe An. In 1998 Mrs. N. joined the Fund and borrowed money to invest in raising livestock. Besides the livestock business, the family also uses a tilling machine to run a tilling service for local farmers; the business brings an income of 15,000,000 VND per job. In the coming round of funding she would like to borrow 10,000,000 VND to invest in buying a wheat harvesting machine with the goal of increasing the family's income.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi N., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy new harvesting machine

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana sells household items in the local central market. She lives and runs her small business in Beregovo, Western Ukraine. Tatyana decided to launch her first start-up over 8 years ago. Her business has been growing since then. Today she has about 50,000 Grivnas invested in her business. Her net profit amounts to 5,000 Grivnas a month. 

Reflecting on how everything started, Tatyana confesses she is very happy she took the risk and ventured into the unknown, starting her own business. Looking back, she sees all her failures and successes and feels sure all her efforts were invested in the right cause. 

Today Tatyana would love to get another small loan of 1,500 Grivnas to increase her assortment of inventory and continue expanding her business. She is hoping to repay her loan in one month.

loans.use: To increase her assortment of inventory

loans.name: Dolores De La Concepción

texts.es:
La señora Dolores de la Concepción es originaria de la ciudad de León donde muy alegremente comercializa frutas desde muy temprano por la mañana en una localidad a la intemperie en el mercado central por lo que requiere de inversión para obtener un tramo donde vender sus frutas y no estar exponiéndose al sol y a la lluvia.

Por estas razones es que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita en este momento la compra de las frutas para su respectiva comercialización y para continuar brindándole mejores condiciones a sus tres hijos en edades escolares.
texts.en:
Dolores de la Concepcion is originally from the city of Leon where she very happily markets fruits beginning early in the morning in a location in the central open-air market. This enterprise requires an investment in order to obtain a stall where she can sell her fruits and not be exposed to the sun and the rain. For this reason she has approached Ceprodel in order to obtain a loan which will allow her to purchase fruits for her business and in order to continue providing her school-aged children with the best possible conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits

loans.name: Razia Liaqat Ali Group

texts.en:
Razia baji is a 28-year-old married lady and has lived in a city called Multan, Pakistan for the past 28 years. She is the mother of four kids: three sons and one daughter. None of her children goes to school. Her husband's name is L. A. and he is a fruit seller and has been selling fruit for the past 15 years. He buys fruit from the fruit market and sells it in different communities of Multan. Razia baji helps her husband in arranging the fruit in their cart. She is applying for a loan to expand their fruit-selling business by buying more fruit.

She is the group leader and there is another lady in her loan group. Saira baji wants a loan to buy burgers, eggs, cooking oil, and spices for her burger joint.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy fruit to re-sell

loans.name: Ayangoke Ayano

texts.en: Ayangoke sells electrical materials, and he also repairs generators. He has been in this business for a long time. He needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more electrical materials to sell. He is 48 years old and he is married with 4 children. He lives in Ogbomosho, Oyo State, Nigeria. He says, "Thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support."

loans.use: To purchase more electrical materials to sell.

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en: Chhin S. N., 27, is married with one young child living at home in the Kampong Cham province. She is a rice farmer, typically making US$1 a day; her husband grows vegetables. Her husband typically makes about US$2 a day. Chhin S. N. would like a loan of US$1200 to purchase a grinding mill so that she can rent this machine to the local farmers and earn additional money to help raise her family.

loans.use: purchase a grinding mill

loans.name: Vit

texts.en: Vit N. has been catching fish to sell at the local market for more than 6 years. He is age 38 and the father of six children who are single and live in the family home. Two of his daughters are employed as garment workers. He is married to Mrs. Sak, 45, who assists him in the fishing business. The family generates a daily income of approximately $5 each day. The family's living conditions are not comfortable, because their house is lacking spare materials and breaks frequently. To solve the problem, Vit N. has decided to apply for a loan to repair their old house.

loans.use: To repair their old house

loans.name: Elkhan

texts.en: Elkhan Q. has very interesting sort of business: he is a bee keeper. He started his business in 2005 when he lost his job. Elkhan is responsible for his five children and tries to expand his business. Honey is very popular, not only in the village where he lives but also in the whole of Azerbaijan; people value quality honey very highly. This business requires a lot of attention and care and Elkhan spends most of his time near his bees.  Elkhan would like to expand his business and for this purpose he needs 2000 USD as a loan.

loans.use: purchase more bee hives

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio A. owns a small sari-sari store business. She is 40 years old, married, and has five children. She would like to improve the size of her store. She needs assistance to grow her business even more. The profit from her business goes to pay for the tuition and needs of her children. She started her business in 1993 using a small amount of money that she saved.

She is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI (a KIVA field partner in the Philippines). She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise, which will help her draw a lot more customers. In that way, she will have bigger profit.

CEVI is reaching out to more people to start and own their own businesses. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en: Kehinde is 45 years old and married with four children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells medicines. Kehinde hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Nkwenti

texts.en: L. is a single mother of three children. She has a farm where she grows vegetables to sell at the Bamenda Food Market, about ten minutes into town. With this loan, L. will pay her farm rent, pay for labor to clear and weed her farm, buy four bags of fertilizer, about 14,000 CFA’s (about $28’s) worth of seeds, a piglet, a chicken, animal feed and huckleberry (green vegetable) seeds for planting. Having been a farmer already and seen that she can sell her produce, L. is confident she will do well with this loan. As well, while raising her pigs and fowls, she will be able to sell the manure as fertilizer. In the end, she knows that residents in her community will buy her grown pigs and fowl. After the age of 6, when her father passed away, it was hard for L. to afford to go to school. Since then, she has raised her children without a partner, and has financial difficulties because of that. With the profits from this loan she will pay for her children’s school fees, feed her family, put money towards building her house and be prepared to help her family with health problems. This is L.’s third loan from GHAPE since she became a beneficiary in 2006. L. takes out GHAPE loans because they give training on how to use her loan. About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profit and loss, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To use for farmland rent, to pay for labor to clear land, plus to buy many items for her business

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: S. is a 40-year-old mother of four children and is married to Hassan. She sells frozen food items and has been in business since 2000. Once a week, she goes to Cotonu (a border town near Lagos) to buy goods, which she then supplies to her customers. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase frozen food items in order to meet customer demand. S. says thank you and promises to pay back the loan in eight equal installments.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen food to sell

loans.name: Ibrohim

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Иброхим Усаров родился в 1961 году, проживает с женой и 3 сыновьями в Зафарабадском районе. Иброхим занимается животноводством и переработкой молока. У него огромный опыт и десятилетний стаж работы.
Иброхим впервые получив кредит в нашей организации, потратил его на откорм скота, продажа которого принесла ему хорошую прибыль. Ему понравились условия кредитования, и он повторно подал заявку на получение кредита для откорма крупнорогатого скота. 
Иброхим кроме животноводства, занимается сельским хозяйством.
texts.en:
Ibrohim U. was born in 1961. He lives with his wife and 3 sons in the Zafarabad district. Ibrohim is involved in animal husbandry and milk processing. He has extensive experience and 10 years of work. Ibrohim first obtained a loan from our organization and used it for feeding livestock, sales of which brought him a good profit. He liked the financing terms and put in a second request for a loan for feeding cattle. Besides animal husbandry, Ibrohim is also involved in agriculture.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeding cattle

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus owns a tailoring and embroidery shop. He is 32 years old and married, with two children ages 10 and 6. Justus has already successfully paid off two loans, purchasing three embroidery machines. Justus has now requested a third loan of 40,000 KES in order to purchase an additional sewing machine and materials. He hopes these investments will allow him to increase production, thereby increasing income to meet the needs of his family. In the future, Justus hopes to open additional shops to meet the demand of his customers, and to succeed in an environment of increasing competition. He dreams of owning a home. Justus describes himself as generous and friendly.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine and stock materials

loans.name: Clotilde Norma

texts.es:
La señora Clotilde es socia del Banco Comunal “Flor de Canela” que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 53 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, es madre de 04 hijos (todos ya casados), ella pudo estudiar solo la secundaria incompleta vive en el Barrio Bellavista Jr. Juli.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 7 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para adquirir ropa americana para la venta.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, este préstamo le servirá para poder comprar ropa americana especialmente chompas las cuales las lleva a las minas y al Cuzco donde tiene muy buena demanda.

Su deseo es seguir trabajando y salir adelante

A ella le gusta el cumplimiento y la puntualidad en su Banco Comunal
texts.en:
Mrs. Clotilde is a member of the Communal Bank “Flor de Canela” (Cinnamon Flower), in the Puno district, Puno Province, in the state of Puno. She is 53 years old, single, and is the mother of 4 children (all now married). She was only able to study at the secondary level (not completed). She lives in the Bellavista Jr. Juli neighborhood. She’s has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 7 years. Her first loan was for S/. 300.00 soles, the amount served as capital to buy American clothing to sell. She currently is asking for a loan of S/. 1500.00 new soles. This loan will enable her to buy American clothing, especially sweaters which she takes to the mines and to Cuzco where there is a very good demand for them. Her dream is to continue working and to succeed in her business. She likes the compliance and timeliness in her community bank.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of clothing

loans.name: Lualhati

texts.en:
Lualhati F., a resident of Barangay Sto. Domingo, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya, is married to Samuel and they are gifted with two children, Daryll and April. The eldest is now in his third year of college while the youngest is now in her third year of high school. Lualhati, who was unable to pursue a college education due to limited finances, wants them to become successful through their studies.

Despite the hardships of life, the couple helps each other in cultivating their rice field by planting rice and vegetables for two sets of crops a year. Lualhati is now requesting a loan of PHP23,000 for the maintenance of their crops to ensure a good yield this coming harvest season. She wanted to join in the microfinance program of Kiva because she believes that it will be of great assistance to them considering the low interest rates that they offer.

loans.use: Additional capital for crop maintenance

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a 30-year-old married mother of four school-going children. She lives in Manyatta, Kisumu, Kenya. Beatrice is the proprietor of a fish-selling business, which she started early last year. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to boost her business.

loans.use: As additional capital

loans.name: Tiesi

texts.en:
Tiesi F. is a 33-year-old woman living in the town of Samatau3.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To make a living, Tiesi owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale.  Tiesi has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 450 WST a month from these activities.

Tiesi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Tiesi has successfully repaid a previous loan of 0 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  Tiesi is now requesting a new loan of 2900 WST which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Tiesi plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en:
Immaculee U. is 33 years old and is a widow with three children aged 3, 7 and 13. She also cares for an additional dependent who lives with the family. Immaculee and her family live in Gatsibo district, in the Eastern Province of Rwanda.

In 2004, Immaculee opened a restaurant and employs two persons in her business. Her restaurant is open every day from 6:00 in morning to 8:00 in evening.

Immaculee is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company in order to have sufficient working capital to purchase modern equipment for her restaurant. With this loan she hopes to increase her business, which will help her to serve more customers.

loans.use: To purchase moden equipment for her restaurant

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia S. is from the village of Sto. Niño,Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 41 years old. Alicia is married and has 1 adult-aged child. To make a living, Alicia owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized "sari-sari" retail store. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Alicia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Alicia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alicia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Alicia is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to expand the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Alicia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es: El señor Juan Hernández, desde hace 20 años labora como mecánico, la mayor necesidad que se le presenta es el sector económicos ya que no tiene los recurso para poder comprar materiales del servicio que el ofrece y eso a logrado que se le disminuya su labores lo  cual afecta a su negocio y a su propia familia por que no le ajusta para la alimentación ; por otra parte se ve afectado por  las condiciones en las cuales labora  que no son seguras para su vida por que no costa con los suficiente seguridad , actualmente alquila el taller donde trabaja y sus sueños es poder comprarlo algún día, él inicio este pequeño negocio gracias al apoyo que le brindo su papá , anteriormente se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en la calles del mismo municipio , tiene una familia de cuatro hijos y su esposa la cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos básicos de la casa como agua , luz entre otros. Comprara herramientas, necesarias para poder hacer bien su trabajo. agradece a la institución por hacer posible estas mejora para su trabajo.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan H. has worked as a mechanic for 20 years. The greatest challenge he is faced with is that he does not have the resources to be able to purchase materials for the service that he offers, and this has caused his work to decline, which affects not only his business but also his family, because there is less money for food. On the other hand, he is also affected by the conditions in which he works, which are not safe enough. Currently, he is renting the workshop where he works, and his dream is to be able to buy it some day. He started up this small business thanks to the support that his father provided him. Previously, he had sold fruit and vegetables in the streets of his municipality. He has a family of four children and a wife who works and helps him with basic domestic expenses, such as water and electricity, among others. With this loan, he will purchase the necessary tools to be able to do his job well. He thanks this institution for making possible these improvements to his work.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tools to provide a better service

loans.name: Rita Marcia

texts.es: Rita, tiene una pequeña pulpería, pequeña después de haber aquejado  una enfermedad por algunos meses, se separo de esposo tiene tres hijos los cuales están a su cuidado pero sin el descuido de su padre. También se dedica a la elaboración del Pan casero para la venta en su pulpería como para la distribución en varias ventas de su zona, teniendo otro ingreso por esta actividad diferente al de la pulpería. Vive en la casa de los tíos, siendo la única sobrina que los cuida, el trabajo que realiza es muy fuerte para una mujer sola pero la Sra. Rita a sobrellevado la situación perfectamente. El proyecto mas inmediato que tiene es el de vender almuerzo los fines de semana en la misma casa ya que la casa es bastante grande contando con un patio amplio y cómodo para dicho negocio. La señora emprendió este negocio hace dos años, actualmente la señora se encuentra trabajando para salir adelante y sacar profesionales a sus tres hijos que aun se encuentran en el colegio. Cliente nueva con crédito individual en nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Rita has a small grocery store. After suffering an illness for several months, she separated from her husband. She has three children under her care, but she raises them without the support of their father. Rita also prepares homemade bread that she sells in her store and also distributes to other retailers in the area. This provides her with additional income above the revenues she generates from her store. She lives in the home of her aunt and uncle, since she is the only niece for whom they have cared.

Her latest project is selling lunches on the weekends from her house, since it is large enough and has an expanded patio to accommodate such a business. She has been engaged in this business for two years. Rita is currently working to get ahead and see that her children who are now in high school eventually become professionals. She is a new client who is receiving an individual loan from our Institution.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Provide additional operating capital

loans.name: Khom

texts.en: Khom R. is 21 years old and resides in an area of Ptasrong Commune in Pursat Province, where she has made a living growing rice or vegetable crops since 2007. She now has two children, both of whom are still young and are living in the family home. Her husband, Manh Bou, 27, sells wood carvings. He purchases wood from the forest to carve himself and sells his wares from village to village in his community, earning around $2 a day. Khom R. will be using her second loan to purchase a plot of farmland in a good location for cultivating, on which she will plant a variety kinds of crops. (R.'s husband is pictured because she was not available.)

loans.use: to purchase a plot of farmland

loans.name: Serigne Babacar Sy No. 1 Group

texts.en: Sope Serigne Babacar Sy is an association of female commercantes (vendors) working in Thies, a city about 70km from Dakar. The association, named after an important marabout (a religious leader in West African Islam), was founded in 2006 by a group of entrepreneurial women from the Cité Lamy neighborhood. The aim was to help the members finance their small businesses through a revolving savings fund called a tontine, in which members contribute a small amount to the pot each month to finance one member's activities. Today, the association has evolved to secure group loans for its members through cooperation with UIMCEC, a Kiva partner. Groups of five are financed through 10-month loans in which each member receives an equal amount. On the 20th of each month, the members of the association hold a meeting to collect the repayments. CurrentL., there are 14 groups of women financed through UIMCEC. Sope Serigne Babacar Sy is headed by Ms. Coumba Faye, the president, and Ms. Oumu Ngom, the treasurer. Ndeye Fatim P. heads group No. 1. She is partners with her older sister, Arame P., who is also in the group. Together, they take turns making the trip to their aunt's farm to purchase peanuts to sell in the market of Grand Thies, a neighborhood in the middle of the city. They have been in the business for some six years. Ndeye also sells breakfast to her neighbors, mainL. sandwiches with niébe (bean spread), mayonnaise or tuna. The other three members are: Coumba L., who also sells peanuts; Mame Saye D., who sells Marmite cooking pots; and Diarra D., who sells detergents and soaps. Each member of the group receives 100,000 CFA francs to finance their activities.

loans.use: Bolstering each member's small business

loans.name: Karukara Group D, Kihihi

texts.en:
Jolly K. is 49 years old and married with four children; she also takes care of two orphans. She is a friendly lady with a retail shop in the Kabingo trading center that she has been running for eight years. From her transactions Jolly is able to make 300,000 UGX in profits every month, and these help to recapitalize her business and take care of her family.

Jolly needs a loan to help her with restocking her shop with more goods like sugar, cooking oil, salt, bread and so on. She dreams of expanding her store as well as educating all of her children to be self-sustaining in the future.

loans.use: To restock her retail shop with more goods.

loans.name: Vivisan

texts.en:
Vivisan is 38 years old, married, and has three children. The family live in Lagos State, Nigeria. Vivisan sells natural herbs to make a living. The herbs are use for the preparation of native medicine. Most people in her locality prefer using natural herbs for medication. Vivisan has been in this business for two years now. With the income from the business, she assists her husband, a commercial driver, to care and provide food for the children.
Vivisan hopes to increase her sales due to high demand for herbs by her customers. She is requesting a loan of 90,000 NGN to purchase more natural herbs to sell. She sends her thanks to Kiva and all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more natural herbs to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John A., married and the father of two children, received senior high education. For some time now, John has been selling different shapes and sizes of wood for all purposes in Elmina. Some of his customers are carpenters, contractors and the like. His wife is a trader.

John uses his income in payment of school fees, bills and other financial obligations of the family and will use the loan to purchase more wood for resale. With the additional profits from his expanded business, John plans to save to build a house.

loans.use: John will use the loan to purchase more wood for resale.

loans.name: Thoa's Group

texts.en:
Thoa T. N. (id: 010114150032) was born in 1958 and lives in L. Phap village with her husband and three sons. She is a farmer: she breeds pigs and poultry. Beside that, she buys scrap iron  to sell. She has a monthly income of about 2,000,000 VND from this job. Her first son is married and her two younger sons help her to earn money.

Thoa T. N. wants to earn a lot of money to buy more furniture. She has taken part in SEDA for five years and has repaid on time. She is very happy because she is abL. to save money every day.

This time, Thoa T. N. wants to borrow 7,194,000 VND (approximately 385 USD) for her small business and to buy feed for her pigs.

About the other borrower in her group:

Nhi T. L. (id: 010114150031) was born in 1955.  She buys scrap iron to sell. She wants to borrow 5,886,000 VND(approximately 315 USD) to invest in her small business.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business and to purchase pig feed

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina is from a city named Borewala, Pakistan. Borewala city is famous for its shrines.
Her husband name is M. N. who is a driver and drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). She operates a sewing clothes business to share the financial burden with her husband. They both earn approximately Pak Rs. 15,000 on every month. This amount helps them to manage the financial expenses and to fulfill the needs of their children.
Currently, She is applying for a loan to repair her husband’s auto-rickshaw because its engine is creating problem and if it gets seized they will be faced the financial crises.

loans.use: To repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Djiguiya  (L’Espoir) Group

texts.fr:
Djiguiya est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Koko de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris et enfants. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et sont mères d’au moins 4 enfants.
Les femmes du groupe Djiguiya font le commerce d’articles divers : céréales, bois de chauffe, préparation et vente de galettes tels Mariam B., habillements etc.
 Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, elles ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a deux ans. 
Mariam B. qui est dans l’alimentaire compte utiliser son prêt pour se procurer  des grains de petit mil, de l’huile et du sucre au  grand marché de Koutiala et du bois de chauffe à la maison auprès des producteurs des villages environnants.
Elle vend les galettes chaque soir devant sa porte en face du goudron et de l’école de la mission catholique. Elle est très sollicitée car sait bien  faire les galettes qui sont très prisées.
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Djiguiya comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 80 000 FCFA chacune au  cours de ce cycle, Mariam B., compte réaliser 110 000 FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utiliseront une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille. 
Elles souhaitent  renforcer le partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour ne plus avoir de rupture de stocks.
texts.en:
Djiguiya [“hope”] is the name of a group of women from the Koko district in the town of Koutiala. They know each other well and all live in large traditional famlies with their husbands and children. They are 38 years of age on the average, and each woman has at least four children. The women of the Djiguiya group trade in various articles: cereals, heating wood, preparation and sale of pancakes (such as the ones Mariam B. bakes), clothing etc. In order to enlarge the scope of their activities, two years ago they have decided to take advantage of the loan programs of Soro Yiriwaso. Mariam B., who is in food sales, plans to use her loan in order to purchase millet grain, oil and sugar at the big market of Kouiala and heating wood from the vendors of nearby towns. Je sells her pancakes each evening in front of her front door, on the pavement by the Catholic mission school. There is a lot of customer demand as she is good at baking pancakes and they are very popular. While other members of the Djiguiya group plan to obtain a monthly income of 80,000 West African Francs each, Mariam B. plans to achieve an income of 110,000 West African francs. In addition to repaying the loan, they will use the income to help meet the family expenses. They seek collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso in order to avoid running out of stock on their goods.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing millet grain and other ingredients for the preparation of pancakes

loans.name: Josesa

texts.en:
Josesa A. is from the village of Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 38, married and has 1 child in school. To make a living, Josesa owns & operates a shop where she sells cellphone accessories and souvenir items to the local community. Josesa has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Josesa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josesa repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, and is now requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which she will also use to expand her business.  She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ahene Mu Hene Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Simon is a cabbage seller who describes himself as hard-working.  He is 38 years old and is married with 5 children between the ages of 2 and 18 years old.  Simon would like to provide his children with a quality future.

Simon has been involved in cabbage selling for the past 5 years.  He will use the loan to purchase more vegetables.  He would like to expand his business so that he not only sells cabbage, but other vegetables as well.  

Simon is currently the leader of the trust bank group named "Ahene Mu Hene", which means “King of Kings” in Twi, the language most commonly spoken in Ghana.  There are 6 members in this group.  The other group members are engaged in selling foodstuff, cosmetics and groceries.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Anastasie

texts.fr: H. Anastasie est née en 1970 au Bénin. Anastasie est mariée à De CAMPOS Valerien, un militaire. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille vit à Fidjrossè un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis une dizaine d’année. Anastasie subvient avec son mari aux différents besoins de la famille. Anastasie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour assurer ses besoins, Anastasie mène comme activité principale la vente de tissus, de chaussures, et comme activité secondaire la vente de fournitures scolaires (cahiers, stylos, etc.). Anastasie s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et aussi à Lomé au Togo. Anastasie exerce cette activité depuis neuf ans, dans une boutique de son quartier. Anastasie a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui a été bien remboursé. Anastasie sollicite un deuxième prêt pour augmenter son stock de produits, ce qui lui permettra d’accroître son chiffre d’affaire.
texts.en:
Anastasie H. was born in 1970 in Benin. She is married to Valerien De CAMPOS, a soldier. The couple has three children, all at school. The family has been living in the Fidjrossè district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for around ten years. Anastasie supports her husband in providing the various needs of the family. She did not go to school. In order to cover her needs, Anastasie has a primary activity selling fabric and shoes, and she has a secondary activity selling school materials (exercise books, pens etc.). She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, Benin's international market, and also in Lomé, Togo. Anastasie has been carrying out this activity for nine years in a shop in her neighborhood. She has already had one loan from ALIDé, which she repaid on time. She is requesting a second loan to increase her stock, which will in turn allow her to increase her turnover.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric, shoes and exercise books

loans.name: Mariatou

texts.fr:
Madame  Mariatou  D.  est âgée de 40 ans et vit dans une famille monogame avec son mari et ses 4 enfants au quartier Bougouni Lafiabougou de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu à fréquenter l’école, très tôt elle commença le commerce ambulant  auprès de sa  mère qui vendait des condiments. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage et riche de cette expérience, elle commença elle aussi la vente des condiments au marché de Ségou depuis maintenant 21 ans et jouit d’une grande notoriété. 
Ces marchandises mises dans des emballages  sont  bien disposées sur une étagère et très appréciées des clients.
 C’est dans l’optique de réaliser plus de bénéfices qu’elle a fait recours à   Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 51 mois, après avoir fait 3 prêts solidaires et 3 prêts individuels tous correctement  remboursés. 
Elle est à son 4ème prêt individuel  qu’elle compter utiliser  pour acheter, 3 cartons de cubes maggi et  20 sacs de sel de cuisine. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako. Madame Mariatou D. vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte   réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 120 000 FCFA, ce bénéfice lui servira de se prendre en charge et de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. 
Son ambition  est de construire une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariatou D. is 40 years old and lives in a monogamous family with her husband and their four children in the Bougouni Lafiabougou region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having gone to school, she began in travelling sales very early alongside her mother who sold condiments. After several years of training and enriched by the experience, she too began the sale of condiments at the Ségou market at 21 years old where she enjoys a large reputation. Her merchandise, put in packaging, stays fresh on the shelf and is well-liked by her clients. With the objective of making greater profit, she has made an appeal to Soro Yiriwaso. She has had a relation with this organization for 51 months, after having taken 3 loans with others and 3 individual loans, all properly paid back. She is on her 4th individual loan which she expects to use to buy 3 cartons of Maggi broth cubes and 20 bags of cooking salt. She buys her stock in Bamako. Mrs. Mariatou D. sells for cash and for credit to both male and female customers. She expects to make a monthly profit of 120,000 FCFA, which will serve to take care of and support the needs of her family. Her ambition is to build a house to live in.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments for food

loans.name: Etelvina

texts.es:
Etelvina es secretaria y trabaja en una escuelita en irpavi II y también vende cosméticos y perfumes; tiene una hija que esta en nivel básico.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz. Vive en alquiler.
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de cosméticos, perfumes, y otros).
Es cliente antigua desde junio de 2008, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de sus cuotas, además que su fuente de trabajo le permite mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Etelvina is a secretary and works in a small school in Irpavi II and she also sells cosmetics and perfumes. She has a daughter in primary school. Their home is located in the Irpavi zone of the city of La Paz and it is rented.

The loan will be used to buy cosmetics, perfumes, etc. She has been a client of the bank sine June of 2008 and her history classifies her as a Level 1 Client, meaning she is responsible with her loan payments and has a source of income that allows her to improve her life's conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetics and perfumes in bulk

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhon U., 54 years old and she is a villager who lives in Ta Ou Khang Cheung village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 3-hectares of land to cultivate rice for a living and she is also farmer who works very hard to support her family. In order to support this farm, Mrs. Sokhon U. decided to ask for a lone to buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for hire laborer to plow the farm. Her husband, Mr. Hun Maol, is a teacher in the local school and also supports his wife on the farm. This couple has a child, who is a student. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for hire laborer to plow the farm.

loans.name: Gracelyn

texts.en:
Gracelyn G. is from the village of Calaran, Calamba. She is 34 years old and is married with one school-aged child.

Gracelyn owns and operates a general store, selling assorted household items (such as rice,salt,sugar etc.)  in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month.

In 2002, Gracelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business.

Gracelyn is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used as additional capital for new business in feeds selling. This loan will be her 10th from PMPC. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional Capital for her General Store

loans.name: Nhanh

texts.en: Nhanh K., 19, is married and lives with her husband in Battambong Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. She sells vegetables and fruit for an income of USD daily. Her husband farms with his mother, earning an income of USD 2 daily.  K. is requesting a loan of USD 300 to purchase corn to sell.  In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more corn to sell.

loans.name: Sou

texts.en: Mrs. Sou K. is a 58-year-old married woman who sells grocery items out of her home. She has had twenty years' experience and earns approximately of $3 per day. Her husband (shown in the picture) buys clothes that are less than export quality from garment industries to resell in his community for a profit. This has been very profitable for family, and Sou K. now needs a loan so her husband can increase his working capital. The couple has nine children, five of whom are married.

loans.use: To increase the working capital of the clothing business.

loans.name: Bahtiyor

texts.ru: Шарипов Бахтиёр проживает в районе Варзоб. Возраст, 31 год. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Образование высшее.  Окончил налоговый институт. Работал год в таможни. Сейчас он предоставляет услугу, такси. Развозит людей по маршруту Варзоб – Душанбе, Душанбе - Варзоб. В этой области уже один год. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины, чтобы предоставить безопасную услугу.
texts.en:
Bahtiyor S. lives in the Varzob district. He is 31 years old, married and has 2 children. He has a higher education. Bahtiyor graduated from a tax college and spent a year working for customs. Currently, Bahtiyor provides a taxi service. He drives people on the Varzob - Dushanbe, Dushanbe - Varzob route. He has been in this business for one year. Bahtiyor is requesting this loan to repair his car in order to provide a safe service.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car repair

loans.name: God Grace Group

texts.en:
Marthina J., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called God Grace Group. She is 25 years old and married. She has three children whose ages are between 3 and 9 years. She was only able to attend school through sixth grade due to lack of financial support. 

For three years, she has been selling rice, cooking oil, salt, seasoning, pepper, etc., in Congo Town on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000-Liberian-Dollars portion of this 30,000-Liberian-Dollars group loan to buy more rice, cooking oil, salt, seasoning, pepper, etc.
 
She describes herself as a determined woman whose dream is to improve her business and continue to educate her children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more rice, cooking oil, salt, seasonings, pepper, etc.

loans.name: Gloria Alfarina Monserrate

texts.es:
Gloria de 54 años, tiene una pequeña tienda afuera de su casa, vive con su hija y nietos en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos.  

Empezó la tienda hace 1 año 3 meses, la idea de tener la tienda vino de una de las hijas ya que ella necesitaba un ingreso adicional. Para comenzar construyo una casita en la parte delantera de su casa para tener su tienda separada de su casa, compro bebidas, pollos y dulces. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar bebidas, pollos, embutidos para su pequeña tienda. En el futuro quiere tener una tienda grande y que su familia estén estable económicamente.
texts.en: Gloria is 54 years old and has a small store outside of her house. She lives with her daughter and grandchildren in a neighborhood called Playas, in a tourist town in Ecuador, which is known for its abundance of seafood. She began her store 1 year and 3 months ago. The idea to open a store came from one of her daughters, since she needed additional income. To start her store she built a small room in the front of her house, so that she could have the store separate from her house. She bought drinks, chicken and sweets to start. She works from 7am until 9pm everyday. With the loan she wants to buy drinks, chicken and meat for her small store. In the future her hopes are to have a big store and for her family to be economically stable.

loans.use: To purchase drinks, chicken and meat

loans.name: Duval Iván

texts.es:
Duval Iván C. M. tiene 35 años. Es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Guaranda en la Provincia de Bolívar.   Tiene 3 hijos.

Duval pertenece a la Ventanilla  Guantucoto ubicada a media hora de Guaranda perteneciente, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería especialmente a la siembra de maíz y papas en la zona de la sierra y en la zona de la costa al arroz, esta ventanilla tiene 25 miembros.

Duval  se dedica a la agricultura por varios años,  siembra maíz y papa, además tiene animales de cría y ganado para luego vender,  las comprar las realiza en Guaranda y vende en el mercado mayorista de la  misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, papa. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Enfrentan desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar vehiculo y comprar terrenos.

Le gusta  visitar a la familia y festejar el carnaval.
texts.en:
Duval Iván C. M. is 35 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and children in Guaranda cantón in the province of Bolívar.  He has 3 children.

Duval belongs to the Guantucoto solidarity group which is located half an hour from Guaranda.  It is a group that works in crop farming and livestock farming, especially the sowing of corn and potatoes in the mountain region and rice in the coastal region.  This solidarity group has 25 members.

Duval has been working in farming for several years.  He sows corn and potatoes.  He also has animals and cattle which he raises and then sells.  He makes his purchases in Guaranda and sells in the wholesale market in the same town.

He is requesting this loan to buy supplies for sowing corn and potatoes.  The support of this loan will help him to fulfil his family's financial needs.  They face challenges such as pests and diseases in their crops.  His dream is to buy a vehicle and plots of land.

He likes to visit his family and celebrate carnaval.

loans.use: To buy supplies for sowing corn and potatoes

loans.name: Rios De Babilonia Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario Rios de Babilonia esta integrado por tres compañeras todas residentes en la colonia Obrera de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, son mujeres muy luchadoras y trabajadoras, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:
 
la señora Leonicia C. Z. tiene 54 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos, pero solo uno depende de ella, la hija vive en USA.
doña Leonicia se dedica al comercio tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion en donde vende productos de consumo popular.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria y asi surtir mas su negocio.
su meta es hacer crecer su negocio.

la sra. Gloria Marina A. A. tiene 42 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Luis Alexander Canales quien vive en USA y le manda dinero para la manutencion de sus dos hijos. doña Gloria se dedica a la venta de mariscos y refrescos, esta actividad la ejerce desde hace unos 4 años.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mariscos y refrescos.
 
la sra. Sandra Yamileth C. tiene 32 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Leopoldo Palma quien se dedica al negocio de tomar fotografias,  tienen dos hijos que dependen de ambos.
la señora Sandra utilizara el credito para la compra de maiz, leña y refrescos. 
Sandra se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas desde hace unos 4 años.
texts.en:
The group Rios de Babilonia (“Rivers of Babylon”) is comprised of three friends that all reside in the Obrera section of the city of San Lorenzo.  They are hard-working and dedicated women, and following is a summary detailing the different activities they carry out:

Ms. Leonicia C. Z. is 54 years old and a single mother with two children, but only one of them still depends on her.  Her daughter lives in the USA  Leonicia dedicates herself to commerce, and has a small general store in her home where she sells popular products for general use.  She will use the loan to buy groceries with which to supply her store.  Her goal is to make her business grow.

Ms. Gloria Marina A. A. is 42 years old and married to Mr. Luis Alexander Canales.  He lives in the USA and sends her money to help support their two children.  Gloria dedicates herself to selling seafood and refreshments, an activity she has been carrying out for 4 years.  She will use the loan for the purchase of seafood and refreshments.

Ms. Sandra Yamileth C. is 32 years old and married to Mr. Leopoldo Palma, who is a photographer.  They have two children that depend on both of them.  Sandra will use the loan to buy corn, wood, and beverages.  Sandra has dedicated herself to preparing and selling tortillas for 4 years.

loans.use: To purchase beverages, lard, rice, corn, sugar, beans, shrimp, tortillas, toilet paper, oil, margarine, soap, pastas, cereal, oats, eggs, bread, coffee, wood.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.ar:
فادي في عمر 35 سنة يعمل في نقل البضائع متزوج  وله 3 اولاد له في عمله حوالي 14 سنة له تاريخ جيد في المجموعة
طموح يحب عائلته ويريد ان يؤمن لهم معيشة سليمة وتقديم ما يستطيع لهم من مساعدة يواجه صعوبة في التطور العملي لأنه بحاجة الى الدعم المادي
انه يريد قرض من المجموعة بهدف شراء رافعة لنقل السيارات لحسابه لكي يعتمد على نفسه ويزيد من مدخوله له زبائن منوعة في جيران واقارب 
وتجار من محيطه
texts.en: Fadi is a 35-year-old husband and father of three who loves his family very much and wants to ensure a secure life for them. He has fourteen years experience trucking merchandise, with a varied customer base coming from his relatives, neighbors, and local merchants. He has a good credit history with Al Majmoua, but needs more financial assistance to further develop his business. Therefore, he is currently seeking a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase a lift so that he can tow cars. This would allow him to boost revenues and subsequently become more self-reliant.

loans.use: To purchase a tow lift

loans.name: Dios Ante Todo 1, 2, 3 Group

texts.en:
