Sadley is the coordinator of her group, Dios Ante Todo 1, 2 & 3 (God first), located in a village where most of the citizen are Haitians. She lives in a modest home with her five children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to work hard because she needs to give her children what they need. With this effort, she can make extra income and help her long-term partner. In the meantime, she will enjoy to eat and rest.

Sadley is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for three years, starting with some capital she saved by working after she came from Haiti. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying clothing, in different size, and for men, women and kids. She will re-invest the profits in her business because this is high season for sales. She dreams of having her own house and return to Haiti.

This Esperanza associate began with us because she invested in her business and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and the tourist industry dominate the economy. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

The woman with face pic in the right corner is one of the member, she was absent at the time the group photo was taken.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Dalagan

texts.en:
Dalagan G. is from the town of Mohon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental.  He is 37 years old and single.  

To make a living, Dalagan owns and operates a food stall that caters to the local community.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from the sale of dry goods.  Dalagan is just starting in this business.

In 2010, Dalagan joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dalagan is requesting his first loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.  It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es: Candida Rosa tiene 46 años es casada y tiene tres hijos, de los cuales uno ya es mayor de edad y vive aparte. La señora es dueña de una pulpería, la cual está localizada en su casa de habitación, además de esto también distribuye productos de medicina natural y también oferta servicios de masajes al cliente. Candida  tiene 15 años de tener la pulpería, la cual en dio inicio con el apoyo de su familia que fueron los que facilitaron el capital inicial de trabajo y fue con el tiempo que fue reinvirtiendo hasta poder hacer más grande el negocio. Ella solicita el crédito para comprar mercancías tanto para la pulpería como para la venta de medicina natural. Sus sueños por el momento son ampliar el negocio, de tal manera que permita mejorar las condiciones del hogar y en especial de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Candida Rosa is 46, married, and has three children. One of her children is grown and lives independently. Candida owns a general store, located in her home. She also distributes natural medical products and offers a massage service.

She has had her general store for 15 years after starting it with the support of her family, who provided the initial working capital. With time, she has been re-investing it in order to make her business bigger. She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise for her general store and her natural medicines sales.

Her current dreams are to expand her business, which will allow her to improve the conditions of her home and especially the living conditions of her children.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 62-year-old widowed man from Lebanon. He lives on his own. He worked in a roastery for more than 42 years. Then, he decided to open his own roastery 5 years ago and started to offer people from his community delicious nuts and crackers. This competent older man was able to cover his expenses all across the years. He obtained his first Kiva loan and he was a very good client. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new machinery and additional tools to increase his productivity, sales, and income.

loans.use: to purchase new machinery and additional tools

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith B. is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has one child.  Her child is not currently in school.  Faith has a business selling decoration flowers, which she has had for five years.  She also has a second business, a boutique, that sells clothes. 

To help expand her businesses, Faith has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase decoration flowers for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Faith hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Faith hopes to own a beauty salon. 

Faith is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save money for herself.

loans.use: to purchase decoration flowers for resale

loans.name: Moeu

texts.en:
Sewing clothes is the main part of 26-year-old Mrs. Moeu H. 's daily duty in the garment industry. Moeu H. has been engaged in her job since 2006 and has a formal salary. She has a life partner in her husband who works in the same field. The couple helps each other to earn money to feed their child.

 Moeu H. is concerned that she and her husband face difficulties in traveling to their workplace. They always travel to work by hiring a taxi or walking because they don't have their own vehicle. To solve the problem, Moeu H. has requested a loan in the amount of $800 to be used to buy a new motorcycle to provide transportation without hiring a taxi.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina tiene 66 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con su familia en Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno y ovino. Cría los animales menores y cuando alcancen un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta en los mercados locales. Alejandrina es muy conocida en el mercado y cuenta con una clientela ya establecida y fiel. Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles para invertir en la compra de alimentos balanceados para sus animales. Con esta inversión, sus animales podrán lograr mejor tamaño y peso y Alejandrina podrá venderlos a mejores precios, incrementando sus ganancias. Posee buena referencias personales y laborales de su comunidad rural. Ha tenido otros préstamos con Edpyme Alternativa y cumplió con sus obligaciones en manera puntual.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 66 years old, married and is taking care of two children. She lives in her own home with her family in Olmos, an agricultural area with considerable commercial activity located in the province of Lambayeque, more than an hour and a half outside the city of Chiclayo.

She raises and sells cattle and sheep. She takes care of the small animals and when they reach a good level of development she offers them for sale to the local markets. Alejandrina is very well known in the market and has an established and loyal clientele. She has requested a loan of 1500 New Peruvian Soles to invest in balanced feed for her animals. With the investment, her animals will be able to reach a greater size and weight and Alejandrina will be able to sell them at higher prices, increasing her profit. She has good personal and work references in her rural community. She has taken other loans with Edpyme Alternativa and completed her payments in a punctual manner.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed for her livestock

loans.name: Yenny

texts.es:
Yenny nació en la ciudad de Maranura provincia de la Convención - Cusco y tiene 29 años de edad, ella ahora vive en la comunidad de Cotowincho de la ciudad de Urubamba, Cusco. Yenny es profesora y trabaja en el colegio “Apu Torrechayoc” de la ciudad de Urubamba. Ya son tres años que se dedica a enseñar y le va muy bien. Yenny también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, gallinas, otros animales más. En esta oportunidad Yenny requiere el préstamo para comprar cuyes.  

Yenny pertenece al banco comunal “Kuska Llankasun de Rumichaca” de la Asociación Arariwa  y trabaja con sus compañeras del banco comunal desde hace varios años. (La comunidad Cotowincho se encuentra ubicada a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Urubamba donde los socios se reúnen cada treinta días para realizar sus actividades correspondientes.)
texts.en: Yenny was born in Maranura, Convención Province, Cusco and is 29.  She now resides in Cotowincho, Urubamba, Cusco. Yenny is a teacher in the “Apu Torrechayoc” school in Urubamba. She has been teaching successfully for the last three years. Yenny also raises domestic animals, such as guinea pigs, chickens, and others. She is seeking credit to buy more animals to raise and sell.  Yenny is a member of the “Kuska Llankasun de Rumichaca” community bank, associated with the Arariwa Association.  She has been a member for several years. (Cotowincho is just 10 minutes from Urubamba where members hold professional meetings.)

loans.use: to buy domestic animals

loans.name: Simon

texts.es: El señor Simon es chofer y tiene un vehiculo de transporte de pasajeros  y su esposa es comerciante; el crédito lo requiere para el arreglo en el sistema de frenos de su vehiculo para no tener problemas en el futuro. Vive  en casa de sus propia ubicada en la zona de Los Andes de la ciudad de El Alto, es casado  tiene un  hijo. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en: Simon is a driver and has a vehicle for transporting passengers, and his wife is a storekeeper; the loan is needed for the repair of the braking system in his vehicle so that there are no problems in the future. He lives in their own home located in the Los Andes area in the city of El Alto. He is married and has a son. This is the first time he has had a loan with IMPRO.

loans.use: To repair the braking system in his vehicle for transporting passengers.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora S. V. pertenece a la población de patria nueva un lugar pequeño y muy conocido por la región por las aguas termales que existe cerca de la población, una mujer de 57 años de edad quien se quedo viuda desde hace más de 5 años. Una mujer que no le teme al trabajo y siempre lucha por seguir adelante, tiene 6 seis hijos los cuales están casados y que de vez en cuando la apoyan un poco económicamente. 
Ella se dedica a la venta de colchas y ropa por catalogo desde que se quedo viuda porque tenia la necesidad de trabajar para salir adelante y sobre todo tenia que ocupar su tiempo en algo para sobrellevar la pena que tenia, sus productos los ofrece de casa en casa aunque es un poco cansado por su edad ella no se debilita siempre tiene la fuerza y la ganas de salir adelante. Su negocio la ayuda mucho porque obtiene dinero que la ayuda solventar sus gastos y poder vivir modestamente. Ella solicito el préstamo para comprar colchas, blusas y playeras ya que tiene un pedido y con ello podrá comprar sus productos que le encargaron sus clientes y con ello obtener ganancias para sus gastos y para realizar sus pagos
Ella comenta que esta muy agradecida con Dios por la fortaleza que le da día con día, seguirá trabajando para hacer unos ahorritos para que el día de mañana que le haga falta. Solo le pide a Dios que le siga dando la fortaleza para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Flora S. V. lives in the town of Patria Nueva.  This is a small place which is very well known in the region for the hot springs that are to be found nearby.

Flora is 57 years old.  She was widowed more than 5 years ago.  She is a woman who is not afraid to work and who fights to get ahead.  She has six children who are married and, from time to time, they support her a little financially.  Flora has been selling bedspreads and clothes through a catalog since she was widowed because she needed to work in order to get ahead in life and, above all, she needed to fill her time with something in order to help her endure the sorrow that she was feeling.

Flora makes her sales door to door.  Even though it is a little tiring at her age, she does not weaken.  She always has the strength and desire to carry on.  Flora's business helps her a lot because she is able to make money that helps her to cover her expenses and live modestly.

Flora requested this loan to buy bedspreads, blouses and t-shirts since she has an order pending and the loan will enable her to buy the products that her customers have ordered.  She will make profits with which she will cover her expenses and meet her loan repayments.  Flora tells us that she is very grateful to God for the strength that he gives her every day.  She will continue working so that she can make some savings in case she needs them some day.  She only asks God to continue giving her the strength to keep going.

loans.use: to buy bedspreads and clothes to sell

loans.name: Dora Leticia

texts.es: Dora Leticia: Ella es dueña de una tienda en la aldea donde ella vive nos cuenta que con su esfuerzo ha podido sacar adelante s sus hijos ella es madre soltera ella nos cuenta que nececita este credito para la compra de productos comestibles de primera nececidad y asi poder surtir mas su tienda y tener mas bariedad para ofrecerles a sus clentes y de la misma manera obtener mejores ganancias para seguir ayudando a sus hijos en la educacion su sueño es que sus hijos sean unos profecionales en un futuro.
texts.en:
Dora Leticia owns a store in the neighborhood where she lives.  She says that through her efforts, she has been able to move her children forward.  Dora is a single mother and needs this loan to buy basic food products.  This will allow her to restock her store and be able to offer more variety to her customers.  As a result, she will generate more income to continue helping her children with their education.  

Her dream is for her children to become professionals in the future.

loans.use: to purchase basic food products.

loans.name: Cindy

texts.es: Cindy, de 25 años en una joven madre de familia muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Ronny de 27 años y su querida hija Luciana de 4 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Frente a un jardín de niños en la ciudad de Pucallpa, se encuentra el kiosco de golosinas de Cindy, gracias a su buen ojo que tiene para los negocios, ella ha podido mejorar su situación económica. Su kiosco es muy concurrido por los niños, quienes prefieren a ella debido a la variedad de golosinas que vende. Lleva 5 años en este negocio y considera que puede disponer de su tiempo tanto para el trabajo como para cuidar de su hija. Con el tiempo desea poner una tienda de ropa y así mejorar su calidad de vida. Este será el  primer crédito con MFP por lo que se siente feliz ya que con ello podrá en marcha sus planes. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida ya que siempre ayuda en todo lo necesario. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más golosinas para su kiosco y así incrementara su stock.
texts.en:
Cindy, age 25, is a young mother who is very simple and hard-working.  She lives in her own house with her husband, Ronny, 27, and her precious daughter Luciana, age 4.  She wants to provide the best quality of life for them that she can.  Cindy runs a sweets kiosk across from a kindergarten in the city of Pucallpa.  Since she has a good eye for business, she has been able to improve her economic situation.  Her kiosk is very popular among the children for the variety of sweets she sells.  

She has been in business for five years and feels she has the time to work and take care of her daughter.  In the future she would like to open a clothing store and improve her lifestyle.  This is her first loan through MFP and she is happy to be able to begin working on her plans.  She is a much loved member of the communal bank because she always helps out as needed.  With the 800 PEN loan she plans to buy more sweets for the kiosk so she can increase stock.

loans.use: To buy more sweets for her kiosk.

loans.name: Sos

texts.en:
Sos, 42, is married and currently lives with his one child and her mother in the Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh City. 

He is a fruit trader. Every day, he leaves his home to buy fruits in bulk from local farmers and then he sells it in the busy market. He has been in this selling business since 2007 and earns more or less $5 a day to cover the whole family's expenses. 

Currently, his selling business is getting better step-by-step, and he often adds new clients who come to buy his fruits. To expand this business, Sos is requesting a loan in the amount of $700 to purchase more fruits for future sale.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits for future sale.

loans.name: Phanahasi

texts.en:
Phanahasi is a 37-year-old married man with four children. He lives in Kasese, in the western part of Uganda. Phanahasi has been in agriculture for twenty years, having started with 50 stems of bananas and now having 200 stems of bananas. He does commercial farming, selling his bananas from the plantation.

Phanahasi's hardships are price fluctuations, limited capital and thieves. His goals are to have a model banana plantation and an educated family. Phanahasi says the intention of having the loan is to enable him to buy manure and mulch and to pay for labor for his plantation so as to realize better banana yields for selling.

loans.use: To buy manure and mulch and to pay for labor for his plantation.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La señora Maria Elena se dedica a la elaboración de de dulces. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de azúcar, envases, leche, queso, mantequilla, coco y pollo. Es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para cubrir sus gastos. Vive en el reparto candelaria, pero Maria tiene que salir todos los días de manera ambulantes para ofrecer sus dulces.  Tiene dos hijos que son mayores de edad y trabajan de manera independiente. Maria se encuentra muy satisfecha con los créditos que obtuvo anteriormente ya que pudo mejorar la producción de sus productos.
texts.en: María Elena makes sweets.  She needs the loan to buy sugar, containers, milk, cheese, butter, coconut and chicken.  This is her source of income to pay expenses.  She lives in Candelaria but María has to go out daily to sell her sweets.  She has two adult children who work independently.  María is very satisfied with the loans she obtained previously because she was able to improve production of her products.

loans.use: to buy sugar, containers, milk, cheese, butter, coconut and chicken.

loans.name: And Soukali Jeeguene Pire 12 Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de 5 membres qui habitent dans le village de Pire à cent km de DAKAR la capitale du Sénégal, leur activité principale est le commerce de produits agricoles  les tubercules de manioc. Elles sont expérimentées dans le domaine et disposent  d’une bonne  clientèle. Leur journée commence à 8 heures du matin et se  termine vers 20heures du soir. Avec ce financement elles comptent  acheter 100 sacs de manioc qu’elles vont revendre  au marché. Les revenus tirés de la vente du manioc leur permettra de renforcer leur commerce mais aussi de satisfaire les besoins de leurs enfants (paiement des frais de scolarité les frais médicaux et participer a l’entretien de la maison).
texts.en:
This is a group composed of five members who live in Pire, a village located 100 kilometers from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. Their main business activity involves trading with farm products, such as cassava tubers. The group members are experienced in this field and have a strong customer base. The workday starts at 8 a.m. and ends around 8 p.m.

With this financing, the group members intend to buy 100 sacks of cassava that they will resell at the market. The income earned from the sale of cassava will enable them to strengthen their business and provide for their children (school fees, healthcare and household expenses).

loans.use: to buy cassava, groundnuts and millet.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 23 years old, married, and has one child. 

Haydar is a carpenter; in 2010 he opened his own workshop where he makes and repairs furniture. He has more than three years experience, a good reputation, and is well known in his area. 

He decided to apply for $3000 in order to purchase a diesel generator for his workshop. He aims to make more money to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To purchase a diesel generator for his workshop.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
This is Gemma, 45, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. She’s married to Vicencio, a driver, and the mother to her four children. The oldest is already working while the youngest is in elementary school.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for everyday expenses and to save for the future of her children.

Gemma operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five peso's-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Gemma earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 450 Philippine Pesos in sales every day.   

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects an increase in her business income as she expands her business. 

Gemma hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Komiljon

texts.ru: Комилджон проживает в районе Рудаки. Ему 29 лет. Он женат. Образование у него среднее. Комилджон уже 8 лет как занимается торговлей. На сегодняшний день у него имеется магазин, где он продает продукты питания. Кредит берет для покупки продуктов. Он хочет увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en: Komiljon lives in the Rudaki district.  He is 29 years old and married.  He has a secondary education.  Komiljon has been involved in retail sales for eight years.  Today, he has a store, where he sells food products.  Komiljon is requesting this loan for the purchase of products.  He wants to expand an assortment of his merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase products

loans.name: Hadijah

texts.en:
Hadijah is a married woman with six children who attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees.

For the past two years she has operated a retail shop business, selling to neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bags of sugar for resale. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bags of sugar for resale.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гульнора жительница города Вахдат. Ей 34 года. Она замужем. У нее 5 детей. Гульнора уже два года как занимается торговлей на рынке. У нее имеется торговая точка, где она продает продукты питания. Кредит берет для покупки конфет, вафель, натуральных соков и молочной смеси.
texts.en: Gulnora lives in the town of Vahdat.  She is 34 years old, married and has five children.  Gulnora has been involved in sales at the market for two years.  She has a retail outlet, where she sells food products.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of candy, waffles, natural juices and dairy mixture.

loans.use: to buy candy, waffles, natural juices and dairy mixture

loans.name: Neverless

texts.en: Neverless is a forty-year-old married woman with five children, and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling bananas and beans for five years and this has helped her in supporting the family. Her hardships are high transport costs and thieves, and her vision is business expansion, a well-furnished house plus educating her children. Neverless needs the loan to rent land for farming and to buy bananas.

loans.use: to rent land for farming and to buy bananas.

loans.name: Irma Irene

texts.es: La socia Irma está solicitando otro préstamo para uso personal específicamente para la alimentación de sus hijos y educación. El anterior crédito a la socia Irma le ayudo en el pequeño negocio de ventas de productos de belleza y obtuvo buenas ganancias de la cuales lo invirtió en el gasto familiar. La socia Irma está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en: Irma requests another loan for personal use, specifically for the nutrition and educational expenses of her children. The previous loan helped Irma with her small business selling beauty products. She obtained good profits which were invested in the family's expenses. Irma is happy for the loan and she is committed to making her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for her children.

loans.name: Leonor Yolanda

texts.es:
Leonor de 55 años, vive en una zona suburbana llamada “Suburbio”, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene aspiraciones de crecimiento a su negocio.
Su negocio es la elaboración de adornos de porcelana como muñecas, jarros, tasas, etc.
Escogió esta actividad desde muy pequeña ya que se dio cuenta que tenía el arte de fabricar piezas de porcelana.
Es madre soltera, ha sacado sus hijos adelante gracias a la ayuda de dios.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de moldes, cerámica en polvo, pintura.
Su sueño es construir bien su vivienda y que su negocio aumente en sus ventas.
texts.en:
Leonor, age 55, lives in a suburban area called “Suburbio”. She is a hardworking woman who has aspirations to grow her business. Her business involves making porcelain decorations such as dolls, mugs, cups, and other items. She chose this activity as a young girl because she realized that she had a talent for the art of making porcelain pieces.

Leonor is a single mother and has been able to move her children forward thanks to the help of God. She is requesting a loan to buy molds, ceramic powder, and paint. Her dream is to build a nice home and to increase the sales in her business.

loans.use: to buy molds, ceramic powder, and paint.

loans.name: Yawoa

texts.fr:
Yawoa est une femme âgée de 32 ans. Elle est mariée à un Laboratin de profession, et est mère de 1 enfant.  
Yawoa travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2009. Elle achète et revend des bazins riches et moins riches à toutes personnes comme ambulante à Lomé. Elle achète les bazins au grand marché de Lomé 
Yawoa a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des bazins destinés à la vente.  Elle veut réinvestir ses profits supplémentaires dans le développement de son activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Yawoa voudrait avoir une boutique de vente de bazins. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit s’assurer une autonomie financière.
texts.en:
Yawoa is a 32-year-old woman. She is married to a laboratory assistant, and is the mother of one child.

Yawoa has been working as a retail merchant since 2009. She buys and resells rich (100% cotton) and less rich bazin fabric, to all-comers as an itinerant vendor in Lomé. She buys bazin fabric at Lomé's great market.

Yawao requested her first loan from WAGES to purchase bazin fabric to be resold. She wants to reinvest any additional profits into developing more business.

In coming years, she would like to have a shop selling bazin. She said that with the profits, she plans to ensure her financial autonomy.

loans.use: Buy lengths of bazin fabric

loans.name: Lisbeth

texts.es:
Lisbeth nació en la ciudad del Cusco  y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Lisbeth tiene 25 años de edad, tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo. Lisbeth desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad del Cusco.   

Lisbeth se dedica a la elaboración de videos de los centros arqueológicos de la cultura Inca como por ejemplo la construcción del centro arqueológico de Machupicchu. Ya son varios que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 
  
Lisbeth pertenece al banco comunal “Ñahupacman Purisun” de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo CD y DVD. 

Lisbeth se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Lisbeth was born in the city of Cusco and still lives in the city of her birth.  Lisbeth is 25 years old and is in a common law relationship; she has a son.  Lisbeth carries out her daily and economic activities in the city of Cusco.

Lisbeth produces videos of Inca culture archaeological sites like the construction of the Machupicchu archaeological center.  She’s been in this business for several years now and does well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

Lisbeth belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s “Ñahupacman Purisun” communal bank in the city of Cusco.  On this occasion she needs the loan to buy materials like CDs and DVDs.

Lisbeth is grateful for the opportunity provided her by this means and commits to make her payments according to the corresponding schedule.

loans.use: to buy CDs and DVDs.

loans.name: Victor Augusto

texts.es:
Victor de 27 años, es policía y con la ayuda de Dios no ha tenido ningún accidente ya que trabaja en las zonas mas peligrosas de Guayaquil. Vive felizmente en unión libre y tiene 2 hijos de 3 y 8 años y estudian en una institución educativa.

El quiere darle una buena vida a su familia por eso quiere mejorar su casa comprar con el prestamo lavaplatos, cemento, arena y bloques.  Con el dinero que le den el banco D-miro pretende terminar de construir su casa para si poder vivir mas cómodos con toda su familia.
texts.en:
27-year-old Victor is a policeman and, thanks to God, he hasn't suffered any accidents despite the fact that he works in one of the most dangerous areas of Guayaquil.  He lives happily with his partner and has two children, aged 3 and 8, who attend school.

Victor would like to provide his family with a good life and so he would like to improve his house.  He will use this loan to buy a dishwasher, cement, sand and blocks.  With the money that Banco D-Miro give him, he plans to finish building his house so that he can live more comfortably with his whole family.

loans.use: to buy a dishwasher, cement, sand and blocks

loans.name: Ivette Marjore

texts.es:
Ivette, administra una panadería, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos, los cuales están estudiando, y le ayudan en los quehaceres de la panadería, ella aprendió la panadería con la ayuda de su esposo, iniciando juntos desde hace varios años.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de sacos de harina, huevos, azúcar por quintales, y otros materiales que son necesarios para la producción de pan.
Su aspiración es tener una panadería más productiva y que su familia también sientan el efecto de los beneficios en la panadería.
texts.en:
Ivette runs a bakery. She lives with her husband and their 4 children, who are studying and who help her with the various tasks of the bakery. She learned about running a bakery from her husband, as they started this activity together a few years ago.
She is requesting a loan to buy bags of flour, eggs, sugar in quintal bags (weight measure equivalent to 46 kilos) and other ingredients she needs to prepare bread.
Her goal is to run a more productive bakery and she hopes that her family can profit from the benefits of the bakery as well.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour, eggs and sugar in quintal bags.

loans.name: Las Flores De Progreso Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS FLORES DE PROGRESO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Panamericana, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Bertha es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: panadería, librería/ bazar, juegos populares, tienda de barrio, venta de pescado.

La señora Bertha,  indica que es la primera vez que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de la promoción. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de panadería que viene trabajando hace años y aprendiendo el mismo de sus padres.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de harina) que adquiere de la Ceja o de Desaguadero y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación.
texts.en:
The “Las Flores de Progreso” (Flowers of Progress) communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana focal center.  It has six members led by a governing board headed by Bertha, its President.  The businesses that the members of the communal bank are in are varied.  Among them we have: bakery, general store/stationery shop, popular games, neighborhood store and fish sales.

Bertha indicates that this is the first time she’s worked with Pro Mujer and that she joined the institution thanks to an invitation from a promoter.  She currently has a bakery that she’s been operating for years having learned it from her parents.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy flour in La Ceja or in Desaguadero and after making the baked goods will sell them in her sales space.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family since she’s married and has two children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training.

loans.use: To buy flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Irene Elena

texts.es: La señora Irene tiene su taller en su mismo domicilio  se dedica a la confección  de almohadones por cantidad  de todo tipo y clase y también confecciona muchas potras prendas de vestir  como por ejemplo medias para bebes el material para las medias lo hace de la sobra de los almohadones, con el dinero del crédito comprara una maquina pequeña de coser para la confección de almohadones  ella vende por la zona  y también vende  los almohadones en los mercados de la ciudad de La Paz y por la feria 16 de julio de la ciudad de el Alto, La Sra. Irene es casada pero su esposo viaja  constantemente por su trabajo ya que es chofer de flotas interdepartamentales, la Sra. Irene es una persona muy trabajadora se siente muy feliz por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Ms. Irene has her workshop in her own home. She devotes herself to manufacturing all types and styles of pillows and cushions in quantity, and she also manufactures many other articles of clothing such as baby socks, which she makes out of the leftover material from the cushions. With the money from the loan she will purchase a small sewing machine for making the cushions. She sells them in her area and also in the markets of the city of La Paz and at the 16 de julio festival in the city of El Alto. 

Ms. Irene is married but her husband travels constantly for his work since he is a fleet driver on inter-departmental [long-distance] runs. Ms. Irene is a very hardworking person. She is very happy about the opportunity she is being provided.

loans.use: to purchase a small machine for making pillows.

loans.name: Rolyn

texts.en:
Rolyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rolyn is 40 years old and all three children are attend in school.

Rolyn has an avon dealership business in the Philippines. Rolyn requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more personal care products to sell.

Rolyn has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Rolyn would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more personal care products to sell.

loans.name: Florentino

texts.en:
Florentino is a poultry distributor in Guayaquil, Ecuador. He travles to the rural sectors in the country in order to buy the chickens he will later to sell in the city. He sells to many of the people who own stands in the large markets in the city. He also sells to many people who own the very small stores common in this sector. He wants the loan in order to buy dairy products that he can also begin to distribute. Florentino has 2 children who are in school. His business is the only source of income in his old.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: He wants the loan in order to buy dairy products that he can also begin to distribute.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Gladys Wangari Maina intends to buy good quality maize and bean seeds for planting.

loans.name: Anselma Concepción

texts.en:
Honesty and responsibility are two of Anselma's qualities. She's married, has a 15-year-old daughter, and two sons who are 18 and 23. To help her husband with the home's expenses, three years ago, Anselma decided to start her own business with selling clothes. She has the help of her three children with this, and fortunately, it has gone very well and she has seen her business prosper.

Now, Anselma would like to offer good service to her customers and for this, she needs a credit of $275, which she will use to purchase merchandise to be able to have more product variety. She promises to return this amount in a period of 4 to 8 months. Contribute to the growth of this business and be an important part of this family. They will thank you.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Honestidad y responsabilidad son dos de las cualidades que posee Anselma, ella es casada, tiene una hija de 15 años de edad y dos hijos de 18 y 23 años. Para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos de su hogar, desde hace tres años Anselma decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de ropa, en el que recibe la ayuda de sus tres hijos, afortunadamente le ha ido muy bien y ha visto prosperar su negocio.

Ahora, Anselma desea ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes y para esto necesita un crédito por $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder tener más variedad de productos, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 4 a 8 meses. Contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio y se parte importante de esta familia, ellos te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her second-hand clothes business

loans.name: Pascoa Joao

texts.pt:
Pascoa is married and mother of 5 children. She helps with the household income. Her husband is a works at a shoe repair shop and does not earn a lot. She wants to make sure her children attend school, get medical attention and eat a balanced nutrition. She joined the program in the beginning of this year. Her first loan was of 125$. Now she is requesting a loan of 225$ to buy more inventory for her business and save.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga Kiva Volunteer.

Pascoa e casada e mae de 5 filhos. Ela faz o negocio para poder comparticipar nas despesas da casa. pois o marido nao recebe muito dinheiro, pois que e sapateiro e os 5 filhos precisarem de estudar, ter uma boa alimentacao, ter assistencia medica. Ela entrou para o Programa de Credito do Fundo de desenvolvimento da Mulher no inicio deste ano. na altura ela tomou um emprestimo de valor igual a $125. Ela agora pretende tomar $225 para poder incrementar o seu pequeno negocio que e feito no quintal de sua residencia e assegurar uma boa poupanca para os momentos mais criticos de sua vida em termos financeiros.

loans.use: Increase Inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in more products such as holiday gifts

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosita, as she is fondly known to her friends and customers, decided approximately a year ago to open her small grocery store in her house, which she built with much effort and sacrifice and with the help of her husband Valentín, who is a primary school techer in a humble little school in his birthtown of Macarí. At first, this small business did not meet the family expenses, but as stock and variety within the store increased, her little shop became too small to meet the needs of her many customers. This is why this determined mother of two wants to increase her business in order to provide convenience and ease for her customers. Rosita eagerly awaits your selfless support.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva Translator

Doña Rosita, como cariñosamente la suelen llamar sus amigos y clientes, hace aproximadamente un año decidió abrir su bodeguita en casa, la cual a costa de mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio construyó con ayuda de su esposo, Valentín, quien es profesor de educación primaria en una humilde escuelita de su pueblo natal, Macarí.En un principio, este pequeño negocio no le permitía solventar los gastos familiares, pero conforme aumentaba el stock y la variedad de mercadería su reducida tiendita fue quedando muy pequeña para atender a su concurrida clientela, es por esa razón que esta voluntariosa madre de dos niños desea ampliar su local para brindarles comodidad y bienestar a sus clientes.Rosita espera ansiosa por tu apoyo desinteresado.

loans.use: Expansion of a small grocery store

loans.name: Kawala 1 C(Ii) Group

texts.en:
Sharon is 37 years old and married with four children. She has a house with four rental rooms. She also sells firewood to supplement her income. With the extra business profits, she intends to buy a piece of land to and build more rental houses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more iron sheets and cement to expand her housing rental business

loans.name: Marcusa

texts.es:
Señora Marcusa, together with her 5 young children, suffered a lot of physical abuse at the hands of her husband and father of her children. Fortunately, things have changed for the best since she decided to separate from her husband to gain back tranquility in her life. Since then, she has dedicated herself to her farm work and to her livestock. She harvests the land mainly to feed her family, and she takes care of her livestock for the main purpose to sell them at a profit. This hard-working single mother gets a lot of support from her eldest, who has decided to work in the mine to help her mother and his younger siblings. Marcusa wishes to obtain a loan to purchase a yearling calf. Your good heart will make Señora Marcusa's dream come true.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Marcusa, junto a sus cinco menores hijos sufrieron durante muchos años constantes maltratos físicos de parte de su esposo y padre, afortunadamente las cosas han cambiado y mejorado gracias a que ella decidió separarse y recobrar su tranquilidad. Desde entonces se dedica con mucha más perseverancia a sus labores agrícolas y ganaderas.Las cosechas que realiza doña Marcusa muy hábilmente son para el autoconsumo de su familia, mientras que con la producción de ganado y venta de sus ovejitas ha ido mejorando su condición de vida.Esta luchadora madre recibe el apoyo de su amoroso hijo mayor, quien a decidido trabajar en la mina para ayudar a su madre y hermanos a salir adelante.El deseo de Marcusa es obtener un préstamo de dinero que tiene pensado invertir en la compra de una becerrita. Tu buen corazón permitirá cumplir los deseos de doña Marcusa.

loans.use: To purchase a yearling calf

loans.name: Namayemba Central D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Sarah N.. She is currently in the business of selling cattle and is requesting a loan to add more working capital. Sarah is 26 years old and is married. She has 3 children ranging from age 2 to 6 and most of her children go to school. Each week, Sarah makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a goat to rear.

Sarah is joined in her small group by Julliet A., Samina G., Apofia N., and Esther Nakiranda. Julliet A. has a business selling fish and wants to add to her business. Samina G. is currently operating a business selling fish and wants a loan to boost business. Apofia N. operates a drug shop business and wants to purchase more drugs. Esther Nakiranda is currently in the business of clothing sales and is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To expand cattle trading business

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline E. is 47 years old, married, and has 4 children. She hails from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells medicinal drugs and drinks. She has been a client of LAPO Microfinance for the past 2 years. Mrs. E. is requesting a loan of $600 so she can buy more medicinal drugs and drinks for her business.

loans.use: To buy more medicinal drugs and drinks for sale

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy I. is 35 years old and married with two children. She hails from the Oka area in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has a cold room for selling various types of fish. She has been in this business for the past four years. She needs a loan of $875 to buy more fish inventory. She thanks Kiva and her lenders.

loans.use: To buy more fish for sale

loans.name: Esse

texts.fr:
Mrs. Esse A. is 29 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She takes part in household costs for her children who attend school. To earn money and to pay school expenses for her children, she runs a grocery store in Adeta, a town located about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. She has a strong customer base because she has already benefitted from two loans and her repayments were on time. With this third loan from FECECAV, Esse would like to supply her shop by buying powdered milk, candy, rice, and various other products for retail. She appreciates this opportunity to improve her standard of living.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Madame Esse A. est âgée de 29 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle participe aux charges du foyer pour ses enfants à l’école. Pour gagner de l’argent et pouvoir payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants, elle opère un marché d’alimentation général à Adéta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise. Elle est une bonne cliente puisqu’elle a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits et les remboursements ont été réguliers. Avec son troisième crédit de FECECAV, Esse souhaite approvisionner sa boutique en achetant du lait en poudre, des bonbons, du riz et les autres produits variés pour la revente. Elle apprécie l’opportunité d’améliorer ses conditions de vie.

loans.use: Stock her shop

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia was born in the Moquegua section but, for work reasons, she decided to relocate to the city of Juliaca with her cherished children and her laborious husband. Currently, they rent a small apartment in the city. Lidia and her husband wish to offer their children peace of mind, comfort and above all a better quality of life. Everyday, after performing her duties as a mother, she leaves her home and sets about walking long hours to offer cosmetics to her friends and neighbors. Her warm treatment of her customers and her experience in the business, assure the sales of her products. Lidia’s desire is for capital to invest in acquiring products on sale so that she can have them in stock to be able to offer at a moments notice to her clients and not just through catalog orders. Lidia has deposited her hopes in your generous hearts.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Lidia nació en el departamento de Moquegua, por cuestiones de trabajo decidió radicar en la ciudad de Juliaca junto a sus queridos hijos y laborioso esposo. Actualmente, tienen un pequeño departamento alquilado en dicha ciudad, Lidia y su esposo desean ofrecer a sus hijos tranquilidad, comodidad y sobre todo una mejor calidad de vida. Cada día, luego de realizar su labor de madre abandona su hogar para emprender largas horas de caminata ofreciendo cosméticos a sus amistades y vecinos, que gracias a la calidez en su trato y experiencia en el negocio aseguran las ventas de sus productos. El deseo de Lidia es contar con mayor capital de inversión, dinero que le permitirá adquirir productos en oferta que tendría en stock para ofrecerlos en el momento a sus clientes y no sólo a pedido con los catálogos que utiliza. Lidia tiene depositada su esperanza en vuestros generosos corazones.

loans.use: Capital to purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Caridad Del Rocio

texts.es:
Mrs. Caridad del Rocio is married, is 35 years old, is an elementary school teacher, and has 2 sons, they are students at the primary and secondary school levels respectively. To help herself economically, apart from working in a kindergarten class, 8 years ago she began working in the development of educational materials. She also works on sashes for beauty queens and sells jewelry at her home in the District of San Pedro de Lloc, in Pacasmayo Province, in the Department of La Libertad.

The entrepreneur is a member of the "Libertad" Communal Bank; her mother is a founding partner of the bank and thanks her for her entry into the communal bank. Three years ago she began working with Manuela Ramos.

With the first loan of S/. 300.00 received, she invested in jewelry, thread, ribbons, and fabric. The amount of S/. 1500.00 that will be repaid within 6 months, will buy embroidery ribbon, zippers, buttons, thread, etc. In addition she will have enough money to purchase a computer for her children. She dreams of her children becoming professionals and to have a house of her own because she is currently living in her mother’s house.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Caridad del Rocío está casada, tiene 35 años, es profesora de educación inicial, tiene 02 hijos, son estudiantes del nivel primario y secundario respectivamente. Para ayudarse económicamente, a parte de trabajar en un jardín de niños dicta clases particulares y hace 8 años se dedica a la elaboración de material educativo así como también bandas para reinas y vende alhajas en su casa en el Distrito de San Pedro de Lloc en la Provincia de Pacasmayo en el Departamento de La Libertad. La empresaria pertenece al Banco Comunal “LIBERTAD”, su Mamá es socia fundadora de este banco y gracias ella ingreso al banco comunal. Hace tres años viene trabajando con Manuela Ramos. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 que recibió invirtió en joyas, hilos, cintas, tela. Con el crédito de S/. 1500.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 06 meses comprará bordados en cinta, cierres, botones, hilos etc. Y además completará para la compra de un computador para sus hijos. La socia sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener una casa propia porque actualmente está viviendo en la casa de su Mamá.

loans.use: Purchase ribbon, buttons, thread, etc.

location.town: San Pedro de Lloc - La Libertad

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in a lot of ingredients to produce food for her customers

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.ru: Кодиров Исмоил житель города Курган-Тюбе.Возраст 31 года,женат,имеет 1 ребенка.Образование среднее.Клиент имеет торговую точку на рынке.Торгует женской и мужской парфюмерией.Занимается торговлей  более 3 лет. На доход от торговли клиент содержит семью.В данный момент Исмоил  хочет увеличить ассортимент торговой точки.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Ismoil K. is a resident of Qurgan-Tube. He is 31 years old, is married and has 1 child. Ismoil has a high school education. He has a sales location at the market. He sells women’s and men’s perfume. He has been in this business for 3 years. Ismoil uses the profits from his business to support his family. At the moment, Ismoil would like to increase the product assortment at his sales location. He plans to pay back the loan over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase product assortment

loans.name: Srey Hong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey Hong M. is the group leader for five who all live in Srei Chey Village in Takeo Province. She has 0.5 hectare plot where she can cultivate rice. In this plantation, she now faces a small problem because her field is infertile which has a bad effect on her crop. To solve this problem, Mrs. Srey Hong M. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to amend her field to make it more productive.

Her husband, Mr. Uk Thon, is a laborer who can make US$ 2.50 per day which is very little to support the family. Mrs. Srey Hong M. is 45 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is working in a garment factory while the younger one is attending the local school.

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Three members have end-of-term loans and the other two have monthly payment loans. The former are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to make her field more productive.

loans.name: Adjoa Mawulawoè

texts.fr:
Madame K. Adjoa Mawulawoè est née le 15 aout 1960 à Tsevié, une ville située à 35 km de la ville de Lomé. Elle s’est mariée à un instituteur à la retraite et mère de cinq (5) enfants. Elle a pour activité la restauration et vente des boissons, commerce qu’elle a commencé depuis l’année 2003.  Son entreprise est situe dans le marché d’Agoè, au nord de Lomé, ou elle peut trouver beaucoup de clients.  Elle s’approvisionne à la Brasserie de Lomé.
Elle n’a jamais bénéficié d’un crédit et sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter toute sorte de boissons, des ignames, du riz, et des condiments pour la restauration. Avec ce crédit elle pourra bien vendre et aider son mari dans les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Adjoa Mawulawoè K. was born on August 15, 1960 in Tsevié, a city located 35 km from the city of Lomé. The mother of five children, she is married to a retired primary school teacher. Her work has been in catering and selling beverages, a business she started in 2003. Her enterprise is situated in the Agoè marketplace, north of Lomé, where there are many customers to be found. She gets her supplies at the Brasserie de Lomé. She has never been the recipient of a loan and is requesting this initial loan to buy all sorts of beverages and yams, rice, and condiments for catering. With this loan, she will be able to do well selling and helping her husband with family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beverages and tubers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more vegetable and fruits

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria O. is 25 years old and married with a child. She sells second-hand books and she hopes to own a bookshop in future. She needs the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more second-hand books to sell. She hopes to expand her business. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand books to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. sells clothes. She loves this business and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. Elizabeth is 45 years old and married with 4 children. She says, "Thanks to all that made this loan possible."

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Dourng

texts.en: E. is 60 years old and a resident of SiE. Reap Province. She has six children: five of thE. are married and live separately, and the other one owns a small grocery store and lives with her. E. is a widow, and she has been a primary school teacher since 1990. She is a struggling mother and a responsible neighbor. She lives in a small house with a small kitchen. Because her house is located near a resort place, E. wants to increase her daughter's business. So E. is looking for a loan of $400 to buy more cooked ingredients for her daughter's business. The loan will help the family have a better standard of living. This is a picture of E. and her daughter.

loans.use: To buy more cooked ingredients

loans.name: Eseohe

texts.en: Eseohe is 28 years old and married without a child. She sells provisions and drinks. She needs the loan amount of N30,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions to sell

loans.name: Abigail M.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Abigail N. from Mbeya. She is married with 2 children, aged 7 and 10. Abigail has been running a "duka" business since 2007. She owns a small "duka" or neighborhood shop in the city where she sells common household and grocery items.

She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Abigail currently earns about 250 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 600 USD in order to purchase items in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to diversify her business. Abigail thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase items in bulk for her business

loans.name: Kossiwa Ameniuade

texts.fr: Cette femme est une résidente du quartier d’adidogomé, elle est mariée et a 01 enfant. Son mari est un maçon. Afin d’aider son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses de la famille elle a commencé en 2004 le commerce de pagnes, elle le fait de façon ambulante. Elle veut agrandir ce commerce, pour cela elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 20 pièces de pagnes de qualité « hitarget ».
texts.en:
This woman is a resident in the Adidogomé district. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a bricklayer. In order to help her husband in taking care of the family's expenses, she began selling pagnes (a type of brightly-coloured West African cloth) in 2004. She wants to enlarge her business, and for this reason she is seeking (through WAGES) her first loan to buy 20 sets of "hitarget" quality pagnes.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell pagnes (a type of West African cloth)

loans.name: Edgorali

texts.ru: Занджиров Едгорали житель города Яван.Возраст 38 лет, женат и имеет одного ребенка. Работает разнорабочим по найму. Кроме того занимается купле продажей мелко рогатого скота. Планирует получить кредит , чтобы закупить овец и коз. На полученные доходы планирует сделать ремонт в своем доме.
texts.en:
Edgorali Z. is a resident of the town of Yavan. He is 38 years old, married and has one child. He does odd jobs on demand. Besides this type of work he also buys and resells small cattle. He plans to use the loan to buy sheep and goats. He plans to use the profit to make repairs in his home.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy small cattle

loans.name: Chris

texts.en: Chris L. is thirty-five years old. He is married and has two children, a boy and a girl who are both currently in the primary school. Chris lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a town in Ghana called Suhum. Suhum is a busy business centre in the Eastern Region. His wife trades to help him financially. He runs a provision store by the road side in his community. Chris procures groceries such as tins of milk and Milo, bags of sugar, candies, soap, etc. from big supermarkets in the surrounding towns and also from vans that come round to distribute. He has been in business for fifteen years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to increase his stock.

loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is married and lives with her husband in a small apartment. She enjoys helping her children even though they now live separately.

Galina sells women's clothing at the central market in Kherson city. Her gross income is 7,000 UAH per month. She has been in this business for thirteen years and enjoys this particular type of goods. She is a very disciplined and orderly person. She can listen to people well as well as persuade them well. These qualities help Galina in her sales business as well as in life.

Galina would like to borrow 12,700 UAH to increase her assortment. She hopes to receive additional income and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To increase her assortment

loans.name: Abdul Saboar Group

texts.en: A. Saboar is the group leader of A. Saboar group. There are three members in this group. They all want to expand their businesses and do well. A. Saboar wants to take a loan for his business: a fruit and vegetables cart. Zalilka wants to take a loan for her husband who has a general store. Leela wants to take a loan for her husband who has a metal working shop. So they are requesting a group loan of 27000 Afghani. They are very grateful for AFS and Kiva lenders that can support all poor people.

loans.use: For  business progress

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is a 30-year-old father of one child.  He runs a kiosk in the Mukuru slums of Nairobi. Before opening his business, Jacob worked as a supervisor on a flower farm. He has requested a loan of 20,000 KES in order to purchase additional stock of flour, sugar, and cooking fat. He hopes to grow his business and continue taking out larger loans. Jacob hopes to one day build a home and educate his family. He describes himself as a diligent businessman.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Buy more stock of flour, sugar, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Teresa es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres progresivas”, ubicado en la el distrito D. Asillo, provincia D. Azangaro, en el departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 53 años D. edad, está casada y es madre D. 03 hijos, ella estudió educación primaria completa, vive en el sector meseta baja.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 6 meses, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para adquirir ganado menor (ovinos).

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional D. S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, con este monto ella comprará ganado menor (ovinos) para engorD..

Su deseo es comprarse un carro.  
A ella le gustan los ahorros y las charlas D. capacitación.
texts.en:
Sra. Teresa is a member of the community bank “Mujeres progresivas” (Progressive Women), located in the district of Asillo, province of Azangaro, in the department of Puno. She is 53 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children. She finished her primary school education, and she lives in the lower plateau area (Meseta Baja). She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 6 months. Her first loan was for 500 soles, which served as capital to purchase small livestock (sheep). Currently, she is requesting an additional loan of 1,000 soles, with which she will purchase small livestock (sheep) to fatten. Her wish is to buy herself a car. She enjoys saving and the training talks.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep to fatten

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Mrs. Imelda P. is the loving housewife of Mr. Darwin P.. They live harmoniously in a rural community of Brgy. Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. Due to the hardships and difficulties of life, they are striving hard to earn a living for their survival and to give their child a better future.
	Imelda is engaged in selling vegetables at Brgy. Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. With her small capital, she acquires her products from Nueva Vizcaya Agricultural Termina (NVAT), which she sells in Barangay.  As a fruit of her efforts and sacrifices, she is able to earn a net income of PHP 500 per day which she adds to her husband’s income to satisfy their daily basic needs, and to support the education of their child. She aims to strengthen her business, but she does not have adequate capital. When her neighbor informed her of the programs and services of the Microfinance organization, she voluntarily joined to borrow additional business capital. She is requesting to avail a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 as additional capital to acquire more fruits and vegetables to sell. She is so thankful in joining the organization because it helps her to improve their status of living.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza tiene 35 años, es una mujer que muestra gran optimismo por realizar nuevas actividades. Vive en su casa propia y sus más ansiados deseos están basados en el bienestar de su familia conformada por su pareja y su hijo de tan sólo cinco años. Se dedica a recolectar gran cantidad de piedras de diversos colores y formas, para luego enviarlas a Argentina donde vive su hermana, quien se encarga de convertir las piedras en preciosas joyas. Para esta labor, Maritza se contacta con diversas personas de otras ciudades, sobre todo de la selva del país, donde se encuentran las más extraordinarias colecciones. Este negocio lo viene realizando hace 5 años y lo que más le gusta es relacionarse con personas de otras ciudades, quienes comparten su pasión por la colección de piedras de exportación. Pero considera que lo difícil es trasladar la mercadería a la capital, pues son muy costosas y pesadas, por lo cual requiere el apoyo de su pareja en algunas ocasiones. Para el futuro, Maritza anhela viajar a otros países y contactarse con empresarios dedicados a la producción de joyería.
Este es su catorceavo préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, donde siempre ha mostrado compromiso con su banco comunal, donde destaca por su entusiasmo. Con los mil doscientos soles solicitados planea comprar la mercadería que tiene pendiente por entregar, para así no interrumpir el habitual proceso de su negocio.
texts.en:
Maritza is 35 years old and is a woman that shows great optimism for carrying out new activities. She lives in her own house and her greatest desires are based on the well-being of her family, which consists of her partner and her son who is only five years old. She makes a living by gathering a large quantity of stones of diverse colors and shapes, to later send them to her sister, who lives in Argentina and is in charge of converting the stones into precious jewels. For this task, Maritza is in contact with various people from other cities, above all from the country's jungle, where the most extraordinary collections are found. She has been doing this business for 5 years and the thing that she likes most is being connected to people from other cities, who share her passion for collecting stones for exportation. However, she considers the most difficult part transferring the merchandise to the capital, because they are very expensive and heavy, and therefore requires the support of her partner on some occasions. In the future, Maritza hopes to travel to other countries and make contacts with entrepreneurs who work in the production of jewelry. This is Maritza's fourteenth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA, where she has always shown commitment to her communal bank and stands out for her enthusiasm. With the requested 1,200 soles, she plans to purchase the pending merchandise that has yet to be delivered, in order to not interrupt the habitual process of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise.

loans.name: Channy

texts.en: Mrs. Channy M., 39, has been selling boiled corn for a year. She and her husband, Mr. Srun Sun, 41, were married in 1985 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. Channy’s children commute to school a far ways from home. They have to spend a lot of money for traveling costs which is expensive for the family. Hence, Channy is applying for her first loan of US $800 to purchase a motorbike for her children to drive to school. Her eldest son has a full-time job, one child is a musician and the other two attend school. Channy's husband has been a sewing machine repairman for 10 years. They live in a small village off of National Road No. 2 about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her children to drive to school

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: The purchase and resale of school supplies

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: This is Susan H., 43 years old. She has been making processed meats like sausages and hams in the comfort of her home for the last three years. She lives in Ascoville, Caloocan City with her husband, Robert, 60, and their only child. Susan’s products appeal to a lot to her customers so that she always finds herself working overtime to meet their demands. She is thankful to the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative for providing her loans which she has used to buy raw materials like fresh meat and seasonings. She now earns at least P6,000 a month, aside from her additional income being a tutor in the neighborhood. She has a teacher’s education back in college. Susan uses her profits to support the daily needs of her family. She applied for a fresh loan from CCT in the amount of P8,000 as additional capital for her business. She also wishes to establish a restaurant soon. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Edilberto Primitivo

texts.es: El Sr. Edilberto S. tiene 44 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su esposa, no tiene hijos menores, sus hijos laboran en fundos de la zona de Santiago. Labora desde hace 10 años como maestro panificador percibiendo ingresos semanales sin boletas de pago, su esposa labora como obrera de campo en la empresa Corporación Agrícola del Sur. Adicionalmente se dedican a la crianza de cerdos en su propio domicilio. Fueron afectados por el terremoto del año 2007 por lo cual con mucho esfuerzo han logrado reconstruir su casa con material de caña y adobe. Su sueño es poder llegar a construir su casa totalmente. Solicitan crédito para continuar con construcción progresiva de su casa. Ambos agradecen el apoyo que les podamos brindar para lograr la reconstrucción de su casa.
texts.en:
Mr. Edilberto S. is 44 years old and lives in his own house together with his wife. His children are adults and work on large farms in the zone of Santiago. He has worked for 10 years as a master planner, receiving weekly income without pay stubs. His wife is a farmworker for the company Corporacion Agricola del Sur. Additionally, they raise pigs in their own home. They were affected by the earthquake in 2007, and with a lot of effort they managed to rebuild their house with cane and adobe. Their dream is to be able to completely build their house. They are requesting this credit to continue with the progressive construction of their house. Both of them are grateful for the support that we can provide them to achieve this goal.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Reconstruction of their home

loans.name: Adejuju

texts.en:
O. sells medicines and groceries at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to own a maternity home in future. She is 31 years old and married with two children. They live in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. She is a focused hard worker. She has been in her business for seven years. O. is requesting a loan of 60,000 nairas to purchase more medicines and groceries to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

O. is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines and groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase and sale of "pagnes"

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion 1 2 Group

texts.en:
Edlina is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres en Accion (Women in Action), and her story is representative of her group's members and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients in general, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a northern port town which is economically-focused on tourism. In Puerto Plata, running water (which is not potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure, and she lives with her long-term partner and their child.

Edlina is excited to be seeking her third loan through Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. To earn a living, she sells clothing and food; more specifically, she purchases pants, polo shirts, sheets, curtains, rice, sugar, flour, oil, and cups, and she either sells these goods (in the case of the clothes) or cooks with them (in the case of the food, which she later sells). She will use the profits generated as a result of the loan to invest in her home and her family. In particular, she would like to purchase chairs for her home and a backpack, shoes, and clothes for her child. Her long-term goal is to save enough money so that she can send some money home to Haiti to finish building her home. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional goods and food supplies

loans.name: Andre

texts.en:
Andre is 27 years old and is married with one child a year-and-a-half old. Andre and his family live in Rulindo, in the Northern Province of Rwanda. It is approximately two hours drive from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Andre has been running his business of selling foodstuffs since 2008 and the hours of her business are from early in the morning until evening hours everyday.

Andre, after realizing that the number of his customers keeps growing and that he is not able to satisfy their demand with his existing capital, decided he needs to request a Kiva loan, which will help him to cover all the needs of his customers.

Through using this loan, Andre hopefully will earn more profits which, in turn will be used to reinvest in his business as well as saving for the future of his business so that one day he will find himself financially stable.

loans.use: To buy additional foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Da

texts.en: Mrs. Da H., who is a villager in Thnuoh village in Takeo province, is 37 years old. She is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare parcel of land to grow crops for supporting her family, and her husband, Mr. Ngous Sek, is a construction laborer, and on the side he is a fisherman also. In the rice field, this family has a problem because it was time to plow, but they did not have enough oxen to plow. Thus, in order to improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Da H. decided to ask for a loan to buy an ox for plowing the field. She is a mother of four children, three of whom are enrolled in local public school, while the other is employed in the garment factory. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy an ox for plowing the field

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This borrower runs a machine shop. He is 27 years old and married, and he completed the primary level of education. He wants this loan to buy tools for his shop, such as a lathe, and the other necessities. He wants to hire an employee to help him in his shop. He has been working in this field for almost seven years.
